Summary: My wife and I stayed four nights in February. This was a trip celebrating our 40th anniversary. We were looking to get out of the cold Utah winter and find a warm, romantic spot. For background, we have stayed in some cheap places and some expensive places in many countries over 40 years. As others have said, this can be a somewhat expensive stay (for us), and my only concern in making the reservation was whether it would live up to my expectations.  And it did.  I judge success by my wife’s reaction and she loved it. As full disclosure, we booked the luxury tower suite, Room 301, so not all of the rooms would have the same location or layout. I should also mention that many locals told us that this had been the best weather of the winter – highs in the 70’s and no clouds – and
Manager Response: Wow! Thank you so much for sharing your feedback and we are thrilled you enjoyed your stay. We are always very honored when guests choose to celebrate their special occasions with us and make cherished memories. Thank you again and we hope we have the pleasure of seeing you both again in the future.

Summary Heading: Delightful Stay at Blue Lantern Inn Dana Point
Summary: I LOVED the hotel and my room AND my view. It is small; personal and charming but the room was large and well -equipped. The staff could not have been more accommodating. Breakfast and the afternoon wine and cheese (and wonderful cookies) were also highlights. The hotel is on a hill overlooking the yacht basin and Pacific Ocean and the view is wonderful.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing such a wonderful review and for your kind comments! We are thrilled that you enjoyed our location, guest service and amenities. We strive to offer our guests unparalleled value so were so happy to read that you enjoyed our complimentary breakfast and afternoon wine and cheese board - our decadent cookies are not to be missed either! We hope we have the pleasure of welcoming you back and wish you happy future travels.

Summary: First, we will be back. This is a well run, beautiful B and B and one of the most picturesque spots in the world.  This getaway is as good as its location. Easy to use on line booking. Had to make a change and called. Dana immediately helped us make the change in reservation. The food and drinks were tasty and satisfying. Room was great and we didn’t have a view! A fireplace, big bathroom and comfortable bed.  The front desk team gave us dinner and hiking recommendations that were perfect.  Our experience was wonderful. It was a little over our budget. There was tremendous value and we highly recommend a long stay.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for sharing such a wonderful review following your stay with us! We are delighted that we were able to provide you with such an enjoyable experience and your feedback regarding staff and services provided will be shared and celebrated amongst the team. We hope we have the pleasure of welcoming you back in the future.

Summary: This property is just awesome!  We went with 2 other couples and had THE best time.  The staff is so nice and the morning breakfast is wonderful, I mean REALLY good.  We received all kinds of tips on restaurants and places to go, plus used the "library" room to watch football on NYE so we could all be together.  We will definitely come back to the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback and kind comments with your fellow travelers! The whole team is pleased to see that their effort did not go unnoticed as we continue in our mission to create little moments of magic and unforgettable memories. We are thrilled that you are planning and return visit and look forward to welcoming you back!

Summary: Excellent service, breakfast and happy hour.  If you get a balcony you are looking at a forever ocean and it is fun to watch the activity in the harbor.  We spent Christmas at the Inn. Our room was comfortable and cozy.  We enjoyed sitting by the fireplace by the tree with a glass of wine. There is a walkway not far away you can take down  to the harbor and walk around there.  We had a delicious dinner at the Coastal Kitchen which is just a block away. Easy walk.  We have been here before and wish we had not waited so long to return.
Room tip: Get a balcony room if you can.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share such a lovely review following your recent stay with us at Blue Lantern Inn. We were all delighted to read how much you enjoyed our cozy accommodations and beautiful location overlooking the ocean. We hope that we will have the pleasure of welcoming you again should your travels bring you back to Dana Point.

Summary Heading: Amazing View, Great Service, Highly Recommended
Summary: My wife and I stayed for two days in December.  The views from the Tower patio guest rooms are amazing. The parking is convenient and the location in Dana Point is great.  The service is also outstanding. Highly recommended hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing such a lovely review and for your kind comments regarding the views, amenities and guest service offered! We are thrilled that you enjoyed your visit and found everything to your liking and hope we have the pleasure of welcoming you back. Wishing you wonderful future travels!

Summary Heading: Hotel on the cliff of coast line! 5 minutes to Dana Point Harbor
Summary: Except for the wild flowers and grass grown on the cliff, there is nothing between you and the ocean. It is real coast line Hotel! I have not seen any other place like here to have so kind and warm staff. Though I travel all the time but this is the first time I write only because Blue Lantern FS is so wonderful! They don't have the register page for child but they actually so friendly to child, the only thing I did is to write down my request before my heck-in and they even tell me there is a sofa bed in gust room ready for child. I checked in about 2 pm which is two hours before set time . But I received a warm welcome with fruit tea and assigned room service for my room to make it ready in 10 minutes.  So warmly right? 5minutes to Dana Point Harbor using cliff road.
Room tip: Find a room with view of ocean! They have dtailed description on room types
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us such an amazing review, we loved reading it! We always strive to offer our guests the absolute best experience and it is a pleasure to read that our efforts are rewarded as such. We are blessed to be located in such a beautiful location and feel so fortunate that we can share this with our guests. Thank you again and we very much hope we can welcome you back to enjoy another stay with us.

Summary: We’ve been to a number of fancy hotels, but being on the bay at Dana Point is something else. I’m really sad we’re only here for 20 hours.   PROS: the location is prime; the facility is perfect for the area; our room was clean & beautifully appointed; having a  private balcony with a view & a fireplace in our room was luxurious; the breakfast was as good as you would get in a restaurant; and the service overall was great.   CONS: our shower drain was slow.   BOTTOM LINE: this is a real splurge in terms of cost. Sometimes, however, a splurge is necessary. This is our new favorite getaway.
Manager Response: Thank you for writing such a wonderful review on TripAdvisor following your recent visit with us at Blue Lantern Inn. We were all delighted to read that you enjoyed our location and amenities. We certainly noted your comment regarding the drain and thank you for bringing that to our attention. We strive to ensure your experience is perfect and, again, it was such a great pleasure to read your kind words. We look forward to welcoming you back soon - hopefully for longer!

Summary Heading: Best place to stay in Dana Point
Summary: This is a wonderful place to stay. We stayed here for our elopement nearby. The scenery of Dana Point Harbor is beautiful. The staff is friendly and welcoming. The breakfast is delicious and homemade, unlike the hotel chains. This is a charming and delightful inn.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing such a wonderful review following your recent stay and we were so pleased to read that we exceeded your expectations! We are always so honored when guests choose to celebrate such special occasions with us and make lasting memories. Our team strives to ensure we deliver the best experience so thank you again for your kind comments. We hope we have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future and wish you a lifetime of happiness.

Summary: A very nice place to stay in dana point. Great staff, clean and great location. Breakfast was fantastic. ( hot entree excellent and varied each day). You can walk to dana point harbor( about a mile away).
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking the time to share your feedback with us & your fellow online community. We are all so happy and to read that you had such a positive experience, and enjoyed our complimentary breakfast offerings. We truly hope we will have the pleasure of welcoming you back soon for another memorable stay!

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for our mini honeymoon in July 2020. The location is beautiful and perfect for walking around the lantern district and the marina. The room was absolutely gorgeous and we loved the snacks and wine that were provided. We used the bicycles that were offered to guests and parking was easy and convenient. The patio overlooking the ocean and marina was fabulous! Even though the regular breakfast buffet was not in operation due to covid restrictions, the chef made breakfast which was delivered to our room. We are looking forward to visiting again! This was one of our favorite trips out of many to southern California.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback and kind comments with your fellow travelers! The whole team is pleased to see that their effort did not go unnoticed as we continue in our mission to create little moments of magic and unforgettable memories for every one of our guests. We were so pleased to read that you enjoyed our complimentary bikes to explore our beautiful location and hope we have the pleasure of welcoming you back in the future!

Summary: This is where we stay every time we come to visit Dana Point. The rooms have wonderful views, are beautiful and the service is excellent. Breakfast is delicious always with a great variety of fruits, eggs and breads. Also love the afternoon wine and snacks. The location is perfect for walking to restaurants and down to the wharf and they also have free bicycles you can take out for a quick ride on the lovely and quiet streets. We don't like to stay anywhere else while we're visiting our family in Dana Point and we will definitely be back.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share such a glowing review following your recent stay with us at Blue Lantern Inn. We are always honored when guests choose to return to visit with us and strive to ensure we offer exemplary service and comfort on every occasion. We were delighted to read that you truly enjoyed your time with us at the inn, the amenities offered and look forward to welcoming you back in the years ahead.

Summary: Feels like a B&B with good service (champagne brought to the room within minutes of ordering), nice happy hour hour & full breakfast included, with stunning views from the balcony! of our corner room (which could use some updating but was clean & well-equipped).
Manager Response: On behalf of the entire team here at Blue Lantern Inn, thank you ever so much for sharing this wonderful review, following your recent stay with us. We were all thrilled to read that we exceeded your expectations -  champagne on your balcony overlooking the ocean cannot be beat! We hope we can welcome you back in the future to enjoy another memorable stay.

Summary: The Inn is spectacular. We were a little dissappointed that our room wasn't ready on time but sometimes things happen. The room was one of the nicest rooms that I have ever stayed in. This property is a tad expensive and I was glad the room was extraordinary.
Manager Response: On behalf all of us at Blue Lantern Inn, thank you ever so much for sharing this lovely review. We were all delighted to read how much you enjoyed your guestroom but apologize for the timing of check-in. We strive to ensure a smooth and relaxing experience for each of our guests and can assure you this is an atypical occurrence. We hope to have the opportunity to offer you unparalleled service, should you choose to visit with us again in the future.

Summary: This hotel has great views of the harbor with cozy, yet spacious rooms.  The staff were very friendly and continually offered assistance.  The breakfast and happy hours were also a nice touch.  There are also some delicious restaurants in the area that are walkable.

My husband and I stayed here in early March, and we were so thrilled. We travel often and this was by far one of the best places we have every stayed. The staff is wonderful, rooms are great, views are awesome, and the afternoon wine and cheese is an extra added touch.   If you are in Dana Point, look no further and stay here.

We vistited the in the week between Christmas and New Year's Eve. The Inn was busy but not too full and the service, accommodations and food we all excellent. The location at the top of the hill overlook Dana Point Harbor is stunning even with a rain storm that blew in the first morning we were there. The weather made for an enjoyable fireplace and balcony experience. We will definitely return.

From the moment you enter the hotel a feeling of tranquility engulfs you. Turning from the lobby checkin your eyes take in the fire in the fireplace with the Queen Anne sitting chairs. Turning to take the elevator your gaze lingers on the magnificent view of the Dana Point harbor and marina with the Pacific Ocean to the horizon. The facility is clean and spacious as are the rooms. The decor fives a feeling of being comfort, and the bed is like sleeping on a cloud. Cradling your body in comfort. The staff from the lobby to the housekeeping are exceptional. I will stay if I were to have reason to come to the Dana Point area in the future. I highly recommend this Inn.

Overall we had an enjoyable stay at Blue Lantern but it wasn’t perfect.   Before arrival we’d tried to get in touch with the hotel several times over several weeks to amend our booking… no response whatsoever. We’re in the UK so we’re trying to avoid phoning. In the end we had to phone the hotel.   We stayed two nights in a queen room with balcony, which are positioned on the side of the property (really the front if the hotel).   The hotel is nice and very clean. Friendly welcome but no assistance offered with luggage (other small hotels help despite Covid)   Breakfast was a bit hit and miss.   We’d notified the hotel of food intolerances when booking.   Savouries and fruit plus muffin all come in one plate! I’d prefer eggs not to be mixed with the fruit. Not everything arrived

Summary Heading: Phenomenal Stay -- wonderful views; serene and peaceful
Summary: I love Four Sisters Inns and the Blue Lantern Inn was no exception.  They have exceptional customer service -- everything is easy and pleasant and hospitable.  The staff are always looking for ways to help and the accommodations are absolutely lovely.  We had a water view and balcony so both sunrise and sunset were amazing.  Breakfast was delicious and generous, and they accommodated our request for just eggs and cheese -- not a big fan of peppers etc. in eggs in the morning.  Wine and cheese were also fantastic in the afternoon.  Parking was easy.  Beds were comfortable and we loved our fireplace.  It could not have been better -- worth every penny.

We spent 4 nights at the Inn and were thoroughly pleased with our experience.  First, location is great with an easy walk to the Lantern Restaurant District in Dana Point.  The marina is also accessible with a longer walk or a short drive.  The views of the harbor and sunrise from the hotel are beautiful.  Service at the hotel was friendly and responsive.  You can text (or call) any requests for service.  The hotel features a “wine and cheese” activity in the afternoon.  Each room can get a very nice cheese tray from the front desk, and then there are carafes of red and white wines to self serve.  You can sit on the patio, in the dining area, or take to your room.  The lobby had coffee and flavored waters available throughout the day.  Breakfast each day was a choice of a hot

Summary Heading: A cross between a B&B and a small hotel
Summary: This 3-floor beauty sits high on top of a point with a city Gazebo just outside the Inn.  The Gazebo is cordoned off due to the unsafe condition of the eroding steep cliff upon which it sits.  In time past, that was a near ideal spot to view the Harbor and Marina below.  Of course, there are views from the property, too.  Breakfast and a late afternoon no-host wine "social" are included in the room cost. On average, the chef's pre-selected breakfasts were heavy on bell peppers.  People with special requests did manage to get their eggs prepared the way they wanted them, however.    Of the 4 days we were there, 3 of the breakfasts included bell peppers in the egg dishes and they also included onions, tomatoes, etc. almost every day except the last when fried eggs were served.

My family and I stayed here during the week of Christmas. We stayed 5 nights and had several room changes due to the unavailability. But the process went smoothly for us and we really enjoyed getting to see each of the different rooms. (304 & 104) Our favorite was room was 101 the tower guest room it’s on the bottom floor which makes it a lot easier for us when you check out and check in.  Breakfast was delightful and they even served made my son was very well accommodated - he’s 5 btw.   We’ve been coming here since he was 2.5 and this last time- we didn’t have one thing to complain about.   Maria and Deysi were the best. My husband and I couldn’t agree more that they really did a great job making sure you were taken care.   We will see you again Blue Lantern inn.

If you want to getaway for a weekend of romance or fun - the Blue Lantern is a great choice.  Beautiful views from the terrace overlooking the Dana Point Marina/bay with an enjoyable wine and cheese/fruit tray and breakfast included.

We stayed here as well as several of our family members due to a family anniversary party down the street. And this was the best choice we could have ever made! Not only are the rooms and views awesome, the staff is so friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay so much that we can not wait to stay again! Highly recommend this hotel!!

Summary Heading: An amazing Inn, staff, and location!
Summary: The Inn is just beautiful - the room is so spacious and well-appointed. The views are spectacular and there is so much to do within walking or biking distance. The Staff was wonderful. Well-worth the cost (which we found to be reasonable given much higher rates at the time of our stay of other properties in the area).

Summary Heading: Beautiful Inn Overlooking Dana Point Harbor
Summary: This comfortable, friendly, and well-managed inn was the perfect spot for a ten-day visit to see family and enjoy the environs of Dana Point.  From sumptuous breakfasts to afternoon wine and cheese, the Blue Lantern Inn offers a high level of amenities coupled with friendly and helpful staff.

Summary Heading: A little gem on the cliffs.
Summary: The Blue Lantern Inn was a perfect spot for an evening's get-away. It is a wonderful little place perched on the cliffs above Dana Point harbor. The rooms are spotless with a great view of the harbor and the beds are very comfortable. I'm glad we upgraded to a room with a balcony. It's totally worth it.  Our only issue was with the noise of the air conditioning unit which was pretty loud when it kick on at night. The staff is excellent. They were welcoming and helpful.

Had heard about Dana Point a d needed to check it out. So glad we stayed at the Blue Lantern. Excellent location and staff and facilities! Slept like a baby! Right on top of a cliff overlooking the harbor! Keep up the good work Blue Lantern.

Summary Heading: Great view, location, amenities, comfort and staff.
Summary: All the accommodations and staff were wonderful. The location was great. We were able to park our car for two days and walk everywhere. The view from our room was spectacular. I especially loved being able to have access to tea and water all day and being given the cheese and cracker plate every evening. The communication was easy and responsive via text. Very quiet and relaxing in the common areas. We enjoyed our 18th wedding anniversary during our stay. It was the perfect spot. Thank you Blue Lantern Inn.

The Inn is absolutely beautiful with all the comforts of home located in a perfect location with an amazing view! The breakfast was awesome and the customer service was outstanding. We were scheduled to depart on the ferry to Catalina and could not get an uber to take us back to get our luggage. We called the inn and they had someone bring our luggage to us within 10 minutes. Above and beyond!!!! We'll definitely be back!

This small intimate hotel is situated perfectly overlooking the ocean.  It was a wonderful stay. The staff is friendly, the room clean, and the breakfast delicious.  You can sit on the patio and enjoy a glass of wine in the evening with a beautiful view.  Enjoy your lovely breakfast in the morning in the same spot!  We enjoyed it so much we are already planning a return. Wonderful hotel!

Summary Heading: Top notch inn with a 5 star experience at a third of the price  with amazing views
Summary: Top notch five star experience with great prices   I can’t imagine ever staying anywhere but the Blue Lantern.   Everything to bottom was perfect; the staff, the rooms, the free tasty breakfast, free parking and views.  Even if you don’t get an ocean facing room, there are plenty of spots to enjoy the spectacular   I was in town for a wedding in Laguna beach.  I did rent a car but was easily able to Uber to town and the wedding.  Didn’t want to put up with Laguna traffic or drinking / driving    But enjoyed the proximity to that gorgeous beach   Perfect stay

We loved it. Super quaint, friendly staff, easy check in, free parking, breakfast included. What more can you ask for. Short drive to beautiful beaches. My only complaint is the carpet in our room 212 was in need of stretching. Trip hazard. I would 100% stay here again and would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Summary Heading: Superb setting, location, and friendly staff for a tranquil get-away
Summary: Beautiful location in quiet residential neighborhood, atop a bluff overlooking Dana Point Harbor and Pacific Ocean with comfortable rooms, large two-room bathroom with two basins, spa tub, separate shower, fireplace, plenty of amenities, excellent daily changing chef-prepared breakfasts, afternoon snacks and wine, all-day beverages. Friendly, attentive, and responsive staff, especially Cathi S., who strive to meet individual needs.

Clean, spacious rooms, quiet, complimentary happy hour and Breakfast . Lovely location. Very friendly and professional staff. Other guests were friendly and respectful. We stayed only one night and wish we could be here longer. Will stay here again!

Summary Heading: Perfect place for a couples getaway. Book now.
Summary: Please book this place right now. We’ve stayed here twice now and we absolutely love it!  We stayed here for a birthday weekend away from our kids. The views are amazing. Staff makes you feel special and welcome. The rooms are comfortable. The tub is huge!  It is a perfect spot for a couples getaway.  I want to go back.

Summary Heading: Great view of Dana Point Harbor
Summary: This is a quaint Inn in Dana Point. On a cliff overlooking the Harbor. Simply beautiful. The Inn is very nice.  Our room was  Roomy and had a nice partial view of the harbor. You get cheese and wine in the afternoon and a hot breakfast in the morning! The staff was great.  A very clean facility. About 7 minutes from the harbor. Definitely will be going back.

The Four Sisters Inns always are delightful, relaxing, clean accommodations, and The Blue Lantern Inn is one of our favorites - it was our third stay. We enjoy the environment, the ambiance, and the location. The staff is consistently professional, pleasant, and efficient. Everything about our stay was memorable and fantastic😊

Summary Heading: My favorite hotel in So Cal
Summary: I had a great stay. The room and bathroom were really spacious. Loved the ocean view from the balcony. Location is great, right in the Lantern District, with all kinds of shops and restaurants. Best part, walking distance to the beach. Staff was great! Looking forward to coming back next year!

This is my second stay at this hotel. I love it and will be back. I am giving it a five rating because it is. Clean, quiet, lovely breakfast and happy hour, kind and helpful staff, amazing location, free safe parking. Our first stay we had no patio but a beautiful harbor view in a bay window. We decided to get a patio room next time but did not pick well. We had a limited view of the water and a great view of the parking lot. Also the bathroom was set up strange with stairs leading to the tub and shower. We will be back but will call for help with room selection. The online descriptions are not quite accurate. Otherwise I highly recommend and remains our #1 choice of accommodations in Dana Pt

Not only is this boutique hotel close to restaurants and things to do, the staff are friendly, the rooms are spectacular, and the views are amazing.  Best hotel find anywhere...this is my new favorite!

Stayed at the Blue Lantern Inn one night. Wanted to get away for the night but not drive too far. Picked this Inn because of the reviews, view and not being a hotel. I like that they offer a happy hour cheese and wine platter and breakfast. This was a plus. Overall I was pleased with the room. We had room 203 nice ocean view and some view of the harbor. On our way to the Inn, I received a text message they were excited to have us and drive safely, the room was ready early so they let us check in. Then 30 min later I received another text message, asking if I needed anything and hoping everything was going good. Nice touch. We wanted to walk down to the harbor, one of the staff members told us how to get there. Super easy walk through Heritage Park. We saw a wedding, gender

My "go to" place in So Calif.  Easy going, great breakfast, wine and cheese in the afternoon, comfortable beds, great views of the harbor.  Spend a little extra to ge the view.  Walking distance to a deli and wonderful Italian food, (Lucianos) .  Of you dont like it here, stay home!!!.

Wife and I spent six wonderful nights at the inn. From check in to check out our stay was outstanding, Staff at the inn go above and beyond to assist for any needs. Breakfast was excellent daily as well as the afternoon wind and cheese baskets. We used the bicycles daily and spent the afternoon sitting outside enjoying the beautiful view of the harbor. Had a room on the 3rd. floor which was very spacious and very quiet.

Summary Heading: Great stay at the Blue Lantern Inn
Summary: Celebrated our anniversary with a weekend stay at the Blue Lantern Inn in Dana Point, and it was amazing.  Had a room on the 3rd floor with a great view of the harbor and we were impressed with how seriously they took Covid protocols, how clean everything was, and how kind and helpful the staff were.  It's a beautiful location and we look forward to visiting again at some point in the future.

We stayed at the Inn from 3/19 to 3/21.  I found the inn online and thought it looked nice for a quick weekend staycation (we live an hour away). I booked last minute, same day and was surprised to get a room. I read reviews and they said get room 301, so after making my reservation I called to see if it was 301 and front desk said, “just so happens it is 301”. I have never stayed in an inn, I always stay in hotels, so this was a little different. Check in was fast and we were off to our room. When we opened the door we immediately were in awe of the room. Beautiful hardwood floors, vaulted tower ceiling, working gas fireplace, bottle of wine on ice, a quaint little sitting area and out the back door there was a drop dead 180 degree view of the harbor. A table and chair for two

What a gem! This place is worth every dollar especially in Covid times. They are meticulous in everything they do. The rooms, the food, the bikes look brand new, bring your own helmet, the enforced mask wearing in public places, the day to day overseeing and involvement of the manager, Dana, look at the positive reviews and believe them.We had room 102 and it was great.

Summary Heading: Relax, Recharge & Reunite at this lovely Bed and Breakfast
Summary: Gracious hospitality, spacious, clean comfortable room with a sweeping view of the Dana Point harbor and the sea beyond; fireplaces, balconies, bikes available to "borrow";  Scrumptious fresh breakfasts with multiple choices that you can choose to change, daily mini-picnics with wine, cheese and fresh fruit at 4 PM (they even remind you with a text!),  guest services are excellent.  Our 'go to' for celebrating special occasions so far but also great for 'just because" or I earned it!!!  So Go And Enjoy!!!

We just stayed here. The staff is extremely accommodating and kind. Our room was clean and very quiet on the 3rd floor.  The offer bikes, wine and cheese and a hearty breakfast. Would definitely recommend!

We had a wonderful stay at the Blue Lantern Inn!  The entire staff provided excellent service. Breakfasts and the snack tray in the afternoon were superior!  Highly recommend this unique and special boutique hotel.

Inn is at the end of a dead end road 10 min or so from Laguna Beach.  I booked room 204, balcony with a partial ocean view.  Checking in was given their ‘picnic basket’ which was a small cheese board with a small carafe of wine and cookies; breakfast was delivered promptly in the morning.  Off street, self parking was right next to the door. Room was nice, view was beautiful, it was a little worn and could use some updating.  And it smelled like my grandmothers house, I’m sorry, I don’t know how else to explain it! The thermostat is set to a max low of 70 which is just can’t stand; I understand the reasoning but I have a hard time sleeping when warm. Staff was very courteous and friendly during check in and check out.

Even during COVID, this was a splendid experience. From a full breakfast delivered to the room to happy hour picnic boxes with an ocean view, this stay was fabulous. It's always walking distance to many great restaurants, the harbor, and beaches.

Summary Heading: Wonderful, can’t wait to go back.
Summary: Gorgeous views and a quaint room. Stayed in a Pacific Edge room and am happy we did. The only thing I would change is trying to get on the second or third floor. The first floor was fine but the patio is next to the general hotel patio so not as private as a balcony on an upper floor. Still amazing and we will be going back!  Also, within walking distance to great restaurants.

Summary Heading: Covid safe with a beautiful view
Summary: Our first time staying at the Blue Lantern and we really enjoyed it.  When we arrived to check in the woman helping us took one last run through our room to ensure all precautions were taken and they were.   Everything was very clean, touchpoints were minimized, and even the TV remote was in a sealed bag.   Our room had a wonderful view of the bay and ocean from the balcony where we spent most of our time.  They included a wine and cheese box and breakfast which were nice touches.   Dining out was very walkable and with the proper spacing.  We will be back.

Awsome time could not have stayed at a better place.they are the compleat package when looking for a place too stay in Dana Point.From pleasing staff clean and safety due too the health issues this day we were still able too enjoy our stay but not feel locked away. Businesses in the area were so delightfully able too acomidate us with enjoyable eats and trips during our stay.

We choose this place every time. Great location, clean, friendly and best views. Looking forward to returning soon.  Close walk to restaurants and waterfront in safe location. A place that should be on your must list to stay.

We had a wonderful stay. Beautiful ocean views from two rooms. Yummy room service breakfasts. Meticulously maintained property. Super clean. Great beer and wine at reasonable prices. The staff was amazing and worked hard and fixed an unusual problem I was having with my computer and wifi. Will definitely stay at the Blue Lantern Inn again!

Absolutely lovely bed and breakfast on the point above Dana Marina! Our favorite "staycation" from San Diego! My wife and I have been coming here for years. The walk along the marina down below the Inn (maybe a mile drive if that) is beautiful.NEVER disappointed! Love it!

Thoroughly enjoy  going to Blue Latern over the years.  The first time was over 20 years ago and still going back.  Four Sisters Inn chain is very enjoyable and relaxing.  I would suggest that you take the opportunity to enjoy the comfort and memories.

This was my 7th time visiting the Blue Lantern and the 6th time for my husband. We absolutely love it here and hope to come back for many years. The atmosphere is just fantastic and we look forward to the afternoon happy hour and the delicious hot breakfast every stay!

I can attest to the superlatives offered in others' reviews of this wonderful boutique inn located on the spectacular cliffs above Dana Point Harbor. They seem to have done everything right, in terms of a very comfortable room (with a huge modern bathroom), excellent breakfast, and very substantial afternoon wine and hors d'oeuvres..  Everything is designed to provide a quiet and restful few days. They have a spectacular large patio with tables (some for the cliff-facing rooms and some for general use), a discrete but well-equipped gym and computer center in the basement, a large comfy reading room/lounge, free use of bicycles as well as towels and small chairs for the beach, and even a nice chess set just off the large lobby.   As both a frequent traveler and an engineer, I

First time to this area and absolutely loved it and the Inn.  Felt like being in a big comfortable “home”.  Happy hour was very nice during the sunsets.  Our suite was amazing.  The view!  Loved traveling to Laguna Beach, as well.  We will return!   Catalina Island is also a must see!

My experience was great, the staff are nice and very accommodating, the hotel is clean with beautiful decorations and the views from my room were amazing! I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely come back.

great little place to stay . staff very friendly.  room overview the water, restaurant was near by. hot tub quite small only large enough for 1 person 😕. complementary breakfast was simple but nice to have.

Gorgeous large rooms (103 and 101) with fantastic views, comfy beds, huge bathrooms with soaking tubs and walk-in showers. They even provide robes!  We could walk directly out onto a semi-private deck area for meals or to sit in the sun.  Hot breakfast was a plus and the happy hour should not be missed - good quality wine and fantastic hors d'oeuvres - we made a meal of them since we had a large lunch each day. Coffee and excellent tea selection available 24 hours plus freshly baked cookies. Nice gathering spaces in the inn as well - light, spacious dining room, sitting area with fireplace, and a game room. Quick easy walk to good restaurants/coffee shop and a lovely cliff walk. Truly the perfect getaway.

The hotel location and decor is wonderful and a great location/venue for any occasion.  Breakfast and hors d'oeuvres are super convenient including coffee, tea, hot chocolate, wine and water.  Bikes are available.

Stayed at the Blue Lantern on our honeymoon night and have been back for our anniversary twice.  Great location, great views, friendly staff and a tasty happy hour, including wine.  They even have bikes to borrow so you can cruise  Dana Point.  Lots of local great restaurants, too

This inn truly has it all.  The setting is magnificent, with a view of the harbor, marina, and ocean (they were keeping track of whale sightings from the balconies).  Our gorgeous spacious room had a large balcony, fireplace, and giant jacuzzi tub to put the icing on the cake.  Both the evening wine and cheese gathering and the morning fresh hot breakfasts included in the rate were served in a common area that had comfortable seating by a fireplace with large windows to take advantage of the view.  While we didn't spot a whale, we sure enjoyed watching a school of dolphin playing by the jetty from our balcony this morning.  I think we're going to have to think of more excuses to visit Dana Point and this lovely establishment.

Check in was a breeze, Wine and appetizers were very good. Cut up vegetables were fresh and tasty. Breakfast was above average: Breakfast consisted of popular items such as scrambled eggs, homemade muffins and bacon, and things on the lighter side such as hard boiled eggs, fresh cut fruit and english muffins. Room was well laid out and very comfortable. Had a balcony overlooking the ocean, staff encouraged us to take food up to our balcony. A long block away is the Bluff Top Trail that's a short picturesque trail with one of the best views of the harbor. Trail is wide and level, has guardrails and a few steps.

We absolutely loved our stay at the Blue Lantern Inn in Dana Point. We had our 2 small dogs with us & we were welcomed with open arms. They even left us 2 doggie bowls next to the fireplace. The views from the Inn are spectacular, the daily breakfast was simply superb, & the free Tapas/wine every day at 4:30-5:30 was amazing! I would highly recommend this Inn to anyone who is celebrating an anniversary or for a romantic getaway.

Summary Heading: View - location - rooms - service:   its all good
Summary: Great bluff top location with beautiful vistas of Dana Point Marina, and the southern Orange County coastline. Put my elderly parents up here and they LOVED IT. This is a "Sisters" property (we have stayed in another facility in Napa Valley).   Charming, Well maintained, nice people working there.

We have stayed before and remembered how lovely the place WAS - no longer quite the same. The location can't be beat and the hotel is situated to take advantage of the view. But as many have noted, it is in need of a remodel. Our air conditioner didn't work properly nor did our Keurig coffee maker work at all! Our patio was dirty and not that inviting. We had a great time due to a hosted party in the "Library" room so wine and appetizers were not an issue. Breakfast was average - The staff was friendly and parking handy, but please, give this place an update!!

My husband and I just returned from 3 magical days at The Blue Lantern. I found it online and we were in search of a three day mini break within 3 hours of our home in La Jolla, California. What an absolute find! The setting is unbeatable with a full view of the Dana Point Harbor and the ocean- mesmerizing. Our room had a previous patio and the room size was just perfect. The staff was so helpful and accommodating. They offer a full breakfast and a lovely happy hour. We cannot wait to come back!

Our stay at the Blue Lantern Inn at Dana Point was amazing! The view of the Bay from our balcony was spectacular, and the breakfast buffet was wonderful! Hiking trails are nearby as are many restaurants. Loaner bikes are available. Our 40th wedding anniversary could not have been any better.

My husband and I stayed here for our first night of our honeymoon many years ago and have made a tradition of celebrating our anniversary here every year since (our kids join too). We always look forward to the cozy room with the fireplace and beautiful ocean view. Breakfast is always delicious and the wine at cheese hour is so fun. While I would say this is more of a romantic couples bed and breakfast, they have been very accommodating and sweet when our kids stay with us. The walk to local restaurants and coffee shops is very easy and it is a very short drive (1 minute really) to get to the harbor below the bed and breakfast. It is definitely a family favorite that holds a special place in our hearts.

Summary Heading: Beauty and Luxury Along the Coast
Summary: This inn is a gem. The location was fantastic and the view spectacular. The room was luxurious and the meals were delicious. We will book again.  Highly recommend!   Booking was very simple. We arrived later than expected and were greeted warmly by the staff. The lobby was quiet with couples enjoying wine, conversation and table games. The beds were extremely comfortable. Even the room coffee was delicious!

We checked in on Friday afternoon 6/28/19 at Blue Lantern Inn for our 10th anniversary. We had a harbor view, the room was clean, and the service was friendly and accommodating. The room was cozy and quaint with a seaside theme (as is the Inn). The wine and hors d’oeuvres hour was welcoming, relaxing, and delicious including an assortment of cheeses, crackers, and crudités, and condiments. Oh - and homemade cookies, coffee, and tea.  The buffet breakfast was very good and there is a single serve k-cup type coffee maker in the room if you need that cup of brew to get your day started. Close to several restaurants (some within walking distance), the harbor, and San Juan Capistrano where we spent our Saturday.   No reflection on the Inn, but the little gazebo at the viewpoint next

Fantastic view.  Beautiful, comfortable rooms.  Fireplace.  Jetted Tub.  Complimentary happy hour.  Complimentary breakfast.  Complimentary bicycle use.  No hidden fees.  Free sodas.  Spa and foot reflexology available.

Summary Heading: A wonderful view from the room
Summary: We had a room with a harbor and ocean view which we loved.  This is a clean, friendly place that is a wonderful place to stay for business or just a get away.   The staff remembered our names and were delightful.

Summary Heading: Gorgeous Views and Accommodations in Dana Point
Summary: Gorgeous all around. Wonderful setting and the most incredible views of the harbor and ocean. I stayed here the night before my wedding and got ready there the next morning - it was the best place to be to relax and unwind before the hustle and bustle. The staff were incredibly pleasant and phenomenal to work with. There was one weird payment thing over a mistaken $0.20 undercharge - it seemed like a whole lot of hassle to go through over 20 cents, but I wasn't going to be bothered about anything on my wedding day so rolled with it. Warm breakfast was great. The staff allowed us to take some photos in the lobby setting and even helped me with my dress a bit. After seeing the place, one of my vendors who met me at the hotel even stayed at the Inn a few weeks later for her own

Beautiful views,  attentive front desk staff.  Our king bed was in need of being replaced, i kept rolling into the middle.  Breakfast,  get there early.  As it wasn't replenished when we arrived at 9am. The choices were slim at that point.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your comments as we truly value our guests' insights. Please know that our complimentary breakfast is served through 10am each morning, with hot and cold items being regularly replenished, so I apologize if we missed the mark during your stay and will certainly be addressing the situation with the team. In addition, we strive to ensure the most comfortable rest for our guests so I will also review your comments regarding the mattress. I hope we have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future. Wishing you happy travels, Lin McMahon Manager, Blue Lantern Inn

Summary Heading: Beautiful property with amazing views and service
Summary: We stayed here for one night and we had a great time. The views are spectacular and the service, food and everything else was wonderful. Everything is also very close by for a stroll in town. We also enjoyed their complimentary wine in the afternoon and breakfast.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay in Dana Point
Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights in March.   It was a nice little hotel on the top of the cliffs looking over Dana Point.   Very friendly staff and wine and cheese hour at 5 is a great touch as well.   Recommend if staying in the area.

Summary Heading: Comfortable boutique hotel with great views
Summary: The Blue Lantern sits in a beautiful spot overlooking the Dana Point harbor. It is attractive and in great shape. Rooms are spacious and in very good shape, if not the high end of luxury. People were very nice, and there is a good friendly vibe from a lot of people hanging around the comfortable lobby from having a happy hour and breakfast. The happy hour is nothing to write home about but you can get some cheese, crackers and fruit to tide you over. Breakfast was done very well; almost too well.  Had a great view from our balcony even though it wasn't the high end view room; was perfectly satisfied with it.  Should be noted that there is not an easy way to walk from the hotel to the Marina. We did it each day, but was for the exercise. Drove down the only time we wanted to go

I gave this INN a 5 star rating due to its spotless appearance. It is kept beautifully. it is nicely located. We stayed in room 203 which had a spa tub and a balcony with a decent view of the harbor. We stayed in the 7 Gables in Pacific Grove many times and this is the comparison I used. The breakfast at the lantern is okay but not great. The wine hour is poor with wine in a decanter)at 7 Gables they have many bottles and vintage to choose from. The cheese plate etc needs a lot more variety. The front desk is very good but normally when we eat at the chart house the Inn(7 Gables) called and we would get a complimentary desert -this did not happen here. All in all i would recommend this as a place to try. I would recommend a room on the top floor to avoid any heavy footprints

Beautiful boutique hotel, 4 post beds, quant, great views, expensive, nice staff, small rooms. When we were there the gazebo was fenced off, not sure why. Quiet and relaxing with great hilltop ocean views.

The Blue Lantern Inn is very nice, particularly nice if you get the right room!! Though I would say all rooms probably have their pluses. The location is perfect as it sits right on a cliff for spectacular views (from public terrace if not from your room) and within walking distance to fabulous food.  The people running the BLI are super nice and accommodating where they can be! They do offer a warm breakfast, but if breakfast is one of your favorite meals of the day there are better options a short drive away :)

From check in to check out everything was just perfect. Our room (101) not only had a sunken sitting room with fireplace, but also a private balcony overlooking the point. Such amazing views from sunrise to sunset. Great breakfasts, afternoon snacks, free parking, and a perfect calm ambience. This was our first time, and hopefully not our last.

We are frequent visitors to Dana Point and had been wanting to stay at the Blue Lantern Inn for a while. Due to the small number of rooms we had to wait a while for vacancies that would have fitted our schedule.  It proved well-worth the wait as the Blue Lantern Inn was everything BandB fans love and expected.  The Inn sits high on a bluff with stunning 180 degree views.  We arrived before check in time and were happy that our room was already available.  The parking lot is conveniently located by the hotel entrance and access to the rooms and around the Inn were easily navigated.  We had a beautiful room with a fire place and a gorgeous view of the harbor.  The whole hotel is elegantly decorated and spotlessly maintained both in the rooms and public area.  As advertised, we

We sent three nights in room 301 overlooking the harbor. This was during the time that the area was getting torrential rain near the coast and snow in the mountains so we weren't able to enjoy the balcony and view as much as we would have liked, but did enjoy the fireplace and got lots of reading done. One morning was dry during our stay and we were able to walk along the bluff, enjoy some time at a beach and walk in the harbor area. There are many walkable restaurants and have to think when the weather is nice this has to be a perfect place for a long weekend.

The room is extremely comfortable and clean with every amenity you could want. Cozy fireplace. The stay includes use of beach cruisers, wine hour with appetizers, an amazing breakfast spread and the option of ordering a massage/spa treatment. The area is great for hiking and within walking distance of several really good restaurants. We truly enjoyed this time and found the experience to a wonderful relaxing get away. It has an outside patio with an exceptional view!

Summary Heading: Wonderful Inn, can’t recommend it highly enough
Summary: What a wonderful place to stay. We had a lovely large room on the 3rd floor with a balcony looking out over the harbour. Rooms are well equipped and very comfortable. Buffet style breakfast was really good and the wine and snacks in the afternoon were a really nice touch. Really friendly and helpful staff. Thoroughly recommend this beautiful inn.

Summary Heading: Plush Bed and Breakfast That Treats Guests Attentively
Summary: Beautiful setting on a bluff overlooking the harbor and Pacific Ocean at very fair rates. It's super clean and welcoming- the staff is always ready to meet your every need.  Comfortable rooms, scrumptious breakfasts and late afternoon wine tastings. Easy walk to good local dining and friendly pub. We love this place and return whenever we can.

A peaceful stay at a beautiful Inn. Delicious breakfasts, friendly staff, extremely accommodating. Zen-like sunrises and sunsets. Close to Laguna Beach. Far from the CA fires. Always welcomed by cookies, coffees, and fruit-filled water.

What a nice place to stay!  Staff is very helpful and friendly.  Room was very clean and we had a great view.  Price includes breakfast, wine and snacks in afternoon, coffee, soda and bottled water in the room.  Would definitely go back and highly recommend.

Our second visit here in a year was cut short and the manager was very understanding about our early cancellation.. The location is great--on a bluff overlooking the harbor and the ocean, plenty of restaurants nearby and in walking distance, so many trails and parks to explore. This time we had two different rooms, one night in the "tower" with it's wonderful views of the harbor and the ocean.  It had a huge bathroom, over-soft king bed, desk, console and tv, plus a sitting area with easy chairs, gas fireplace and telescope. Windows all around the room with great views. We still heard all the people who passed below our balcony, but once it grew quiet at night, we enjoyed having a glass of complimentary wine and looking out over the harbor and city lights. Always ask for a

If your looking for a superior location yet more casual atmosphere, this is it.  This Inn sits on the bluff overlooking the Dana Point Harbor and is within walking distance to 6 restaurants, from casual to upscale.  Enjoy this special property for a weekend get a way, vacation or romantic stay.

Summary Heading: GREAT LOCATION, COMFORTABLE, AND VERY ACCOMODATING
Summary: This was our second stay. From the first time we enatered, they were quick to welcome us and were quick to give us all the information we needed for our pleasant stay.  Everyone that helped us were very helpful. The rooms were clean and well equippedt. The breakfast was more than adequate in a quite setting. We especially enjoyed the late afternoon wine and hors d'oeuvres  We would highly recommend the Blue Lantern Inn at Dana Point CA..

I took my wife to the Blue Lantern Inn for our 33rd anniversary. We had been there before, but it has been renovated apparently since. The location is wonderful - beautiful view, walking distance to good restaraunts, a nice trail on the bluff overlooking the wharf and ocean.  The staff over all was very friendly and helpful.  Why the poor rating? Well, the refrigerator would make a loud clicking sound once an hour at least when it turned on. This is okay during the day, but not at 2 oclock in the morning. The Air Conditioner is EXTREMELY loud - it would 'pop' on - and then it would be VERY loud.  When we talked to the front desk about both when we checked out, we got a weak apology - especially about the AC."Those are big units, recently renovated, cant slow the fan blades down

Summary Heading: Great views, dated interior and very basic  food.
Summary: Came here with my wife and got a pretty good deal on the room rate.   OVERALL: Slighty disappointing due to the price. If I had paid a normal rate for this I would have been very disappointed.  THE GOOD: Great views from the room. Staff was friendly.   THE OK. The interior could use some updating. The furniture and decorations were pretty dated. Our mattress was way too soft. Our backs were sore in the morning. Also the water temperature in my shower kept getting hot bursts.   THE BAD: The food. Wine and cheese happy hour was house wine and the cheese seemed pretty stale. The cookies tasted as if they were a week old.  The breakfast was also a pretty basic buffet. Basically what you would expect from a chain motel.

We stayed only one night (by choice) and had a lovely stay.  We were in an upper room with view of the water from the balcony. As others have said, a no charge happy hour was offered along with a no charge breakfast. You park your vehicle yourself in a lot next door. No complaints.

The inn was beautiful. The price per night was fantastic considering we took advantage of the happy hour and full breakfast. Got up early to watch the sunrise and Stan the night manager was still there offering us early morning coffee and wonderful hospitality. I would definitely recommend staying here. Hope to return.

I am very happy with my stay at the blue lantern inn. They really care for you there. Clean rooms very spacious and breakfast was perfect for me a very picky eater.  This is the place to stay for exploring the area I was impressed with Dana Point, it’s beauty and geographical area will make me comeback and soon.

Summary Heading: Great staff, amazing views, lovely property
Summary: Stayed here for Labor Day weekend after my husband returned from a month long work trip. We had room 307, a harbor view room and we loved it! It had two double sinks in the spacious bathroom, a large bedroom area with plenty of space for your belongings, two chairs under the windows that overlook the marina, and a fireplace. We loved opening our windows and staring at the view from our room! So peaceful! The rooms were also very quiet at night.   The breakfast was good, but my favorite included perk was the happy hour. It was great to take our wine and cheese and sit out back on the terrace and overlook the marina. Very relaxing and we met several nice guests also staying at the Inn.  The Inn itself has lots of common areas, so you never feel like you are on top of anyone when

We keep coming back to this wonderful Inn because we find it so refreshing, so calm and relaxing in the midst of our busy life. The cool air, the beautiful harbor view, easy access to cliff-top trails that descend to the beaches below, and a place that somehow combines homey-ness with elegance. Staff members are consistently warm, friendly, and accommodating, and the bountiful breakfasts are superb. So are the homemade cookies and the late afternoon wine and hors d'oeuvres. When you need to hit the "pause" button, this is the place to come. P. S. Don't miss out on the delicious dinners at Cannons and/or the Chart House, walking distance away, but make reservations!

We flew from Connecticut for our nieces wedding and stayed here. What a gem of a place. The room overlooking Dana Point was breath taking. There is a fireplace in the room and a sitting area to enjoy the ambiance. The patio has beautiful views of the marina and beach areas. Sipping coffee in the morning watching the paddle boarders, boogie boarders, sail boaters were something out of a magazine. In the morning there is a breakfast fit for a king. Something for everyone. At night  there is a cocktail hour with wine and beer and appetizers. All the staff were very friendly and accommodating to whatever needs you have. They have beach bikes to ride if you like as well. I highly recommend this little gem of an inn. I cannot wait to return.

Summary Heading: A lovely inn away from the hustle bustle of Laguna Beach
Summary: This is a comfortable hotel. The rooms are spacious and quiet.  It's a bit old looking (stained carpeting) but is very homey.    They serve a hot breakfast which is pretty good.  The bacon is especially crisp and yummy.  They also serve wine and snacks in the afternoon which is a nice touch.  A small thing--I asked for water to fill my water bottle and, while they had a pitcher  in the back, they sold me a bottle.  For the price of the hotel they could have given me a small bottle without charge.  But the people at the desk were otherwise friendly and welcoming.

Thank you so very much for a wonderful “five star” experience! All 24 of us were thrilled with your beautiful facility and excellent Staff! Of particular excellence was the beautiful Thursday Evening Reception on your Fourth Floor Patio at sunset overlooking the gorgeous Pacific Ocean! As well, the ordurves were quite tasty! We will definitely return!

This is our second time here and we have stayed at several other four sister inn’s before. This one is the worth drive from Modesto to Dana Point ! And yes nightmare traffic thru LA. The rooms are very clean and we got the room as we requested with spa and balcony with view of the bay. The afternoon snacks and fresh cookie and wine superb. And as for the breakfast in the morning is fantastic and with fresh fruit all cut up and NOT from a bag or can! If you think of going to this fantastic hotel and yes a bit pricey but worth every penny! We will be back again soon. And hiking trail near the hotel. And also your only about an hr from old town San Diego. Enjoy your plan to stay here . We most certainly do !

The rooms are so sizable and well appointed in this cozy inn on the coast that one would practically move in if the hotel allowed it. The bathroom is immaculate and  the living room space is great for reading or relaxing. Parking is also complimentary in their lot next to the inn.   There is a breakfast buffet in the morning, and there is a wine tasting hour in the late afternoon. I am anxious to stay in some of their other properties in other parts of California.

The location is right on the bluffs overlooking the harbor.  We had a balcony and spent a good deal of time just watching the sailboats and the ocean.  We were right by the elevator but never heard anything-- our room was very quiet.  The bathroom is huge-- a jacuzzi tub and beautiful shower.  Carmen at the front desk was very welcoming and helpful from the moment we checked in.  The breakfasts were hearty and the appetizers and wine were great, too.  Enough food so that we only ended up purchasing lunch.  We borrowed the bicycles to tour the area, which was fun, but I will say the bikes were made for shorter people and are not adjustable, which was tricky since we are both around six feet tall. The bed was a bit too soft for my taste, but I like a very firm mattress, so take

Summary Heading: Comfort, casual weekend and vacation retreat.
Summary: Wonderful setting above the Dana Point Harbor.  Quaint feeling inn with comforts of home.  Fireplace in rooms, B&B type breakfasts and close to everything one needs for fine dining.  Enjoy the patio with wine and cheese in the evening.

Summary Heading: Hotel's error with credit card at check-in soured our stay
Summary: Really bad stuff:  We arrived late at night and the desk clerk said our credit card was declined. She said we'd have to sort it out in the morning, handed us the key, locked the front door to the hotel, and left. In the morning we came down to resolve the problem and the desk clerk said, "The night clerk shouldn't have let you in at all - she was supposed to send you to an ATM to get cash or refuse to check you in."  Leaving aside the fact that we had another card the night clerk could have used (we offered it but there was some reason the night clerk could not run it), why was our first card declined? Well, it turned out that they'd tried to run our card with someone else's name. Soooo.... if the night clerk had followed procedures, we'd have been driving around town at

Wow! This Inn is great. Highly recommend. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The lobby is so inviting. There is a fireplace in the lobby and the library right off the lobby. The room is well appointed. The bed is comfortable, the bathroom a good size. Fireplace in each room. We stayed in both 102 and 305. Each room is different but has similar charm. The view from rooms are fantastic. The hotel is set on a cliff over the harbor. You can sit out on the patio (102) or balcony (305) watch the boats and enjoy the sunset. This is truly a hidden gem.

I love this B and B and was anxious to bring my husband after staying here a few times solo in the past. Our first two nights were delightful: early morning hiking followed by substantial and filling breakfasts, sunny perfect weather days, and quiet peaceful nights. Night three is absolutely dreadful. There is a loud party going on at a restaurant next door, complete with loud bass-heavy music and screaming guests. We will never get to sleep.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your feedback. I was so happy to read that you have enjoyed previous visits and were able to bring your husband on this trip. Your description of hiking, sunny days and peaceful nights sounds absolutely lovely! Please know that we very much apologize that our neighbors caused a disturbance to you. This is very much a "one off" situation as they are restricted by a noise curfew.  I will certainly be discussing the issue with the restaurant manager to ensure there is no recurrence. I very much hope we have the opportunity to welcome you back to enjoy future visits. Warmly, Lin McMahon Manager, Blue Lantern Inn

Summary: room was great and quiet.  Enjoyed the breakfast-much fuller than expected.   Very relaxing!   Walking distance to our restaurant- have great recommendations for restaurants and other activities such as whale watching.

Everything met or exceeded out expectations. From the delicious breakfasts to the happy hour wine/appetizers. Room was spacious and the location was perfect for our itinerary. Easy to get to and simple parking.

My wife and I decided to try the Blue Lantern Inn for our 28th wedding anniversary. We were not disappointed. If I could I would give this place 10 stars. The inn was super clean, the staff was excellent, breakfast was great, and what can I say about the view from our balcony. We plan to be back as soon as w can.

Summary Heading: Not the same as all the prior stays. New chef lacks creativity .
Summary: Had to downgrade one level do to the new chef's lack of creativity. Breakfast is basically the same menu every morning. Eggs were scrambled one morning and then back to eggs with red/green peppers the next. Wife got sick one day probably due to the hard boiled eggs which I warned her not to eat. She was also disappointed in the same orange flavored water daily. Before, the young lady chef varied her flavored water with different fruits. Now their cookies are the same old raisin or chocolate chip every day. The other reviewers are right about the happy hour appetizers. Same o Same o. Now we can't brag to our family and friends about Blue Lantern anymore. I will give kudos to the young front desk clerks. The actually thanked us for coming back as repeat guests ! That means a lot

Wife and I spent five wonderful nights. The staff was again extremely friendly and gracious. The location is perfect as it is very close to the harbor and downtown. Bikes provided by the inn are a big plus. I would have given a five star rating but this time breakfast was only average compared to our recent stays and happy hour snacks were very minimal once they were out of food it was not replaced and three of the night they were 10-15 minutes late setting up.

Summary Heading: Outstanding Views, Helpful Staff, Well Appointed Rooms
Summary: What's not to like? This is a new property perched high on the bluff overlooking Dana Point Marina.  It's convenient to the scenic Bluffs Trail and two outstanding restaurants, Cannon's and the Chart House.  Unlike many B&B's the breakfast is buffet style and not as creative and "personalized" as one might expect, but it's adequate.  The staff is friendly and eager to assist.  Prices are about right for the area; we paid $239 per night on a Sunday-Monday stay, plus $49 in taxes per night.

We had room 301 in the tower.  The room and view were amazing.  The staff was very helpful.  We enjoyed the happy hour and the delicious buffet breakfasts. The only drawback is to go to beach and harbor you have to drive.  We did walk to an Italian Restaurant one night for dinner, which was very good.

Check out what they offer. On top of the cliff overlooking the harbor and the ocean. Tower suites have special large binoculars in the room. (Junior suite type accommodation). Some rooms with street view but not to close to PCH. Free onsite parking. City pavilion under repair due to rock sliding. Breakfast and afternoon wine and cheese. recommended if the price is right. MeuterMedia

Summary Heading: very nice hotel with great view
Summary: dana point is a very nice city, and a great hotel, with great views when you reserve a room with view. We had breakfirst included which was very nice. Enjoy the sunrise from the viewpoints. Everything was good so we will come back.

Spectacular views, unique rooms, friendly service, nice breakfast and social hour, easy parking. Clean, comfortable and inviting. Very small gym but so many activities to do nearby. Enjoyed every minute. They were offering a nice special during our stay.

Summary Heading: First time being disappointed in our stay
Summary: We booked two nights in August 2017 for New Year's Eve and New Year's Day.  I thought by booking so early we would get a great room.  This was NOT the case.  We had the worst room we have ever stayed in there.  It was small and on the street side near the gazebo with a very small and very dirty balcony.  The noise level was awful, especially on New Year's Eve.  It took forever to get hot water and we reported this and were told because of the location of the room, we were the last to get hot water.  We first started staying at the Blue Lantern Inn over 20 years ago, so needless to say, we really enjoy coming here for a getaway.  The last time we stayed here we were in a tower room and it was wonderful.  Just so bummed that this time was not pleasant.

Situated high on a bluff above the Dana Point harbor, Blue Lantern Inn offers a B and B style experience of Dana Point. We could watch wonderful sunrises and sunsets and were even treated to a tall ship sailing in the bay. The glass-walled elevator  was a great effect.Wine and cheese and ample  breakfasts added to our comfort.Only two things disappointed: the heater was overactive and a very hard bed made the nights less perfect We hope these will be remedied .All in all, though, a lovely place.

We were so thrilled to get a last minute room at this lovely Inn. Our room had breathtaking views,  bright sunny skylights, a gorgeous deck overlooking the harbor, a gas fireplace and 2 person Jacuzzi tub! Our bed was super cozy along with the robes they offer to their guests. We were sad to have missed the wine and cheese time, but upon our late check in, wine was offered to us, which was a nice touch. The yummy breakfast spread was amazing with so many choices to fill your belly before heading off for your adventure. We will certainly return to your lovely gem of an Inn, which felt so cozy and homey!

I added on a couple of days to a San Diego conference trip to explore the California coast and for some much-needed R&R. Without much research, I booked the Blue Lantern Inn for two nights. What an amazing, lovely place! Dana Point itself was such a great, accessible little town. Just enough restaurants and activities for a couple of days. Although there was much to see and do around the area, I really didn't even want to leave Dana Point. The hotel was actually so perfect, that I barely wanted to leave it! The inn itself is perched on a cliff with beautiful views of the bay. Go ahead and get a room with a view - you'll be very happy that you did! The hotel offers free bikes, and there are numerous walking trails that you can take right from the hotel. Just ask for a trail list

offering warm atmosphere and spectacular views with friendly service. Our room was very spacious with a great bathroom - huge shower and a spa bathtub. Bed was big and comfortable. Martim decor in the room. Furniture a bit dated but that is not so important. Charming and romantic. Nice breakfast.

Summary Heading: Staying at this B&B always leaves you with a feeling of happiness.
Summary: When I look back at my vacations in SoCal, my time at the Blue Lantern Inn stands out vividly.   The views of Dana Point harbor and the pacific ocean from the balcony are surreal, the staff is always incredible, and the room is filled with everything you need to enjoy the staying in paradise by the sea.  Lin, Carmen, Tiffany, Erika, & Leslie were at the front desk during my recent stay, and they were all wonderful. From check in, making reservations, and local knowledge, they couldn't have been more accommodating!  Yet another wonderful experience in Dana Point, staying at the Blue Lantern Inn.

Room 302-wow, great view of the harbor. Friendly staff...lovely location   I agree with many of the other posters, the place needs some TLC. The furniture looked tired and please, provide dark washcloths rather than those awful chemical make-up wipes. The one in my bathroom was dried-up anyway.  The afternoon wine and cheese was terrific , great selection and I was happy with the breakfast -had a hard boiled egg and some bacon. I think plain scrambled eggs might appeal to more people than the ones with salsa--maybe salsa on the side?  Slippers would be a nice touch. You do get a nice terry robe.  Overall, a pleasant spot,but not the luxurious place I thought it would be.

We loved our stay at the Blue Lantern Inn and will be back. The room was fantastic - between gorgeous views of the harbor, a lovely fireplace, large bathroom with whirlpool tub and comfortable bed, we enjoyed our stay.  Our room did not have a balcony, but there is a communal area overlooking the harbor that we were able to spend time at while awaiting our check-in. During our stay, we were able to borrow beach cruiser bikes that we rode over to Capistrano on, and the Inn had great beach chairs & beach towels we used later in the day.  Breakfast & the wine/cheese hour were also lovely!

We stayed here for my nieces wedding, which was held at nearby Dan Point Yacht Club.The Inn is setup like a large house, with winding hallways. The room rate includes a full hot breakfast in the airy lobby and drinks in the late afternoon near the fireplace. The Library has a TV, books and games all there for the guests use. Soda and bottled water are available all day as well. The rooms vary from Large multi-level affairs with balcony's that overlook the marina to smaller more functional rooms. Even the "smaller" room was twice the size of a standard hotel room. Our room, and I suspect all rooms, had two fully robes, a fire place and a Jacuzzi tub. The staff treats everyone like family, it was a great experience and we can't wait to go back. This is a great location for

Summary Heading: A wonderful place to enjoy beautiful Dana Point
Summary: This is a small beautiful inn with very welcoming and accommodating staff, delicious buffet breakfasts and a happy hour in the afternoon. It is perched on a bluff overlooking the harbor with a small beach and loads of boats. From our good sized room with a balcony we could see the sun light up the harbor and watch the stars at night. There is an outdoor patio to sit with your coffee in the morning or wine in the evening.  It’s at the end of the street so no noisy traffic going by either. Many good restaurants within walking distance.

Our room overlooked the marina and out into the ocean.  We enjoyed watching the activity in the marina and the tall ships that were in for festival from our balcony.  This property was beautifully maintained with elegant linens and was very quiet.  Breakfast each day was delicious, with eggs, yogurt, breads and pastries,  and afternoon wine and appetizers was a lovely respite from a busy day of sightseeing.  A small exercise room is on property.  Hosts were friendly and helpful.

This inn is located on the Dana Point cliff with breathtaking views and in close proximity to many activities. The inn itself is beautifully decorated with very friendly staff... and most importantly, it was very clean. The amenities were perfect with breakfast each morning and wine & cheese in the afternoon.  I highly recommend walking through the Dana Point Bluff trail (have to walk down Santa Clara Ave.) and pass through the Dana Point Arches...and you will find the most spectacular views of the harbor. It's also a nice hike.

Very accommodating, polite and friendly staff. Rooms were very clean, decor simple but stylish. Views wee spectacular.  High end inn at a reasonable price. Excellent wine/cheeses served at 4. Breakfast was included.

Summary Heading: A wonderful weekend in Dana Point.
Summary: Our 3 night stay at this delightful inn was perfect.  Our Tower Room (301) had a beautiful terrace overlooking the Harbor and Cove Road, a fireplace and a four poster bed.  The staff is excellent, friendly and helpful and the location is perfect.  Parking is not a problem since Blue Lantern has it's own parking lot.  Absolutely loved it.

Booked one night after a stressful business meeting. Hotel was excellent in service, and relaxing. They have afternoon wine with snacks. The morning breakfast was extremely good. The staff was excellent in directing to a restaurant and making a reservations for you.

Summary Heading: Absolutely wonderful property !!  Great location, beautifully appointed, excellent staff
Summary: My husband and I just returned from a trip to southern California and had the pleasure of staying at the Blue Lantern Inn during our time in Dana Point.  It is a beautiful property sitting on top of the hill overlooking the gorgeous Dana Point Marina.  The views are breathtaking !  Our room was extremely clean- beautifully decorated with a wonderful large bathroom, complete with jetted tub-  We had a ground level suite with a fireplace.  Stone patio-  Enjoyed mid afternoon wine and cheese in the hotel- staff was extremely helpful and pleasant.  We will definitely return - absolutely wonderful time !!

Nice B&B, was upgraded with slight view for our anniversary, + very nice complimentary Champagne & Chocolates!   Room could use updating & more lighting over bath vanity.  OK recommendations for dinner restaurants.

This large BnB (or small hotel) is perched at the edge of a cliff overlooking the beautiful Dana Point harbor. The BnB offers a very delicious breakfast daily and an incredible wine and cheese spread every afternoon. The BnB also offers free beach cruiser rental and beach gear, all of which were well-maintained. We stayed a total of 5 nights, and to our surprise were given a complementary bottle of sparkling wine to enjoy on our last night, and enjoy we did on the beautiful common patio overlooking the harbor. We were not left wanting for anything. The room was clean and spacious and every one we interacted with at reception was warm, friendly, and accommodating. I also found the price to be a great value for the location, quality, and complementary services. Thank you Blue

The Blue Lantern Inn is a great place to stay. It is romantic and feels off the beaten track even though it is on Coast Highway. it has various levels of rooms. Do yourself a favor and get one of the highest and best. You won't be disappointed.  Outside porches with a tremendous view of the Pacific make this hotel fantastic. We spent three glorious nights there.  Staff and hospitality are the best. Pictures don't do it justice. I look forward to many return trips. Highly recommended also for locals who just need a getaway place for the weekend.  It does book up, especially in the summer. Free full breakfasts are served.

Clean..big king bed.good and fast ck in. I Great breakfast and coffee. The view is great if you get the correct room. They do have a view point outside of the motel. The motel is close to the center and it is great to walk around the center

Just returned from a two day getaway at the Blue Lantern Inn in Dana Point.  The views are spectacular and the room was lovely.  We were able to book a "Royal Treatment" couples massage at the last minute and enjoyed every minute.  The Blue Lantern Inn will be on our list as a must on our next trip to Southern California.

I read about Blue Lantern while on honeymoon and straightaway thought it would make a great first anniversary getaway. Did it ever. It's just a homey B&B in a great spot. Highlights:   1. Wine tasting and hors d'oeuvres at 4:00.   2. Bicycles to borrow.   3. Cookie jar!   4. Beautiful view of the Pacific.   5. Fun shops within walking (or bicycling) distance.   6. Breakfast was lovely. Fresh squeezed juices stand out.   To be fair, we haven't gone to a ton of B&Bs, so there might be more amazing ones out there. But I get the sense it would be tough to top this one.

Summary Heading: An oasis of peace and tranquility  in Southern Cal
Summary: We just returned for a short stay after 20 years and it is still as wonderful as before--wonderful innkeeper Lin, high standards in comfort and cleanliness, delicious food, and a view that cannot be beat.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, choose an upper floor for view and privacy
Summary: We recently spent three nights here and wish we could have stayed longer. The location is great--on a bluff overlooking the harbor and the ocean, plenty of restaurants nearby and in walking distance, so many trails and parks to explore. Our room, 101 was in the "tower." It had a huge bathroom, comfy king bed, desk, console and tv, plus a sitting area with easy chair, sofa, gas fireplace and telescope. Windows all around the room with great views. However--why is there always a however? People on the public walkway just outside can smile and wave as they go by. We had a "private" patio. Being on the ground floor our patio overlooked a public walkway and hotel tables that overlooked the harbor. So, you could enjoy a drink on your private patio with whomever happened to walk by and
