Summary Heading: The most Magical place in SoCal
Summary: I honestly cannot say enough positive things about my stay at the Blue Lantern Inn!   Upon arrival I was greeted by Leslie and Kelsey at the front desk, who gave an excellent first impression of themselves, and of this lovely B&B. Both cheerfully welcomed me, and provided an overview of Inn's the breakfast/evening reception, as well as gave recommendations for nearby dining.  I could see the ocean views from the lobby were better in person than any picture I saw online, but when I opened up the door to my room and saw the views from my balcony-I was in awe.  The room itself was spacious and extremely comfortable, with a jetted tub, fireplace, and a cozy bed that you never want to get out of. I often felt that a lot of thought went into maximizing rest and relaxation.   My trip

We booked this property based on a recommendation from a friend. Were not disappointed! Although we normally are inclined to large 4-5 star hotels, we were very happy with our stay! Even having to switch rooms for our 3rd night due to crowding, was not an issue when we booked.  Afternoon wine and munchies, along with a very nicely prepared buffet breakfast, made for a great end and start to our days. You can't beat the location for a gorgeous view of Dana Point harbor. Right on the cliff edge. Will definitely return.

The Blue lantern Inn at Dana Point offers complete satisfaction in all regards. The Inn is located on top of the hill with a stunning view of the marina and beautiful Pacific sunsets - make sure you ask for a room with Ocean view! The rooms are sumptious: Lot's of space, your own fire place, nice bathroom, very comfortable beds, and very high quality of cleanliness! On top of this, staff is incredibly service-minded and kind: We received lots of unprompted help and advice during our stay - and always smiles and kind comments. We have found our home away from home in Southern California!

Had a disappointing stay here in July 17. It started badly when we were informed that they would be refitting carpets the next day and suggested that we vacate the hotel between 8am - noon. They then went on to say that the hotel was full because they had three weddings and so couldn't change our room. So they knew the hotel was going to be full and still scheduled recarpeting. That is a neat little way to encapsulate my experience.  other grumbles - asking for a place that did a good salad for lunch and being directed to what turned out to be a deli with prepackaged ingredients - so much for local knowledge. Breakfast is complimentary but very basic and you would be better served to going to s lovsl dpot.  Positive points - The view is great ,and within walking distance is a

My husband and I booked an accessible room for 2 nights in June.  The Inn is charming the location fabulous.  Not so if you need an accessible room. I asked for a room with an ocean view.  Apparently, they have two accessible rooms, one with  roll- in shower; but no view.  The other with a view, but no roll in shower.  Its equipped with grab bars etc. What I didn't know was the bathroom had a jacuzzi  tub. No way is that accessible for anyone with mobility issues and most difficult for the elderly.  My husband has Parkinson's.  What upsets me the most is they do have rooms with walk-in showers as well as a jacuzzi.  Why was I not offered that? Needles to say the hotel couldn't make any changes once we were there.  My complaint to management has landed on deaf ears.  Very
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. As you noted, one of our two accessible rooms has a view and a tub with a removable bench and the other has a roll-in shower and no view. Although we do have other rooms with a shower and view, they are “step in” showers and thus are not considered an accessible room.  However if that meets your needs, please let us know when booking your next visit, and we would be thrilled to accommodate you in one of those rooms. We do our very best to accurately describe guestrooms and their features to find each guest a room that meets their expectations, and I apologize if we missed the mark in our description. Please do not hesitate to contact one of the managers in the future when making a reservation.

Summary: I have stayed here 5 times and had excellent accommodations every time. The Inn atmosphere is so much better than conventional hotels. Front desk clerk Carmen was again a very pleasant charming person.

Summary Heading: They seemed to think of everything
Summary: My wife and I stayed here for three nights as a gift from our children.  We have nothing but great things to say about the hotel.  The staff were all courteous and helpful, our room was excellent (they even upgraded us upon our arrival at no extra charge), and the complimentary breakfast was very good (for the reviews I've seen that are critical of the breakfast, I don't know what they expect for a comp breakfast).  They even offered crackers, cheese and wine in the afternoon.  The location is great and our room had a nice view (and patio) of the harbor. We really enjoyed everything about this place.

Summary Heading: Not Quite the Inn it Used to Be
Summary: My husband and I stayed at this inn on two previous occasions 12 years ago before returning last weekend for a few days with friends who live in the area.  The view is still as spectacular as ever and the staff are welcoming and very helpful about providing recommendations for dining and activities.  But I agree with the last reviewer that the the interior of the inn needs updating.  There are stains on the hall carpets, bathroom tile and upholstered furniture in the rooms, and serious dust on some of the furniture in common areas.  Bird droppings on our balcony were there when we arrived and still there when we left 4 days later making the balcony an unappealing spot to sit.  I overheard 3 different guests reporting minor room maintenance problems to the front desk at breakfast

Summary Heading: Beautiful view, needs a little lift
Summary: My husband and I stayed for one night in a room on the third floor.  I used the "carpe diem" rate, which gave me a discount for booking the same day as our arrival.  Parking was easy, right next to the hotel and free.  Front desk staff was very nice from reservation to check in and out.  We had to haul our own bags in and up to our room and back out to the car the next morning.  No cart or assistance was anywhere to be seen or offered.  Room was just okay.  The entire place needs a bit of love and remodeling.  Stains on carpets, dings on walls, stains in shower etc.  That being said, the room itself had tall ceilings, was spacious and clean, had a comfortable soft bed, and a small balcony with a heck of a view of the harbor and cliff.  The breakfast was just okay.  Eggs,

Summary Heading: Perfect secluded paradise by the harbor!
Summary: Me and my husband just stayed here for our babymoon, and we can't rave enough about this secluded paradise!  It is a sweet, beautiful quaint B&B that is tucked away off the beaten path that has the feel of an east coast getaway by the sea.  We were situated on the 1st floor with a patio that overlooked the harbor, absolutely stunning!  The room was incredibly comfortable and perfectly appointed with an extremely comfortable bed and a wonderful bathroom with a huge shower and big jetted bathtub that was glorious.  They had a lovely reception hour in the common area starting around 4:30 where they put out a wonderful array of delicious hors d’oeuvres and a plentiful amount of white and red wine (which my hubby partook in for me since I'm not drinking right now with my baby in the

Summary Heading: Location, free food, room and staff were exceptional. Highly recommend
Summary: I stayed here on business and my wife joined me for a few days. The views were excellent. The hotel had a boutique European type feel with an older clientele that enjoyed congregating together during happy hour and breakfast. The free bicycles were one of our favorite parts of the experience.

We spent our second anniversary at the Blue Lantern inn, and had the most amazing time. The room was clean and we had a nice view. The staff was very friendly and outgoing. The breakfast in the morning was great and we loved going down for a glass of wine or 2...before we left for our dinner plans. I would definitely stay at a Four Sisters Inn again in the future, we are already looking forward to planning our anniversary trip next year at one of their Inns.

We were visiting family in Palm Springs and drove out to the coast for one night. And I think we picked the very best hotel on the Pacific.  We loved our stay and everything about this place and this little town.

I had previously stayed at the Blue Lantern Inn many times decades ago and was anxious to revisit this wonderful location.  It remains a classy, quiet, elegant place to stay in a great location.  Afternoon cocktails and appetizers are plentiful and varied.   Morning breakfast is also varied and delicious.  The location is directly above Dana Point Harbor and within walking distance of very good local restaurants.  Lovely rooms at reasonable prices.  Don't miss this gem.

We stayed at the Inn for our anniversary.  I have to say that this inn has it all.  Gracious innkeepers, beautiful, serene rooms, gorgeous views, bountiful, homemade delicious breakfast and a happy hour with wine, cheeses, fruit & other nibbles.  Perfection!  Treat yourself to a massage with Cathy & Barbara-you will be so relaxed!  Blue Lantern is our new go to for little breaks during the year.  You will not be disappointed!!!!

The Blue Lantern is a wonderful property and a great value.  Definitely get a room with balcony and a view!  The rooms are a little dated but cute and comfortable.  We really appreciated the bike rental, happy hour and included full breakfast.  Carmen was very helpful for suggestions of restaurants and activities.  Thank you for a great stay!

Right from the booking the staff were extremely friendly and helpful.  The views from the back were breathtaking of the harbour and hills being perched on top of the point.  They served an incredibly delicious hot/cold breakfast every morning (bread pudding and french toast to die for) that could keep you satisfied until the afternoon when the brought out the wine and appetizers.  Our room was spacious and homey with plenty of room for our family.  Overall great value for this boutique hotel. We will always call The Blue Lantern first if staying in the area.

My wife and I celebrated our 30th anniversary with a few short trips. One was a drive up the coast to Dana Point. Blue Lantern Inn was recommended for it's beautiful views, comfortable rooms and warmth. It didn't disappoint. When we called to ask about an early check in, Carmen checked on our room, called us back, and recommended local restaurants. We sat on the balcony and watched the sun go down, loved the huge jacuzzi tub, enjoyed the tasty happy hour and breakfast, and loved the location. This is a charming hotel and a great place to stay for a weary road warrior or a couple looking for a romantic getaway.

We stayed in late October 2016 ~ the property is beautiful and the staff is very helpful and hospitable!  There was a minor plumbing issue with our room when we arrived and they were very accommodating and apologetic and offered us a nice bottle of wine for our stay!  We appreciated the kindness and also all the suggestions for dinner and activities in the area!

You can't beat the view from the BL. We stayed in a city view but took full advantage of the outdoor patio seating for all guests.  Our friends, who stayed on the water side and had a deck, had great views of the harbor.  Second to the views was the extremely friendly and accommodating staff - desk, cleaning, cooking, etc. Those aside, the place needs some updating and it is way over priced.   A strip outlet for electric in the room because it lacks plugs. Weak wireless connectivity.  One waste basket in each room apparently to double as bathroom trash. A mysterious noise throughout the night - like an engine / generator that kept a light sleeper awake. A tiny fridge...so do not bring much take out, etc. back to the room.  Had it not been so expensive - you could perhaps get

Have you ever wished to stay at an old elegant inn on the East Coast that stood on the cliffs above the ocean, complete with telescope allowing you to view ships coming into harbor?  If you choose the Blue Lantern Inn you will be there except on the West Coast  This is a charming B&B with tasty breakfasts and bikes to let you wear off any extra calories.  At the end of the day you can leisurely enjoy treats and a glass of wine in front of the fireplace.

This location is a great romantic and comfortable place.  It is centrally located walking distance to various restaurants.  You can also bike or walk to the ocean and to Dana Point Harbor.  Get a balcony room for your best views

Summary Heading: Phenomenal view, spectacular service, awesome breakfast
Summary: Stayed for business, but the few free hours were very pleasant and energizing. The hotel provides free cruisers bikes, great healthy breakfast, evening cheese table with wine, very quiet rooms and the location couldn't be better. One of the best values I've been in.

My husband and I enjoyed a stay here while celebrating our nephew's wedding and my birthday.  We reserved a Pacific Edge room well in advance and were asked if we were celebrating a special occasion -- when I confirmed that we were the woman who completed our reservation said she'd ensure we had a nice room.  When we checked in we were given the keys to Room 302, which has an incredible view of Dana Point Harbor and the Pacific Ocean, and a balcony overlooking all that beauty.  Enjoying the balcony's scenery while we had coffee and tea in the morning and a glass of wine in the evening was a highlight of our stay.  For $10 the inn will bring a wonderful breakfast to your room and it's well worth it.  Although busy with family wedding festivities and reconnecting with SoCal

We have been to the Inn several times.  Have stayed in different rooms, all with an amazing views of Dana Point and the Pacific Ocean.  Every room has been wonderful.  Location is at the end of a cul de sac, so quiet and peaceful.  Afternoon wine and snacks are served and a breakfast in the morning.  Cookies are usually always available.  Fairly good restaurants are within walking distance for lunch or dinner.  Will definitely be going back for another special occasion.

This is the first place my wife & I stayed right after our wedding-- we had the perfect time! We stayed in a suite and the bathroom was almost as big as the bedroom-- had a jacuzzi tub, full shower, separate room for the toilet. The room was very clean, the property was peaceful, and bed was extremely comfortable. We loved our private porch on the 3rd floor that had an ocean view. Go here if you want somewhere that doesn't feel corporate but instead is home-y -- but you'll still get A+ treatment. Bobby in particular was a great representative of this hotel. Very friendly and helpful, I never once felt like I was putting him out when I asked for something special on the honeymoon... The breakfast they provide is very good quality, all the options you would expect in a nice hotel

We stayed on the third flour and the view was amazing.  The room is large with a fireplace and deck.  At night they have food and drinks-also includes a great breakfast. The lobby is also cozy with a fireplace.  They have bicycles for guests to use.

The room was quite attractive with fireplace, skylight in bathroom, and patio with ocean view. Staff was helpful, breakfast and Happy Hour food were tasty and varied. Plenty of restaurants close by, several within an easy walk.

My company booked this location for an annual meeting.  From the moment I arrived, this place exceeded all expectations.  Friendly staff, great food, beautiful location, and comfortable rooms.  The views from the rooms were spectacular.  We walked to dinner both nights to tasty restaurants.  Will definitely be back!

We just spent five wonderfult nights at the inn. We absolutely loved this place. Wonderful friendly staff and always very, very helpful. Our room had a balcony overlooking the harbor, fireplace, and huge jetted tub. Pefect location close to the harbor and we used the bikes to get where ever we needed to go. Breakfast was outstanding as well as the afternoon wine and cheese.

The Blue Lantern Inn has been one of my very favorite places.  I used to live in Dana Point so I often go back to visit friends.    Naturally when my mamma passed away, I wanted to stay in the wonderful calming Inn.  I brought my husband on this visit and it felt so good to get there! First we noticed the food was actually stale.  I shrugged that off as an aberation. Then we noticed that whereas the folks running the place used to be so kind and friendly, the atmosphere was sterile.  Not terrible, but not the warm, friendly service I have come to know.  We asked for a late check out (check in is $4pm and check out is noon).  I was writing my mamma's eulogy.  I was told the place was full and that all the maids left at 2pm.  I later learned that was a fib.  Why in the world

Summary Heading: Wonderful setting with intimate and personal attention
Summary: Loved this hotel and the view even had telescope in room!  It was a special occasion and we were greeted with champagne and chocolates in room.  Has evening happy hour with wine and appetizers!  You can walk to shops and wonderful near by restaurants!

Summary Heading: Another Delightful Stay at this great inn!
Summary: We returned to this spot for another visit, so you can conclude we really like it. It's a one of a kind place with wonderful music playing in the dining area. The afternoon wine and cheese is still very nice even though it closes too early. The staff are super friendly and the beds are quite comfy. The location can't be beat. Although this is a fantastic spot to relax and read, don't stay inside; get outdoors and explore Dana Point! One observation about our room this time: A person over 5' 7" can't see the top of their head in the bathroom mirror since it was mounted too low.

Summary Heading: Just like the pics online, better actually!
Summary: Fantastic stay- great value for the price! We loved the ocean view room, it was just like it looks on the website. The complimentary breakfast was delicious as well as everything at the afternoon wine and appetizer hour. The place is absolutely charming and lovely and we will definitely want to return!

We stayed October 25 for 4 nights in room 308.   I have to agree with all the great reviews of the Blue Lantern.  I would so recommend this place to any one looking for a tranquil getaway.  Just keep in mind this is a B&B not a resort.  We ran into a couple at breakfast who complained about the lack of  amenities such as a pool, which is  something you will  find at a resort.    Carmen at the desk was great,  and so are all the rest of the staff. The check in process was a breeze.  She was able to check us in early.  They will also make reservations at any place  for you,  and recommend restaurants and places to visit. The full breakfast and the afternoon wine reception was A plus.  Everything was replenished as needed.    Our room was very comfortable and quiet.  The Jacuzzi

We stayed here recently for 3 nights and I cannot recommend it highly enough. This was one of many places we stayed on our 3 week roadtrip and it was definitely our favourite. We had a ground floor (1st floor for Americans) room with a terrace and a fabulous view over the sea. The room was really comfortable, a place for both of us to sit, inside and out. Beautifully decorated. Large bathroom with a lovely spa bath and a large walk in shower. Everything that you need is provided, well almost... Take some binoculars so you can sit and while away some hours on the terrace looking out for whales!  The breakfasts were really good, a great selection and freshly made.  A lovely touch was the wine and nibbles available each day at 4, lovely to come back to if you've been out for

Often I put guests up at the Blue Lantern Inn or  I stay there when I need a break.  The BLI overlooks the Harbor and ocean and has specialty rooms that are cozy. Some have fireplaces which are great for winter evenings overlooking the ocean. Some have sitting areas outside and are private. Wine is served at Happy Hour and the Ladies who check you in are very helpful.  It is a Boutique Hotel that is booked early by people who know about it. Many do and many don't.  I tell my friends that if they will spend a little more they will have a great place to stay. I hope you come and relax in Dana Point on the bluff over the Harbor.  1980Ironman

We have stayed here several times, can't seem to get enough of this beautiful b&b! We always request the 3rd floor with a balcony overlooking the ocean,magnificent view and you can watch the sunrise in the morning, what a way to start your day. The spa tub is great, everything here is so peaceful and beautiful. Dana point has fabulous restaurants within walking distance, great getaway!

Summary Heading: Great location, breakfast, wine & hors d'eouvres
Summary: for Dana Point, very affordable when including location, free parking, great breakfast and Afternoon wine and hors d'oeuvres postcard process was nice unexpected perk; common areas provided ability for 4 couples to  comfortably reconnect and visit. Cannons, restaurant next door can be noisy room 204 had tree blocking view but not noise. noise stopped about 9ish the daily breakfast buffet was exceptional and having the option of breakfast in room/on the balcony was nice option-- the delivered breakfast was outstanding (quantity and quality) View of ocean institute, harbor breakwall and chart house  we really enjoyed having the wine available after the hors d'oeuvres were removed. Stairs to second floor. Elevator for basement (printer and fitness) 2 &3rd floor  Staff helpful

My daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights and it was heavenly.  The minute we walked into the lobby, we knew our trip to Dana Point would be relaxing and peaceful.  (The fact that we arrived during the wine and cheese reception after a delayed ride from Palm Springs didn't hurt, either!) Cameron, who checked us in, made wonderful recommendations for dinner and  for things to explore in the area.  Our bed was so comfortable! We enjoyed sitting out on a private patio and viewing the harbor every morning while we drank coffee.  I will definitely return!

Summary Heading: One night just so wasn't enough!
Summary: We only stayed one night here on the way to San Diego but I so wished we had been here longer. This the most charming place, in a perfect setting overlooking the harbour. We arrived early and went to ask reception if we could park in the car park whilst we wandered around town and had lunch, they couldn't have been more helpful and said of course and checked when our room would be ready which turned out to be earlier than expected.  We walked down to the harbour and wandered around the boats then had lunch before checking in. The room was gorgeous, 1st floor with amazing views and a delightful patio area overlooking the ocean. Fabulous bathroom with whirlpool bath and a v comfortable bed.   We indulged in wine and cheese before heading out to eat locally.  Everything about this

Summary Heading: Just as wonderful second time around...
Summary: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at Blue Lantern Inn two years ago. We returned for a few days this year and had another wonderful stay. Everything about this place is wonderful. It really is a delight to stay at and the staff are exceptional. A visit to Dana Point, staying at Blue Lantern Inn and enjoying the amazing views on their terrace really should be on your 'once in a lifetime list.'

Perfect place by the ocean to get away and relax. Rooms are nice and Inn is very quite and cozy. Inn over looks Dana Point harbor and is close to numerous shopping and restaurant locations. Inn has bikes to use for ride around the area, wine and snacks before dinner time and freshly made breakfast in the morning.

We were in San Diego for a few days and decided to extend our stay and drive up to the Blue Lantern Inn.  We knew the inn was full as it took many tries to find a room that was available for the weekend.  We had to pay full price,  but once we arrived and checked into our room we knew we were going to love our stay.  Our room was on the 2nd floor and was considered a harbor view with no balcony.  Our room was in the turret section and all the windows opened wide to a spectacular view of the harbor.  We were disappointed at first as we would not have a balcony but with this room it didn't matter.  We even slept with the windows open!  The evening reception starts at 4:30 pm with a choice of red and white wines.  There was cheese, crackers, olives, vegetables, and dip.  On the

We arrived early for check in and were offered tea and coffee while we waited for the room to be finished off so could check in at 2.30 instead of 4pm which was great did not have to fill an hour and half in. We received a bottle of wine which was a lovely touch to sit on the balcony of our beautiful room and enjoy the view.  The wine and cheese was a nice start to the evening.  Everything was great from the staff to the beautiful room. Another bonus no extra cost for parking.

Who would have known that Dana Point had such a lovely, intimate, pristine white inn with such romantic ocean-view balconies, comfy bathrobes, bathtubs for two, and sprawling king-size-bedded rooms with wing chairs?  And such a terrific, tasty, homemade hot breakfast, which kept flowing. We enjoyed every mouthful on the veranda. I highly recommend this charming hotel, especially after returning to Dana Point on the evening ferry from Catalina... it extends the romance of the island and provides a very soft landing back into the bustle of L.A.

My stay at the Blue Lantern Inn was centered around attending a wedding in the area.  I fell in love with this hotel as well as Dana Point!  The staff was Supreme!  All our needs were met with solutions and joy.  My room!!!  I had a room on the first floor.  Fireplace, two sinks, a large jetted tub, separate shower, king size bed!  I couldn't think of any amenity that wasn't provided.  Bottled water and canned soft drinks waiting for me in the refrigerator. All this and a birds eye perch over the Dana Point Marina!  Coffee on the patio amongst the flowers and the view of the Pacific Ocean was an excellent way to start my day.  Honestly, I can not say enough nice things about the hotel and its staff!

Summary Heading: Looking forward to heading there in November for our anniversary
Summary: Victorian look on the outside with everything you would expect from an east coast BnB. Great views, awesome staff, love the tea and baked goods in the am. If you are looking for a place to unplug for a few days this is the place for you. The Penthouse suite is sweet with its vaulted ceilings, fire place, jacuzzi tub and amazing views.

I don't get these negative reviews.  Do you see the views?  We checked out of the Marriott & moved here & were so much happier.  We travel extensively for business & stay in hotels & B & B's all the time.  I grew up in Dana Point & used to run by the hotel - it has the best location.  Sure, some of the furniture is worn, but for the price you pay - & the view - it's a great deal.  All the staff was gracious & we found it to be very peaceful.  Five restaurants within walking distance & never had to get in car.  We will stay here any time we're in town.

We are experienced B&B/Inn travelers and this was our first visit to the Blue Lantern Inn and it will not be our last.  The inn sits high on the cliffs above the Dana Point Marina so the views are blue water and sky everywhere including from the elevator to the 3rd floor. Our room had a "city view" which saves money but there are many places throughout the property to feel spoiled by that view--the breakfast room, the porch, through the front gate, and the gazebo on the side street.  Our room was large with a king bed and a big bathroom--love having 2 sinks and a skylight.  All areas are clean and cared for.  Afternoon happy hour veggies, cheese & crackers, & wines are continually replenished during the hour [unlike many places which put out the initial offering and that's it]

My wife and I decided to stay here over night for a wedding and as a late anniversary present to our selves. It was beautiful and immaculate from the lobby to the room. The people who worked there were hospitable and friendly. The view from the balcony just took my breath away. Especially during the day you can look over the pier. The room was beautiful and we were tempted to just blow off the wedding (not really) and just lock ourselves in the room. It is a lovely place and if you can afford it please stay here or one of their other sister locations. There is even one in Claremont which is another favorite little town of mine. Please visit!!

Summary Heading: Like New England on the West Coast!
Summary: On first arriving into The Lantern District of Dana Point, you get a feel like you are on Cape Cod!   The Inn in so welcoming and warm; it is a magical experience just walking through the door.  The feel is like you are staying as a guest in a beautiful home on the water.  The rooms are so clean and fresh with all that you need for a comfortable stay! The view from our "partial ocean view" room was spectacular, and sitting on the veranda was perfectly relaxing!  The breakfasts in the morning are wonderful!  More than one can expect, and the evening cocktail hour is something to look forward to before heading out or just staying put while enjoying the beautiful front porch with a glass of wine.  The surrounding area is perfect for walking to shops and restaurants.  There are many

We love the Blue Lantern Inn and the Four Sisters group of inns.  This was our second visit and we hope to make many more visits in the future. We came for the Laguna Beach art festival and after spending time with the crowds in Laguna we were very happy to come back to the peacefulness and charm of the Blue Latern Inn.  Everything was perfect.  The staff was warm and very helpful.  The breakfasts were great!

This hotel has lovely modern rooms with very comfortable beds in a quiet location. It is about 2 miles South of Laguna Beach so if you want to stay in that hubbub then this hotel is not for you, but if you don't mind the few minutes drive, the price is reasonable, the free breakfast is nice , the staff is very nice, and they lend you beach chairs and beach towels.  Make sure you get a room with at least a partial ocean view, it is much nicer than looking at the parking lot.  While the tubs have jacuzzis there is no pool.

Summary Heading: A beautiful and charming hotel and exquisite location
Summary: We had family stay at the Blue Lantern Inn when we "overflowed" our townhouse.  It is very charming and close to a pier with restaurants, boating and surfing nearby.  There are some walks and hikes along nearby coastal spots and for kids (and adults) it if fun to look for shells and sea life close up.    In addition, Dana Point is a charming small coastal town with several very good restaurants conveniently located.

What's not to love? The location, the atmosphere, the view, the friendly and peaceful ambiance? Oh and don't forget about those cute beach cruisers to borrow for a ride!   My husband and I stayed here as a component to a birthday surprise for him when we were visiting the area from out of town. From Canada actually. I'm originally from San Diego and thought I'd surprise him with a jaunt up the coast. This location didn't fail us and we had a lovely time.  I do believe that a chunk of my rating is due to our room itself. We stayed in a Pacific Edge room which has the balcony and ocean/harbor view all in one. I probably wouldn't have given it a five if we had only stayed in a Street View, which is really a parking lot view. If you are going to stay here, it would make sense to

We love, love, love the Blue Lantern Inn. The location is perfect with panoramic views of the Pacific Ocean, harbor, lagoon and park. It's within walking distance of the harbor, restaurants & shops. The rooms are tastefully decorated, clean & comfortable. The staff is always friendly & helpful. They serve a nice buffet breakfast & happy hour with wine & hors d'oeuvres.  This is one of our favorite local get-a-ways.

We chose the Blue Lantern Inn because of it's proximity to the venue for a wedding we attended. It was the best decision we made and we were extremely comfortable in Room 201. It has the best view of the area. Loved everything about our stay - The Inn, the staff, the food service, the location. Simply the best!

This was our first visit to Blue Lantern in Dana Point.  All of my expectations were met.  We were graciously greeted upon arrival and the same attitude was exhibited by the entire staff.   We were treated as though we were truly their house guests.  Tiffany went out of her way each evening to personalize our visit.  She prepared a box breakfast in the evening for our morning excursion to Catalina.   Our room was beautifully appointed with a wonderful harbor view.  We will definitely make Blue Lantern Inn our destination for future visits.

If you want fabulous views, this one has the most incredible view of the Dana Point Harbor.  Also, we were able to walk to the Charthouse for dinner !  Our room was huge and had a terrific terrace to sip wine and enjoy the amazing views and weather.  Our room was 101 and can't wait to go back.  Also, compolimentary breakfast!

The inn is absolutely beautiful and the views are amazing.  Breakfast was a full breakfast, not just continental. I can't say enough good things about this place.  The staff was very helpful and friendly. I hated to leave but I will be back.

Spent 2 nights here in June and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The only downside was the fact that their is no pool. The view is lovely, the room comfortable and spotless, the area around has plenty of dining out choices and the breakfast was more than adequate. Would be happy to return if we are ever in the area again.

This is a beautiful B&B. You are looked after by lovely welcoming people from the moment you arrive. The bikes are great fun and a nice way to see Dana point after the buffet breakfast . And there are also delicious wine and nibbles in the afternoon. The ambience of the hotel is wonderful and the rooms don't disappoint. They are pretty and romantic and we had a beautiful view from our balcony. We thoroughly enjoyed our 3 nights at the blue lantern inn and highly recommend it.

Summary Heading: Great location, comfortable, lacking a little Four Sisters charm.
Summary: Had previously stayed at Santa Cruz and Santa Monica in Four Sisters properties and loved the small boutique, chilled and friendly nature of both those properties. So.. the Blue Lantern is a much larger and less friendly property when compared to the others. We lined up to check in and got a robotic and disinterested greeting from the young lady, fist impressions count...  Afternoon nibbles and wine was funny as my wife was elbowed out of the way by an octogenerian keen to refill their glass before the flagon emptied!  Breakfast was fine, nothing special and a grumpy cook who did not like questions about gluten.  Having said all that the location is superb with views over the harbour. Our room, a Harbour View was spacious, clean and very comfortable. It's close to many eating

Have stayed at least 10 times during past decade and plan to continue coming back.  The view of the harbor and ocean is fabulous.  Surrounding area is great for touring and beaches.  Many great dinner places are within walking distance.  The only minor issue we had was with the breakfast staff not being able to keep up with the food demand.  Other than that, pure joy!

This is a lovely inn. It's styled as a large blue house with a quaint surround porch. I've stayed here three times with my sweetheart and each time is as special as the next. Each bathroom has a large two person jetted bathtub, which is amazing for romantic nights. The rooms are all cozy and clean. They come with a fridge, WiFi, soft beds, and a gas fireplace.  I would stay here again in a heart beat. It's part of the four sisters Inn, which is a quality program.  It's also close to my favorite restaurant, Luciana's Ristorante. Possibly the best Italian food I've had since my time in Florence. It's walking distance from the inn, literally two blocks. Definitely try their veal ravioli and eggplant lasagna.

Fourth time at the Blue Lantern Inn in Dana Point;  Love it as a quick romantic get away.  It overlooks Dana Point Harbor and is next door to Cannons Restaurant.  The hotel is awesome, appearance of an old house, but as up to date as it can be inside.  Each room is special, AC, refrigerators, Wi-Fi, fireplaces, giant Jacuzzi tubs, all marble and tile with great amenities.  We have had tower rooms and ground floor with patios, we prefer the bottom with the patio for easy access and the comfort of the large patio.  Great wine and happy hour, fabulous breakfast every morning, close to everything in Dana Point, with free bicycles for the guest (which need updating btw).  You can walk to dinner at Cannons or the Dana Point Chart House (my favorite!) - a deli just up the street , and

The location and hotel were awesome.   The only issue we had (not that bad) was the staff and breakfast. The staff was not very accommodating and the breakfast was mediocre at best.   It's worth doing but I wouldn't go more than once.

Wife and I just returned from 3 wonderful nights at this premier boutique hotel. Our Pacific Edge room was beautifully furnished with a spa tub and separate shower and a balcony view of the harbor and ocean that was spectacular. The staff can't do enough to make their guests feel at home. Breakfast and afternoon wine and cheese are included, parking is free and plentiful, and they even provide loaner bicycles if that is your pleasure. If your not a B and B person you will still love this place as it is really a boutique hotel or inn and not a traditional bed and breakfast. Would return here without a doubt if visiting the area again.

I had a second floor, Pacific View room. After a long hot drive, I was able to open all three of the windows and welcome in the sea breeze.   The bathroom! Wow! Double sinks, a jet tub, a stand up shower, and then another counter with a mirror.    The room came with two free water bottles, a can of Coke, and two Kuerig pods of coffee. There was also a single brew Kuerig in the room.   The breakfast was wonderful. Scone sandwich made with fresh scones, an egg, Canadian Bacon, and cheddar cheese. There was also cooked potatoes, hearty porridge, cut fruit salad, baked goods, and other goodies.    I took it back up to my room and ate it on my private balcony overlooking the harbor.   Overall it was amazing place! Last awesome piece is check is at 12 which allowed a nice relaxed to

Summary Heading: Great place for a family reunion
Summary: Everyone in the family down to the great grandchildren from 5 states are here for a big family reunion. The Blue Lantern is a great place with breakfast, hot and cold items, a afternoon happy hour and great coffee. They overlook Dana Point Harbor with fantastic views,  breezes and nice hiking trails in walking distance. Sandwich and fine dining within a short walk or short drive

My husband isn't a fan of B&B's, but this won him over.  The room was very nice, with a view of Dana Point Harbor.  The breakfasts were delicious, and the daily happy hour was relaxing and good.  There's outside seating overlooking the cliffs to the marina, which was very nice for long talks and bird watching.  We like firm beds, but the bed was too soft for us.

We spent three nights at the Blue Lantern Inn.What a delightful place to spend some free time. The rooms were nicely appointed, the breakfast allowed many choices, and the afternoon wine and cheese were a welcoming sight after a day of hiking and whale watching. The staff was eager to please and made us feel most welcome. We highly recommend a stay at Blue Lantern Inn!

My fiancé and I had the opportunity to stay here for a night while vacationing in CA...and I wish we could have stayed longer. The women at the desk couldn't have been nicer & more accommodating, and really made us feel at home. We borrowed the Inn's bikes and rode to the top of the street, locked them up at the nature trail, and hiked to see the sunset. The free wine and hors d'oeuvres were fantastic, the views from rm 102 were second to none, and the gas fireplace, jacuzzi tub, and comfy bed were all luxurious and perfect. We didn't want to leave! Not to mention the breakfast was generous and the mushroom quiche delicious! We can't wait to come back longer.

I took my boyfriend here for his bday and 1 night, 2 days was not enough. This B&B is THE cutest and most original place. First off, if you're a spontaneous person, think about doing their carpe diem deal which is where you call them that morning and see if they have any deals. My boyfriend and I got a huge steal on a room with a view of the water on the second floor. We partook on their FREE wine, cheese, fruits, and cracker happy hour along with many of their other guests. We sat outside with the view of the water and it was very luxurious. We did a quick 5 min drive to the water where we went kayaking and enjoyed our time together. The room was beautiful from their little welcome note with both our names, to the jacuzzi tub, the most softest throw blanket from pottery barn,

Summary Heading: Perfect overnight birthday getaway for Orange County locals
Summary: My husband and I went to the Blue Lantern Inn to celebrate my 30th birthday. We enjoyed the delicious evening appetizers (be sure to get there by 5:30 pm to enjoy), then headed to dinner at nearby Schwack's burgers, recommended by the woman at the front desk. We appreciated that the TV has many channels and a "guide" feature to be able to tell what's on.   Breakfast in the morning was plentiful and delicious. The Inn has a number of extra touches like complimentary newspapers and snacks and a small stash of board games. Directly outside the inn is a gazebo with a wonderful view of the harbor area below. I loved the huge in-room jacuzzi bathtub.   This was a perfect getaway for us - though we live in the Orange County area, we don't often frequent Dana Point. The inn was

We searched for a quiet, comfortable inn in Orange County and were so happy at the  Blue Lantern that we keep coming back! Super clean, perfectly situated within walking distance of restaurants, the harbor and a fabulous nature center and beach. The breakfast buffet is great and always includes fresh fruit, an egg dish, potatoes and bacon or sausage. The rooms are very quiet and the staff is terrific. We could not ask for anything more.

We spent a delightful night at the Blue Lantern Inn celebrating a special occasion. We stayed in a "Pacific Edge room" on the first floor with a patio out to the sea. It was very nice with a fireplace, huge bathroom with jetted tub, and all sorts of amenities like sodas in the fridge and bottles of water.  Really enjoyed the wine and cheese hour (spoiled our dinner!) and breakfast was very nice as well with quiches and corned beef hash.  Very relaxing and quiet place!!

This is our third stay at the Four Sisters inn and we were  again delighted . Very relaxing - great breakfast menus and the wine and cheese in the afternoon is a fun treat . The view of the harbor is wonderful. Walking distance to restaurants, the beach  and several nature trails. Though it isn't far off of Coast Hwy. it feels like it.

The Blue Lantern was the perfect place to spend a weekend away, from the beautifully appointed room with an incredible view, to the platter of warm cookies waiting in the lobby at night.    There is a walkway along the cliffs leading down to the marina just two blocks down the street.   We will be back.

Summary Heading: Excellent location...fabulous view...great service. A delight!
Summary: We were looking for an experience similar to Santa Barbara, but closer to our home base. The Blue Lantern Inn in Dana Point was an excellent choice. We enjoyed kayaking, stand-up paddling, and the natural areas and beaches near the Inn...all within walking distance! The view from our room was perfect...and at night, using their telescope, we are certain that we could see Jupiter!  The breakfast was wonderful, with lots of healthy choices. Also, the Inn has a lot room inside and out, and across the street in a harbor view public gazebo where we could relax, practice our music (acoustic) and socialize with other guests. This is a very nice property, and we will return.

The blue Lantern Inn certainly knows how to provide perfect hospitality.  My wife and I stayed for a couple of nights for our wedding anniversary and were impressed how comfortable and welcomed we felt.  These people do an extraordinarily good job.

We had the best room in the hotel, no 301 with an octagonal voted ceiling and a balcony.  Room was spacious and comfy, but it could have done with a good clean in the pitch of the roof and round the skirting boards.  Breakfast was a little disappointing with half cooked hash browns, and overlooked bacon.  The air conditioning was ver noise too.  Other than that the staff were really lovely and the location fabulous.  Look out for humming bids on the roses!

Summary Heading: Blue Lantern Inn Dana Point - A special place
Summary: The Blue Lantern Inn Dana Point is a wonderful property in Orange County, California.  The staff is warm, courteous, attentive and professional.  The rooms are spacious, well appointed, quiet and very comfortable.  The dining area is quite large with oversized windows that overlook the marina and Pacific Ocean.  The Cliffside views of the marina and Pacific are breathtaking.    The location is walking distance to restaurants, stunning nature/beach walks, coffee shops and cafes.  The breakfast buffet has many options both hot and cold and the afternoon happy hour is a very nice treat.  I required several extended stays and the staff treated us like family - exceeding our expectations in countless ways.    I highly recommend The Blue Lantern Inn and would not hesitate to stay

We were in a room on the third floor facing the marina and ocean to the left and a two lane winding road on the right.  The view was spectacular and mind you...this wasn't the best view.     Brittany, Leslie and Carmen (hope I have the names right) were friendly and always helpful!  Our first day we were tired from travel and missed the evening wine and cheese.  Brittany offered to prepare a plate for us and we could help ourselves to wine.  This may be the policy of the Inn, but we would have never known.  She could have simply apologized and had us help ourselves to wine.  But she didn't, she went the extra mile.  This was the norm with the employees of this Inn - always ready to help.   Breakfast was tasty with a nice variety and the room was nice and clean.  For a little

Spent 2 nights here early March.  A classy B+B that is one of the Four Sisters Inns.  You know what you can expect- elegance, cleanliness, charm, a comfortable and well appointed room, cozy common areas, a delicious breakfast and wine and cheese in the afternoon.   The location is superb with a magnificent view over the harbour and the Pacific.   In walking distance of many restaurants and paths along the harbour front.   Wouldn't hesitate to come back again the next time I pass through this way.

A great place to stay for an exceptional ocean view. Nice location for easy access to area surroundings. The rooms are quite nice with plenty of amenities, but one negative is that it had no shade or curtains which made it exceptionally bright in the early hours when you want to sleep in. Also, during our stay there was two weddings on different days and a restaurant next door. This made it a bit noisier then most similar type places.

I have tried to reserve a room here a couple of times but at the last minute, it never worked out. This time with a little advanced notice I was able to get a Pacific view room. The hotel sits at the end of a cul de sac up on a bluff overlooking the harbor and ocean. The room was clean, nicely decorated and updated. Bathroom had a jetted tub and a large shower. Check in was quick and friendly. Breakfast was included but I think I would eat there again. Average and nothing special. There are many options close by.  Definitely will book again.

Beautifully situated on a promontory overlooking Dana Point Harbor and the Pacific ocean the Blue Lantern Inn is a very special destination. Sumptuous rooms with views forever, fireplaces, balconies, comfy beds and thick terry cloth robes place us in the lap of luxury. The tasty hors d' oeuvres and wine each late afternoon and the delicious, bountiful fresh cooked breakfast each morning top off a delightful experience each visit.

Summary Heading: Excellent Location and Experience - First Time at the Inn
Summary: The was our first time at the Blue Lantern Inn and we were celebrating our 31st wedding anniversary.  Everyone at the front counter was happy and smiling, and we enjoyed our stay.  The staff was very pleasant when asking questions and went out of their way to make sure we had a great experience.  Room was excellent, well maintained, loved the fireplace and Keurig coffee maker in the morning.  Shower was huge and very clean.  The entire room was very clean and we had no problems or complaints.  Our room overlooked the Dana Point Harbor and what a view.  Very comfortable patio chairs outside on the patio.  Best room I'm ever stayed in.

My husband and I enjoyed a two night stay before heading over to Catalina Island on Easter weekend.. Having never been to Dana Point we didn't know what to expect. The Inn was just marvelous. So Relaxing. The views are incredible. The staff very friendly. The room amenities are very convenient, robes ,soft drinks, coffee, and  water. The bed was very comfortable.  There is a big Jacuzzi tub that I chose not to use due to the drought but it looked nice.. Breakfast was delicious and had a good variety of both hot and cold items....all made fresh! Love the afternoon wine and cheese...It gave us a chance to just sit back and relax on our patio. Loved it so much we have booked a long weekend over Thanksgiving for ourselves and another couple.

My wife and I stayed in Room 201 again.   It has a wonderful balcony and view of the harbor.    Simply a perfect place to relax and recharge.    Convenient walk to two nice restaurants (Cannons and The Chart House.)    We will be back.

Summary Heading: Another wonderful experience at the Blue Lantern Inn
Summary: This is our sixth or seventh trip to the Blue Lantern.  The view from this Four Sister property rivals Cannes in France; the marina in the morning wakes up in precious movement and we watch in awe.  The property is lovely and the staff is so friendly and provide service in a family type of way.  We love the professional way everything happens and yet they are old friends.  This is our number one place to visit - and Disneyland is just down the road!

I read about the Blue Lantern Inn on Travel and Leisures best unknown places to stay with a view and was intrigued and booked for 3 nights.  The location was east to find and parking was easy too.  The check inn was smooth and we found the room clean and large with comfy queen beds, a fireplace and a patio with a gorgeous view.  It was very quiet in the mornings and the patio afforded an endless view of the locals streaming down the hill to paddle board.  The free breakfast and drinks in the fridge were a nice touch.  The bathroom was nice - tub/shower combo was a bit steep and could be hard for someone with limited dexterity to navigate.  We had a great visit with wonderful service and loved the location.

Summary Heading: The perfect place for my daughter and me!
Summary: My adult daughter and I stayed at the Inn for one night on our way to LA. What a great spot!  We arrived a little early; thus our room was not quite ready. The view from the Inn's patio - see below - is heavenly. We had a chilled bottle of wine with us, so I somewhat timidly asked the desk clerk if we could drink it on the patio. Of course - and she found me an opener and glasses.  Our room was lovely, lots of wonderful detail. Unlike so many other places, the Inn does not charge for WiFi or parking or any sort of resort fee. And the breakfast was also included, which was fabulous.   We were able to walk to the Chart House for dinner but there wasn't much else in walking distance. Uber was very responsive and, of course, very reasonably priced.   I'm not a B&B person generally,

Summary Heading: Nice situation, good room but lousy wine
Summary: Our second Four Sisters property. Nice staff and room. Was rather hot so needed air con in March! Breakfast quickly went cold. Big spread of food at 4.30 pm so if you had lunch or are having dinner a strange time for us Brits. However wine was truly awful - bulk hotel supply apparently. Other guests very much kept to themselves, whereas other similar places tended to chat.

Summary Heading: Perfect stay, Staff professional and friendly
Summary: I spend half of my life in Hotels all around the world. This particular hotel is on my top 10. Quiet, clean, cosy, well designed! The staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast delicious with a splendid view. I appreciate the wine tasting in the evening also.  This hotel is my little paradise on earth

I had read some negative reviews before we arrived so I was little concerned, but every place has some negatives it seems, so we took a chance, and I wasn't disappointed at all. The rooms are large, the bed was comfortable, and our room was right off a patio where we sat and read and looked at the ocean. Very relaxing. Breakfast didn't wow me, but it's as good as I've ever gotten without staying at a real B&B, much better than your typical Marriott/Hilton breakfast. The evening wine and cheese appetizers were also good, with crackers, dips, olives, and other snack foods. My only caveat is that the "ocean view" is really no different from the "harbor view". The way the inn is situated you're going to see the same amount of ocean either way. If I had it to do over I'd have booked

We only stayed at Blue Lantern for one night but wished we had stayed much longer. The room was clean and big and very quiet. The Pacific View room was great. Also the champagne made the entire stay magical!

This is A terrific location with a great waitstaff. Snacks are excellent. People at the front desk were friendly and great. Go for a walk and take in all of the sites! Lights are provided which was fun as well. The lobby is spacious and has a warmth - even a fireplace!

Stayed here for over Christmas weekend because family lives in Dana Point. Room and bed were very comfortable and breakfast Christmas morning was wonderful. Staff seemed a bit unorganized as we had a couple of requests and each time we tried to get them settled we spoke with a different person who, apparently,  hadn't communicated with anyone else.   Our rooms were "city view," which meant overlooking the parking lot. If you're going to be spending time at the hotel or in your room, get an ocean view room.  Lovely location and charming hotel--would be very romantic for a honeymoon or anniversary celebration.

Spent 3 nights in this lovely inn. The views from our room of the Pacific were breathtaking. The room was large and comfortable, with a jacuzzi and huge shower in the bathroom.  We also had a private patio. We enjoyed the generous breakfasts and happy hour, which included wine and hors d'oeuvres. The staff made helpful suggestions for local restaurants and even made reservations for us. It was a great getaway.

Summary Heading: Great place but disappointed in food
Summary: My wife and I recently spent two nights here.  The facilities are very nice, the ocean views (we stayed in the Tower) were spectacular, and the staff could not have been more pleasant and helpful.  It's location allows for easy walks to several good restaurants.  However, a major disappointment was the food.  The brochure portrays a magnificent array of fine dishes for both the complimentary breakfast and late afternoon happy hour (good red and white wine).  Our first morning, the buffet breakfast was very ordinary --- including scrambled eggs left too long on the warming platter.  The second morning, there were poached eggs, but at 830 am, all of the eggs were essentially hard-boiled --- again left far too long on the warming platter.  At $400+ a night, the food for breakfast

Summary Heading: Superb views, clean hotel, free happy hour, bikes to use.
Summary: Stayed with my sister in this very nice hotel. We had a room with the best view of the harbor. We could sit out on our deck and watch boats come in and out of the harbor. The bathroom was spacious as was the bedroom. During happy hour they have a buffet of appetizers and a choice of white or red wine - which is really delicious. The patio area is on the ground level surrounded by colorful plants. There are several bicycles you can use to peruse the area. The swimming beach is a trek down the hill or in the car. I brought my SUP and drove it down the hill to launch in the bay beach and into the harbor.

My husband and I enjoyed a relaxing overnight without our kids. We had a room with a balcony overlooking the marina. The view was gorgeous! We enjoyed sitting on our balcony watching the rain. The wine and cheese reception was great. The breakfast was delicious. We also really enjoyed the fireplace and jacuzzi tub in the large bathroom. We can't wait to go back, hopefully soon!

I selected this hotel based on its location.  I wanted a relaxing respite to unwind after a hectic business schedule during the day. I enjoyed the wide variety of afternoon snacks served with wine until 530. The hours for both breakfast and the wine are more suited towards leisure travelers.  Breakfast starts at 8, too late for me to enjoy. The rooms were very clean and the amenities modern. The cozy gas fireplace and the pipeless Whirlpool tub enjoyed were relaxing.  The in room fridge and complementary bottled water, quality pod coffee and tea republic offerings were a nice touch.  Free beach cruiser rental first come first serve .  I visited during the week and did not experience any issues with noise from the restaurant next door as others have commented on.  Based on trip

We spent a week here and it was great! The room was a Pacific View edge room and we had perfect views of the harbor and ocean. We were on the second floor and had a lovely balcony where we could watch the sun come up over the harbor and set on the Pacific Ocean. The inn is quaint, clean and well managed. Tea and coffe are readily available in the lobby all day and they serve a delicious and fresh breakfast buffet. They always let me warm up my tea in the microwave they have in their main kitchen.  In  the afternoon they serve wine and appetizers...while this is nice you will be better served to venture out to any number of nearby excellent restaurants. There are numerous excellent walking options right from the inn. They even provided us a surprise bottle of champagne on our

Blue Lantern Inn is quaint, quiet, with good breakfast and afternoon complimentary wine and cheese, beautiful view, great walking trails, lovely rooms, free bikes, near restaurants, lots of beach nearby to walk on.

The Blue Lantern Inn is the kind of place that you don’t want people to know about because it is so special.  It is set on a bluff overlooking Dana Point. The location is spectacular and the inn is very charming.  We were there for one night and weren’t able to get a room overlooking the water, but our room was beautifully appointed and we slept like babies.  The breakfast and evening wine/hors d’oeuvres are delicious and the staff is wonderful. We wish we could have stayed longer.

We had an incredible time at The Blue Lantern Inn. The location is beautiful, every detail of the décor is impeccable,  the staff is friendly and helpful, breakfast and afternoon wine and Hors D'Oeuvres were wonderful. My wife and I both agree we will have to visit the Blue Lantern again.

Love this place and the beautiful view! Also, breakfast is awesome. . .Chart house is within walking distance, but you will be so full from happy hour, you might not go!  Not a bad room in the place.  The harbor view rooms are a great value and you get nothing but sun which is lovely in the winter.

When we came to Dana point we were unsure of the place  but its small heritage boutique hotel. A real gem & sight for sour eyed travellers...  The location is beautifull right overlooking the bay.  Only thing beware they need to be informed before hand for dinner but there are plenary of good restaurants around...

Summary Heading: Frequent guest...feels like a second home
Summary: For the past year and half, my husband and I have been building a home in Dana Point.  We currently live over four hours away. I have been traveling to Dana Point every two to three weeks and have ALWAYS stayed at the Blue Lantern Inn except for one time when I tried the Marriot. The Marriot is a nice resort but one incurs the cost of resort fees and parking fees.  Plus, a daily newspaper,  bicycles to use, board games to play, sodas, an evening reception and morning breakfast is not included as it is at The Blue Lantern.  The Blue Lantern is in a secluded spot, but within walking distance of restaurants and public coastal pathways for a wonderful sight seeing walks in both directions.  The innkeepers  are very nice, welcoming and informative.  There are three floors with an

Came here with our friends from LA for a 2 day visit really enjoyed our stay the view over the harbour was fantastic and the rooms were also good a nice touch was the afternoon tea with wine sat looking over the harbour and at night the lights were impressive overall an excellent place to have a relaxing stay away

Summary Heading: Best hotel all-around on our California vacation
Summary: The location of the hotel is wonderful, overlooking Dana Point Harbor and the beautiful Pacific coastline. Our room was large with a great view from the small private patio.  The bed was very comfortable and everything was clean and fresh.  The staff is very courteous, the breakfast was very good every morning. We spent three weeks in hotels from San Diego to Carmel and this was the best!  We will certainly be back and we highly recommend it.

What a lovely, friendly place. We had a warm welcome from Lin and staff. We arrived early and we were offered coffee and cookies whilst our room was prepared. We did not have to wait long even though we were 2 hours too soon! The spacious rooms had fireplaces and balconies with good views. Bathrooms were large too with bath and shower, complete with nice toiletries. White fluffy towels and robes were provided, although no slippers. We were offered wine and canapés in the afternoon that were really tasty and varied. A good continental breakfast was included in the price, as was parking. We felt it was good value. We asked Lin to book a local restaurant that she recommended and had a delightful evening, complete with personalised menu, great food and a yummy free dessert. The Blue

My daughter and I stayed for 4 nights.  Our room was a good size, with a lovely balcony overlooking the harbor.  The beds were comfortable, and the room was clean.  The bathroom was large, but not a lot of room on the vanity.  The sinks were quite large.  Also, the shower was in the jacuzzi tub, and was not easy to get in  and out of.  All was clean and well taken care of.  One complaint, is the only mirror was in the bathroom.  Should have a mirror either on the closet door, or on the wall above the desk.  Especially when one of us was in the shower, the other had to wait to do her makeup until the other showered.  If there was another mirror with plugs I could have done my hair and make up in the room.  The breakfasts were good.  Not outstanding.  I found we had to wait for

Beautiful view out over lovely Dana Point Harbor. We stayed in the tower suite and it was amazing. Gorgeous 4 poster bed with lots of pillows and a fireplace. Felt totally pampered. There is a nice walk through the park next door down to the shops. Definitely recommend!

Summary Heading: sublimely relaxed hotel and amazing location combined
Summary: amidst  the hustle and bustle of Orange County this is a real oasis of calm and tranquillity. Great location on the hill above the Dana Point marina and with novel touches like free wine and snacks of an afternoon this was a great hotel for the area and amazing value for money as well

WOW!!!!  I called for the Carpe Diem rate and was offered the 3rd floor tower suite for $200.  Since it's usually goes for $450 of course I said yes.  When we stay in hotels we open the door, drop off our things and go exploring the area.  Once we opened the door to our suite I took one look around and never wanted to leave!!!!! The balcony offers a 180 degree view of the ocean and harbor.  So gorgeous. Lots of windows in the room which all offer breathtaking views.  Even views from the spa tub and shower were spectacular!!!!  The king sized bed was so comfortable.   The managers reception was nice and the buffet breakfast was good.  Tea, coffee and cookies offered throughout the day.  Staff was very pleasant.  My only complaint was that we had to leave.

Summary Heading: It doesn't get any better than this....
Summary: Outstanding!  My family stayed here for my son's wedding at the Ritz Carlton.  The staff was extremely accommodating for all of us (6 rooms).  My parents and my sister and her husband stayed in the Pacific Edge rooms.  The views were great, rooms very clean, and the decor was inviting.  My husband and I stayed in the Tower Suite overlooking the harbor and park below.  We loved the telescope and tried looking for seals.  The afternoon refreshments and cookies were a welcome treat.  Each morning the inn provided a buffet breakfast with a special entree.  Would I stay here again? Absolutely.  The Dana Point area was darling and fun to explore.  Also, I preferred staying here vs. The Ritz in Laguna Beach.  Hands down! (I am late in writing this review as the wedding was in May 2014.

Stayed here for my sons wedding and what a great place. Spectacular views of the pacific and magnificent sunsets every night. The staff is so friendly.  They will attend to your ever need as if they wanted you to be completely satisfied. A little pricey but for a wedding or a weekend getaway it is perfect.

We were warmly greeted as we checked in! All the staff we encountered were friendly. The view of the Marina was beautiful! The bed was comfortable. Some of the carpet and furnishings seem worn in the halls and open areas. Our room was very clean. The staff go out of their way to be helpful and made our stay enjoyable! Very impressed by the staff!

Summary Heading: Wonderful view! Overall, a pleasant stay.
Summary: We booked one of the rooms that had a balcony and partial ocean view. The view from the balcony was amazing! However, it was a little noisy in our balcony because the inn was right next to a restaurant. You can definitely hear the noisy people who are seated outside the restaurant- even on a Monday night. The room was clean, but the design was a little outdated. The bathroom was really spacious. The evening drinks and appetizers was nice. We enjoyed it while seated outside the main lobby, with the nice ocean breeze blowing by. The breakfast selection was great. The front desk people were polite, but they did not seem warm or friendly. Overall, we had a good experience, and we would probably stay here again when visiting the area.

Summary Heading: A lovely inn with a magnificent view
Summary: We really enjoyed our weekend getaway at this place.  They work very hard to please.  We had a suite with a large balcony facing the Dana Point Harbor.  Lovely!!!!  There was chilled Champgane and some chocolates waiting (I beve they come with all suites).  The room was large and very clean.  The bed and sheets were amazing.  We very muche njoyed the cheese, veggies and wine each evening.....we would take it up to enjoy privately on our large balcony.  We were still on Eastern time, and early to rise (in time to get coffee from the lobby and sit on our balcony to watch the sunrise and watch the paddle boarders on Baby Beach), so after our coffee, we opted to drive to Stacks ....just down the road....for breakfast.  We really enjoyed it, although it appeared that the breakfast at

Friendly, welcoming staff! Lovely afternoon wine and cheese hour. Take your wine outside and enjoy the beautiful view of the harbor.  Our room was very clean and we had a lovely little porch that overlooked the harbor.  I must admit, breakfast was a bit underwhelming, but I wouldn't let that keep me from staying here again!

What a lovely place this is, perched on top of the cliffs, gorgeous views of Dana Point Harbour, such a refreshing change from the big chain hotels.  The receptionists were really friendly and welcoming as we checked in, you really felt relaxed and comfortable in this place.  Our room was a delight, loved it, we had a huge bathroom with a sink and tub in one part and another sink and shower in a separate room.  The bedroom had New England type furnishings with a fireplace and a really comfy bed.  We were on the first floor with access to a private patio, leading on to a larger patio with chairs and gorgeous views.  We walked down into Dana Point via a park, this took around 25 minutes (longer coming back uphill) it was a pleasant walk though.  Found a nice little bar on the

This place is a very well maintained B&B.  Not a B&B out of a home, this place was purpose built for this use.  Rooms overlooking the harbor are more. Prices go up for weekends but are reasonable compared to local resorts. there is no pool.  Wine cheese in lobby every afternoon. Breakfast changes every day & very good.  They have some free bicycles to use to cruise around.  There is a nice overlook just outside at end of Blue Lantern St as well as a deck overlooking the ocean & harbor.  Just next door is a good seafood restaurant, Cannons.  Lots of other good places within easy walking distance.  Rooms are comfortable but AC is a little loud.  Good spa bathtub in room.   Massage appointments are available.  If view isn't an issue opt for room by parking lot.  Parking is free in

A great place to stay in Dana Point.  I stayed here because I a quick business meeting at the Four Seasons.  The room was significantly less and the staff was extraordinarily friendly.  It was within a 3 minute walk to the Chart House restaurant.  A great view of the harbor.

Summary Heading: Such a homey gem of a place
Summary: Stayed at BLI for a family reunion get together.  It was so homey comfy & I felt so relaxed. The beds contributed to that relaxed feel. The (included) breakfast was awesome, the view stellar, and the staff very welcoming. Next time....I'm so there!

Whether you're a local or enjoying a week-long vacation the Blue Lantern Innprovides a much needed break from the hussle of SoCal. When you arrive, everything just seems to slow down. The rooms are nicely outfitted and most include a fireplace and jacuzzi tub. The innkeepers are very friendly and can provide you with great recommendations for nearby restaurants and activities. The views from the numerous patios are amazing and they even have an afternoon social complete with wine, cheese, cookies, fruit, and coffee. After a day of sightseeing, it's nice to come back, enjoy a snack downstairs, and then take a walk through the neighborhoods surrounding the inn. Another great thing about the Blue Lantern is that the prices are inclusive of breakfast, parking, and other fees (except

Quiet hotel with an incredible view of the harbor. Dana Point is a much more relaxed beach area than Laguna or Newport. Rooms were nice, clean, quiet. Loved the fact we could open our window and balcony door. Nice breakfast and a wine and cheese afternoon gathering, but we were our at the beach during that. Spent a few hours in San Clemente as well, nice beach and pier.

Beautiful location, and wonderful views of Dana Point Harbor.  Stayed in tower room 101.  Everything was wonderful.  Location perfect and easy to get to for a quick weekend getaway.  Will definitely return.

Summary Heading: Good location, stunning views, elegant interior, helpful staff
Summary: We stayed here for five nights while visiting Orange County for a wedding. I was completely charmed and won over by the place. Our room was lovely -- on the first floor, with a small patio with a stunning view of the bay, and with access to a larger patio with chaise lounges and with an even more stunning view.   The location is wonderful for exploring both Dana Point and Orange County. And I believe parking is free (and right next to the inn). There are several good restaurants within a short walking distance (5-10 minutes).   The room was very elegant, with beautiful furniture and lovely, large bath with both a tub/jacuzzi and a shower.   The inn has complimentary happy hour every day from 4:30 to 5:30 pm and you can bring your wine and cheese outside to enjoy the beautiful

My wife and I "escaped" for an end of summer 4 night weekend stay. The Blue Lantern Inn is charming and welcoming.  Our room overlooked the harbor and the balcony with chairs and table were a treat.  We took the evening wine and snacks to our room and were able to just kick back.  Breakfast was quite good and fresh.  The facility is clean and well maintained with a friendly staff.  Three adequate restaurants are within an easy walk and beaches, harbor and Laguna Beach are all close.  Unlike nearby hotels, the room charge is all inclusive; no resort fee, breakfast charge or parking fee.

This was our second stay at the Blue Lantern and we love the inn, the amenities and the location.    We brought our sister and brother in law with us on this trip and they could not stop talking about the inn.

We visited Blue Lantern Inn May 2014. Nice and quiet room with our own patio which gave a beautiful view of the harbor. Bathroom was clean and spacious with a separate toilet. Breakfast was just as expected from a B&B, clean and simple. Staff was really friendly. When you have a room at the ground floor, beware of the door that leads to the patio, you can't get back in without your key card. If you did lock yourself out, like us and apparently a lot of other people did as well, just go back to frontdesk they will give you a new key card. We really enjoyed our stay here and would definitely come again.

Summary Heading: Peaceful, cozy inn in quaint Dana Point
Summary: We stayed at Blue Lantern for a short “mini-moon” after our wedding and really enjoyed it! Dana Point is very quaint and lovely, and Blue Lantern Inn has a lot of charm. It has really great ocean views and is a quick drive to the ocean. The rooms are large and cozy. We especially enjoyed the Jacuzzi tub and the balcony.  The staff were really incredibly friendly and helpful. Breakfast was always hot and fresh and the wine in the afternoons was a special treat as well.  For us it was the perfect place to go and relax after our wedding. I’d definitely recommend it and can’t wait to stay there again next time we are in Southern California.

Fantastic location, perfect for our visit to family members. View overlooking the harbor was spectacular, so good that we brought them down to share a picnic lunch on the terrace and everyone raved! We were on the ground floor, which gave us a small personal patio and was just steps away from the terrace and it's commanding view of the whole Dana Point Harbor and coastline looking south. Room was larger than expected and the high ceiling really made it feel spacious. Parking was free and conveniently located (much better than the outrageous 'valet parking' fees charged by some other properties…..) Located on a quiet side street at the north end of town and just half a block from a great sandwich shop in the nearby mall, with a couple of good coffee shops nearby (and they offer

Summary Heading: Beautiful, comfortable Inn at a wonderful location.
Summary: This was our third stay at The Blue Lantern Inn. I really look forward to our vacations there.  The Inn is beautiful, comfortable, peaceful and surrounded by natural beauty. The staff is very friendly, helpful and accommodating. They are really nice people.  I would love to see them get new pillows and towels. They should be up to the standard of this Inn.

Phenomenal view high up on the hill,  lovely service, and good breakfast,  The front desk was very accommodating and made a good suggestion for dinner. In order to get to restaurants and other local sights at you need to drive.  The room was very large but was a disappointment being worn and outdated.  It is supposed to have a New England look but it is dark and dingy and needs a serious updating.  Has an elevator if you are traveling with a heavy bag.

Summary Heading: Very Nice Alternative to Huge Hotels
Summary: Blue Lantern is the place for you if you want an ocean view room in a spotless, friendly, well located B&B.  Our room 204 was spacious, if a tiny bit worn, with a nice comfy bed and large bathroom with 2 sinks.  Loved the bathroom!  Included buffet breakfast was complete with a nice variety including eggs, a meat such as sausage or bacon, fresh fruit, breads, cereals, etc.  staff is friendly and helpful.  We visited 2 nearby hotels & Im delighted to have chosen Blue Lantern over the large glitzy hotels.

This inn was my favorite spot that we stayed on our California trip. Make sure you specify that you want a room that has a balcony/patio and view of the harbor. That is really the main point of staying here. In fact, there are three suites called the tower suites, I think, that are amazing and have the BEST view. We stayed in one of these the second night as the staff upgraded us due to a loud wedding party that was at the restaurant next door the first night. This was really out of their control, but the staff was very friendly and understanding about it. I'm including a picture of the view from our room. They also serve a good breakfast each morning that is included with the room.

Summary Heading: Blue Lantern a great location and facility in Dana Point.
Summary: We have stayed here before and enjoy the great views of Dana Point Harbor and the close location to Laguna & Newport. Beautiful facility on a cliff that overlooks the Ocean. Enjoyed the gas fireplaces, peaceful rooms, free parking, free WIFI, free breakfast, free hors d'oeuvres, and nice staff. Four Sisters Inn has many great locations in California.
