When we stay at a Bed & Breakfast we usually look for a Four Sisters location. They have bikes you can take and ride around the harbor. If going to the beach I would recommend driving a few miles North to the gorgeous Treasure Island Beach in Laguna on the PCH & Wesley Dr.

The Blue Lantern is posh. It's a large inn, with large, well appointed rooms and attentive staff. It's beautifully situated at the top of Dana Point, with superb ocean views.  Expect to chat with other guests in the lounge or on the patio during the happy hour, most likely about the arts scene.  As far as I could tell, there is no beach anywhere close.   The food wasn't worth writing home about, but there is a spectacular Chart House a short walk away and the Cannons next door.     This is a pretty short review because "posh" says it all: quiet, luxurious, effete.  If you're looking to knock back margaritas on the beach, go somewhere else.  I'd probably recommend the Blue Lantern mostly as a nice romantic getaway, wedding anniversary, Valentine's Day, etc.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel when we were getting married next door at Cannons. It was perfect. A lot of my family stayed and others came and joined us before the wedding, the day of. We had a rehearsal dinner in The Library. We loved the lobby so much we hung out and played chess, sat by the fireplace and just relaxed. Great views. There is a ocean view trail steps away that was a great way to get in some exercise. We loved it and will be back for our anniversary.

We had the most enjoyable time while staying at the Blue Lantern Inn. The room was beautiful, clean, comfortable, and quiet. They made sure there was enough robes and towels in our room for the four of us. They have cute beach cruisers to use, as a hotel guest. The view is pretty and the surrounding area clean and quiet....with lots of restaurants nearby. Would definitely stay again!!

I chose Dana Point for this summers birthday week getaway and am so hapoy I found the Blue Lantern Inn. The staff were all welcoming and friendly. The hotel is on located on a stunning lookout and each room is decorated beautifully. My room was right above the kitchen so I was awoken each morning with the delightful scent of the free breakfast. That is the way to wake up!  The location was perfect for walking around. I walked over to the harbor which means I encountered a steep incline coming back up the hill, but it was a lovely walk. Also within walking distance is the Strand with it's beautiful beach and lookout. Try the Point or schwack if you are hungry and Royal Thai Massage for a relaxing massage.   I can't wait to bring my husband back here with me!

Attending a family function in Irvine, my wife and i decided to spend a day on the ocean and booked in at the Blue Lantern ... our view as requested was of the harbor indeed but just by a third ....competing with the not so intresting street below ..... I would suggest getting an ocean view given that the hotel is loctad on the heights of Laguna. No walk is possible to the ocean as car or bicycling are the only realistic way. Room was clean and quiet. Staff was pleasant.

We stayed here for two days on a trip from LA to San Diego. The hotel has a beach-side New England feel to it although it is perched on top of a cliff with fantastic views over the Dana Point harbour.  The hotel is lovely, the rooms immaculate and clean and the staff friendly. There is coffee and cookies on tap all day in the lounge and the freebies don't end there. Each day at 4.30 pm complimentary wine and nibbles are served and to work it off, free bikes are available on a first come basis. Breakfast was included in our package and was varied and good. There are ( at least ) three restaurants within a short walk of the hotel allowing a good varied choice of evening meal. A relaxing and quiet hotel best used to recharge batteries,would definitely stay again.

This Inn far exceeded our expectations. Our room on the 3rd floor had a spectacular view of the ocean as well as Dana Point harbor. We spent most of our time sitting on the balcony terrace taking in the view. The fireplace, high ceiling and jet tub added to the ambiance.  The room was spotless and like new condition. Carmen was very helpful with restaurant reservations and recommended a gorgeous walk along the ocean from the top of the cliffs.

The inn is located on the cliff overlooking the Pacific, just a 20-30 minutes walk from Dana Point harbour where we took Catalina Express for a day trip to Avalon. The place is quiet, private, clean and comfortable.  The bathroom is upgraded and the continental breakfast was plenty. Nice touch was the wine and cheese available at 5pm. The service and front desk staff were outstanding. And the view from our oceanfront windows...breathtaking.

Blue Lantern is the perfect place to stay! Very close to the water and clean! We rode bikes that they have available down to the harbor to eat. The staff is incredibly friendly and the place felt like home. They also let us check in a little bit early which was so nice! Highly recommend. :-)

i can't say enough good things about this inn. the room was spectacular and we didn't even have one of the more expensive rooms. the bathroom was incredible. huge tub and shower. the woman at the front desk was a doll and so helpful. the wine and appetizer hour was great and the breakfast was delicious. we even took out 2 of their beach cruiser bikes and had a blast. i only wish we were there for more than 1 night. we will definitely be back!

Summary Heading: First time visitor to Dana Point
Summary: Heading to a conference nearby and wanted one night away from the large chain hotels. Blue Lantern was the perfect hotel. Spacious room, quiet and beautiful views. Staff helpful, property lovely. Enjoyed the wine in the afternoon and delicious breakfast. This is truly an adult property with only adults there.Not that I mind children but it was a crowd of wedding guests and weekend getaways.

We stayed here for four nights and the Blue Lantern lived up to our expectations. Our room was on the third floor with a balcony and great views down to the harbour. The staff were helpful and friendy and the breakfast s good. The area is truly beautiful and we enjoyed using the hotel bikes to explore. A really great stay.Thank you

The Blue Lantern Inn is a fabulous place to stay in Dana Point, California! It's full of charm and the location is beautiful, overlooking Dana Point Harbor! The breakfast is outstanding,,as well as the afternoon horderves, complete with wine. The rooms are very comfortable and the overall feel is peaceful. It's wonderful!

I stayed here for our ten year anniversary in April. We had a great stay in one of their 2nd floor rooms facing the ocean and harbor. The room was lovely. The breakfast every morning was plentiful and good. The staff was very sweet and helpful.  I would stay here again and recommend to anyone else.

We have stayed here twice and have another visit planned next month! Really beats the chain Hotels. Like the fact that parking is included as well as a great free breakfast and free happy hour with wine and appetizers. Super friendly and upbeat staff who cater to your every need.

What an amazing B&B!  I stayed in the Pacific Edge Room with balcony and the views were wonderful.  The Inn sits high on a bluff and overlooks the marina with views of the ocean. The room was beautifully decorated with great attention to detail and the bath with jetted tub was delightful.  The breakfast presentation was wonderful and everything tasted delicious.  I walked to the marina, restaurants and shops but the drive is quick and easy and takes about 4 minutes.  Check-in was quick and easy with courteous and helpful staff.  I would highly recommend this Inn - it was a memorable stay!  Treat yourself!

This was a lovely place with friendly front desk help. The patio area and many rooms have ocean views. A breakfast and afternoon wine & cheese hour are included. There is no pool; however you are within walking distance to a harbor. This is a good place for couples as it is quiet and relaxing.

My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Blue Lantern Inn recently. We loved the property and its surrounding area, including the magnificent view from our room (Tower, room 201). Upon arrival we had a bottle of champagne waiting for us, and the staff had properly noted our special occasion (my husband's birthday). Breakfast was fine, with a wide variety of food. The first breakfast we had, on a Friday morning, included fresh off-the-oven pastries (Sat and Sunday we had the impression the pastries were left over from Friday's bake). Overall, Blue Lantern Inn was a great experience. I highly recommend getting a room with an ocean view.

After much consideration, my husband and I chose Blue Lantern Inn for our 29th anniversary getaway and we couldn't have made a better choice! We were greeted with a welcoming smile and friendly service. Although we had arrived early and were not able to check-in yet, we were able to park in their lot and set out to exploring the area. The location is fantastic as it is convenient to the marina as well as the nature trail and restaurants, but is also tucked away in a quiet location. We walked just about everywhere we went, but know that the marina is downhill from the inn which means it's uphill coming back. Our room was exceptional! We stayed in a Pacific Edge room which had a fireplace and a private balcony with a spectacular view of the ocean. The room was well appointed, the

Summary Heading: The Best Place i have ever stayed.
Summary: Ijust thought I would add my review,although not stayed for a few years sadly.We first stayed at the blue lantern in 1998 and thus every year right up to 2007,when unfortunately my marriage eneded.This is quite simply the best place I have ever stayed with the most wonderful views,afternoon wines and home cooked breakfasts.I will always have fond memories and grew to know the staff well,pleased to see Lynn is still the manager,a charming lady who I class as a friend.I have stayed in almost every room and to be honest which ever one I stayed in it was the whole package that made the each time special.I long to visit again but weather I do or not there is no denying,if you visit the LA area this is a must stay.

We loved this inn! The view was amazing and our room was large and beautifully decorated. We were greeted with wine and snacks and sat on our balcony enjoying the view. Breakfast was buffet style. We wished we could have stayed a second night. Great location, close to San Clemente and Laguna Beach.

Lovely inn!!  Every staff member is so friendly & helpful and the rooms are gracious with charming balconies & wonderful views.  Some of the most beautiful hikes we've ever taken begin right outside the door--  Breathtaking!  Can't wait to go back!!

My husband and I had a very nice visit staying in a partial view third floor balcony room.  Partial or not, it was lovely.  The grounds make it easy to enjoy the view even if you don't have a view room.  Wine and cheese hour, as well as breakfast, was delicious and served in a spacious room with more than enough room for all of the guests to sit comfortably and not feel like they are on top of each other.  There are bikes available for guests, but the area is nice for neighborhood strolls as well.  The room was a nice size with a great bathroom with a jetted tub, but it did seem a little generic in decorations, but the other niceties make up for that.  Midweek prices make for a nice value considering the evening snacks, beverages and the substantial breakfast.

My husband and I stayed at the Blue Lantern Inn for the last few days.  Our stay was glorious.  It was our anniversary and my husband went all out.  The spacious rooms, the daily wine and cheese, the daily chocolate chip cookies, the friendly staff, the beautiful views, and the luxurious massage made it perfect,  I would highly recommend this inn,

We have stayed in large hotels, small hotels, inns, and B&Bs all over the world, and this one is simply the best. Beautiful rooms, killer views, clean, quiet, comfortable, great breakfasts, wine and cheese every afternoon, beautiful location, nice neighborhood, good restaurants within walking distance, friendly staff... You get the picture.  We fly to California from Ohio every year just to stay here.

My mom and I had a short but wonderful visit to Dana Point and stayed at the Blue Lantern Inn (our first time).  What a lovely and quaint inn!   We thoroughly enjoyed having our breakfast and afternoon appetizers and wine on our balcony overlooking the ocean and harbor each day.  The view was amazing and the inn location was perfect!   The jetted tub was a little difficult to get in and out of, especially for my mom who is in her 70s.  Since the shower was in the tub, you didn't have a choice.  A removable tub mat might have helped.

I booked this hotel with my husband for a 2 night stay in October 2104 and was so disappointed that we left a day early. After reading all these fantastic reviews I could hardly wait to get there. This hotel is in a time warp! It is in dire need of updating!!! The minute I walked into the lobby, I felt as if I were in a retirement home. The decor is worn and dated, from the plastic on the walls in the hallways to the mismatched bathroom fixtures. I would compare this hotel to a highway hampton Inn. This hotel does have incredible views and a lovely friends ly staff,but it is WAY overpriced for the quality of the property. We stayed in the Tower room and were not impressed. For the same money,you can stay in Laguna Beach-a much better option!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to review your October 2014 stay and for your kind comments regarding our friendly staff and wonderful views. Please rest assured that we set extremely high standards for ourselves with regards to comfort, service and hospitality and therefore, of course, regularly update every aspect of the inn. We are proud of the pristine “coastal chic” decor and relaxed, comfortable ambiance, attested to by the majority of our TripAdvisor reviewers, but understand that this style may not be to everyone’s taste. We would very much like to welcome you back should you choose to visit Dana Point in the future. Warmly, Lin McMahon Manager, Blue Lantern Inn

Summary: My daughter and I stayed here for one night and it was outstanding.  The welcome treat that you get is very good.  They have an afternoon buffet with wine if you want it.  Very good appetizers.  The view from our room was wonderful.  The room itself was elegant and comfortable.  It was worth every penny.

Summary Heading: We've already recommended to our friends & family!
Summary: My wife's birthday was the reason for our trip to the Blue Lantern Inn. We booked 201, one of the larger tower rooms with a large balcony overlooking the Dana Point Harbor & Marina, and it was wonderful. Our elegant room had a great view, warm fireplace, comfy bed, large tv and a decadent bathroom. The staff were great, the breakfast was delicious, and the location --- the Best!

We spent three nights in a wonderfully spacious room with a patio and ocean view. We enjoyed sitting outside on the patio during the day and when it began to get chilly at sunset, retiring indoors to enjoy our gas fire.  The bathroom was very spacious with the treat of a jacuzzi tub. Afternoon wine and cheese was very generous and the breakfast each morning was great.  My husband requires a gluten-free diet and there were ample choices for him.  The staff were very helpful and friendly, giving us suggestions regarding restaurants.  We enjoyed our stay.

6 years ago, we stayed here and always fondly remembered the smell of fresh baking in the morning, the complimentary bottle of wine, the wine and cheese offering each afternoon. It made this Inn special.    So we visited the area in early February and chose to come back and though the fresh baking and the free bottle are no longer offered, it is still a wonderful place to stay, excellent location with a breathtaking view.   The rooms are clean, large and very well appointed.   Location provides easy access to highways, yet you feel you are in a very quiet and secluded place. Another wonderful visit to a very nice Inn.

Stayed here to attend a local conference.  Arriving in time for wine/cheese happy hour set the tone for a great 2 night stay.  Rooms are very spacious and clean, with all the amenities you need.  The breakfast in the morning, while I did not partake, was full of both hot and cold options.  Great places to sit at a table or couch or on the deck to enjoy the view overlooking the Dana Point Marina.  Staff were helpful with restaurant recommendations, walking routes and getting transportation.  The pillows were too flat for my liking, but it was a great stay otherwise!

Returned to this lovely B&B after 3 years and it is still a wonderful place to stay!  We brought along our daughter and new son-in-law and they were equally impressed with not only their romantic  room but the delicious breakfast and afternoon wine & cheese and the mouth-watering cookies!  The staff is friendly and helpful with advise of restaurants, walks, etc.  There are bikes for loan and the setting and views of Dana Harbor remain beautiful.  Go and stay!

Stayed here 3 days between meetings in San Diego.  Great place, great views.  Found out some things a little late.  Didn't do the walk around the Hilltop Park until the last day, should have done it the first.  Restaurants - loved Luciana's.  Great fish tacos for lunch couple miles north in Laguna at Coyote Grill.  Keep going a mile or two to Wesley (just before the Montage) and park there to access the beach.  The inn was beautiful and quiet.  Staff attentive and helpful.  Typical amenities for a 4 Sister's facility.  Can't go wrong.

Thanks to Trip Advisor, we found this lovely inn for an anniversary trip. We love boutique hotels and this didn't disappoint. Small touches and big wins like the beautiful rooms and lovely breakfast were all winners. The view is also lovely in all rooms!

My husband and I spent 2 days at the Blue Lantern Inn this week would have loved to extended our stay another day or 2.  We spent 2 days at Disneyland prior and the Blue Lantern Inn was the perfect place for us to unwind after the chaos of that.    The staff was wonderful, helpful and informative.  I spent a morning at the spa and it was a wonderful way to relax, I highly recommend the royal treatment option that they offer.  They have bicycles you can borrow (at no additional cost!) and they offer a wine and appetizer happy hour which was a lovely way to end our afternoon.  We stayed in one of their Pacific Edge rooms which had a great view of the harbor and we were able to enjoy breakfast out on our balcony one morning.  They have a wonderful breakfast, which includes a lot of

WOW - what a great place! My wife and I stayed here for a weekend getaway and loved everything about it! The staff is amazing and friendly - from when I booked the room until check out. The hotel is beautiful. It sits on the cliffs over looking Dana Harbor, and has probably some of the best views of Dana Point. Our room was amazing. It was comfortable and in excellent shape. We had the Pacific Edge room, which overlooked Dana Harbor. The view from the patio was just unbelievable. The room included breakfast and afternoon wine and snacks.  We love Dana Point and have stayed at a couple other places. The Blue Lantern is pricier than we normal stay at, but was worth every penny!

My wife and I stayed here last year, and thoroughly enjoyed our time there. It is expensive, but worth the money. I wouldn't stay for more than a few days, though. In the surrounding areas there are so many more places to explore. We found the facility to be immaculately maintained and beautiful. The view from blue lantern is wonderful. If you go, take some time to drive up and down the coast to enjoy all of its beauty. We would definitely go back.

Summary Heading: Blue Lantern Inn - Our "go to" B and B
Summary: The Blue Lantern has been our "go to" B and B for several years ... exceptional service, staff, breakfast, wine and hors' devours, rooms, location ... the Inn overlooks and has a fabulous view of the Dana Point Harbor.  It's a shot walk to the Chart House which is set higher on the hill and with a window seat, has a wonderful night view of the harbor and surrounding areas.  Have the staff at the Inn make your reservations and you can get a window seat and many times, a complimentary dessert.  The rooms are cozy, with new windscreen TVs, fireplaces, etc.  Breakfast and happy hour offerings are always delicious and plentiful.   Cookies in jars seem to be endless throughout the day as is coffee and a variety of teas.  It's a short drive to the Fashion Island Shopping Center and the

This B&B is inviting and has an great view of the ocean. It is the perfect place for a quiet and relaxing getaway. The library not only provided a great selection of books but board games as well, along with couches, TV and a fireplace just outside the door. Although we didn't use it, the fireplace in our room added a nice touch and would be nice on a cool night. The breakfast in the morning has a nice variety of options (even GF bread!). There were always cookies or muffins out along with coffee and water.

Summary Heading: Upscale B&B with incredible ocean views
Summary: Beautiful room and view looking out on Pacific Ocean.  Excellent full breakfast included in price of room.  Comfortable lounge areas.  Bicycles available for guest use at no charge.  The staff gives very personal service.  Always remembered my name and asked how my day went when I got back to the hotal.  They made excellent suggestions for dinner.  Very enjoyable stay.  I would go back if I am ever back in the area.

This inn is a very special find, and it couldn't me more ideal for couples looking for a quiet getaway. We loved how clean and contemporary it was despite the old-time feel. We enjoyed using the library - well stocked with classic books and a great wifi signal - and the beach cruiser bikes that are included with your stay. Breakfast was very satisfying and the little touches, cookies and wine and appetizers in the afternoon, were great. Our balcony offered beautiful views of the water. Even the glass elevator had water views! The staff was very accommodating (let us store our luggage, helped us coordinate a whale watching cruise, and didn't balk when we asked if we could make change for big bills:). Overall, the service was nothing short of first class. We will definitely stay

Here are the high points for this Inn: The location is on a high point looking down onto the harbor. with a beautiful ocean view. (Spring for the view or you could get the parking lot.) The staff are incredibly helpful and pleasant. There are bicycles you can use for free. Here are the low points: It is not a cozy B&B, which for some reason we had anticipated.  It is more like a hotel. It smells very unpleasant. Breakfast was unappealing.  (The oatmeal was good however.) If we were to go back to the area we would go up the coast to Laguna Beach and explore there.

Summary Heading: A Beacon of Comfort Overlooking the Sea
Summary: My husband and I are longtime fans of Four Sisters Inns and this first-time visit to the Blue Lantern Inn at Dana Point, California did not disappoint. We stayed in a third floor room with balcony overlooking the Pacific Ocean and the Dana Point Marina.  The bright and airy rooms welcomed the weary traveler.  The comfy bed and soft linens assured great slumbers.  The ample breakfast offerings satisfied the palate with hot and cold items.  The eggs and non-crispy hash browns were often only mildly warm..The egg fritatta worked much better. The aroma of brewed coffee wafted up to the rooms as a pleasurable wake-up.     We figured out that eating a hearty breakfast and an early dinner allowed the visitor to skip lunch...The wine and cheese hour that commenced at 5:00 was a good

Summary Heading: Definitely a perfect place for a romantic weekend
Summary: I took my girlfriend to this place as a birthday's gift and I definitely do not regret my choice. I booked the tower guest room and it looks as it is on the website from the pictures. Very nicely decorated with an astonishing view of the ocean + port. You are nicely welcome in your room with champagne and chocolates that we could enjoy on the balcony. Everything is nicely made in the room.  The service is excellent and friendly. I just feel that they repeat themselves all day and in the end, they dont even remember what they told you earlier. It's not negative just they are really busy and they really do their best to offer a good service.  In the afternoon, you even get a complimentary wine-cheese buffet. Important to notice that the wine was good. Same for the breakfast which

Summary Heading: One of our new favorite places
Summary: Everyone here was super friendly and it made our stay so worth the travel.  We have never stayed here before but we saw that it had good reviews.  We wholeheartedly endorse those reviews and now add ours too.  There is no beating the view and our room was situated just right. We're fans forever.

Lovely setting as well as a relaxing stay in a large room.  Even though we didn't pick the room with the ocean view, we were very pleased with our stay.  The service was excellent including suggestions for where to eat.  Very close to good hikes and main street with lots of choices for food and coffee.  The morning breakfast was excellent, with lots of choices for both meat and veggie choices.  The evening appetizers and wine were also a nice treat that you don't get with most chain hotels.  Glad we stayed.

Summary Heading: Not sure you could beat the view
Summary: Stayed here for a long weekend in October and had a great stay. Front desk staff was super friendly and very easy to deal with. They put out some wine options in the afternoon and a breakfast in the morning that it turned out we never took advantage of. The rooms were great and you just cannot beat the view from the patios.   Bathrooms could use a little updating though, for a hotel of this caliber the shower had very low water pressure and it had an old, basic shower head.   One strong recommendation - get a room on the top floor. We had a room for the first night on a middle floor and you could easily hear people clomping around on the floors above you. We had planned on switching anyway so it was no big deal. But its definitely something to be aware of.  If you go in knowing

We cannot speak too highly of our stay at the Blue Lantern Inn. Our room was clean, comfortable, well positioned and well equipped. The staff were friendly and efficient. Breakfast (continental plus hot dishes) was excellent and in the afternoon there was a (free) happy hour with wine and hors d'oeuvres. Free parking is adjacent to the Inn. Restaurants are within easy walking distance of the Inn, as is Dana Point harbour. We plan to stay at the Inn again when we re-visit the area.

Summary Heading: Comfy, Cozy Inn in Dana Point
Summary: Loved this Inn and were close to many sites in San Clemente, DanaPoint, and Laguna Beach.  Staff were very helpful and friendly, and breakfast and evening snack were excellent.  Liked the Keurig coffee maker in our room.  Also have mini refrig in room, spa tub, fireplace.  Had a view on the Pacific Edge with balcony. I would have spent more time on the balcony except it rained.

We enjoyed our stay.  The hospitality was wonderful and the rooms were warm and cozy with a fireplace and jacuzzi tub.  We also like the breakfast buffet.  We look forward to seeing several of the other Four Sisters Inns!

Needed a little time away.  The wife and I love this place.  Excellent place to relax.  Staff was very attentive.  Room was the best.  We enjoyed both the breakfast buffet and the evening snacks.  Will be back soon.

If you want a great ocean  & harbour view this is the bed & breakfast for you. The rooms are very nice & the breakfast choices are varied & excellent; also the afternoon tea service is a nice midday break. All this comes at a hefty price but seems well worth it.

we spent the day in Orange County and drove down to the inn for the evening. We really enjoy the accommodations and the location was right on the coast.  The room we stayed in was cozy and we had no issues. Breakfast was served downstairs in the morning and we could smell the bacon when we woke up.

My husband and I decided to revisit southern California where we lived 20+ years ago. What a delight to discover this lovely inn in such a gorgeous setting--truly a place to relax and enjoy. I am a big Tripadvisor fan and read many entries to determine if a particular property is right for me. After reading about this inn I wondered if it could really be as good as it sounded. The answer is a resounding "Yes!" We chose a room with a harbor view as two out of the three nights we were there this particular room was offered at 15% discount. It was a lovely, large room with a king bed, huge bathroom with double sinks, a sitting area, a refrigerator, and a bar/sink area. The room had lots of light with windows we could open if needed (the AC was quite loud so it was nice to be able

I typically do not write reviews, but after my stay this weekend at the Blue Lantern I felt compelled to share! First, it is so easy to get too, minutes off Interstate 5 and blocks from PCH. When you arrive you are captivated with the beautiful Pacific and the Inn is perched on a cliff over looking Dana Point Harbor. The room was very comfortable, great view from the bed, jetted tub in the bathroom with 2 sinks and a gorgeous shower! The staff was wonderful, they treated you like a best friend coming over for a weekend! Each morning we were treated to a wonderful buffet with fresh squeezed OJ, a hot pot of coffee and a fresh selection breakfast items to choose from. Each evening we were also treated with a choice of red or white wine along with variety of cheeses and crackers

A great hotel, loved the view of the harbor from one of the harbor view rooms.  Wine and cheeses, crackers and olives in the evening, complimentry.  Breakfast included. Staff was very nice. Chart House Restaurant was a very short drive away, could be walked and the staff is willing to make reservations for you.

I think this is my favorite hotel/B&B.  The location is wonderful, the staff so helpful.  They just try to think of everything that would make you comfortable--fireplace, jetted tub, robes, our names on a welcome card on the bed.  Our balcony had a beautiful ocean view.  It's walking distance to a couple of nice restaurants and a short drive to many others. Laguna Beach is not very far away.  The afternoon happy hour is a nice extra and breakfast is always wonderful.

It was unbelievable.  Its right next to the ocean, in fact the hotel itself hangs slightly over the cliff.  The bay is the view you see walking up to the hotel, in the breakfast room, tables outside and the glass elevator.  But there is a road you can drive down, sit on a bench and watch the waves.  The room I had was twice the size of most motel rooms.  Huge poster bed, flat screen TV on the wall, DVD player, fireplace, huge cupboard for clothes, bathrobes, small fridge with soft drinks included, end tables, desk, and two cushioned arm chairs with a table between them.  My bathroom was also huge, with a sauna tub, separate enclosed shower, two sinks and the toilet was in a separate room with a door.  A library of DVD's were down stairs for the guest to check out, included with

Blue Lantern Inn is a five-star bed and breakfast and is considered one of the best b and b's in the country. Wonderful views high up on a cliff overlooking Dana Point. As an extra bonus the afternoon buffet and morning breakfast are included in the room rate. The food quality and preparation is top notch. The rooms are very comfortable and some have fab views. Even the town view is lovely and is one of the larger rooms. We will return!

We stopped for one night before our trip to Catalina Island.  We didn't want to miss the Catalina express.  We regretted that we didn't have longer.  What a fantastic location, over looking Dana Point.  The rooms were nicely appointed with fireplaces and jacuzzi tubs.  The breakfast in the morning was delicious, wide variety, and complete.  Beds were comfortable, the hotel was clean, and the staff accommodating.  They have bikes to use au gratis.  Wine and snacks served in the afternoon.  They also give AAA and AARP discount.  We are definitely going back for an extended weekend, as it's only one hour from San Diego.  A very romantic getaway for a couple without the hassle of flying.

The Inn was recommended by the meeting planner at my work. My company does meetings at the Ritz, however employees can't stay on property. (Sigh) but after visiting the Blue Lantern Inn, who needs the Ritz? Be sure to book a room facing the harbor.  The first floor is fine, but you will hear those above you banging around.  Why must folks on upper floors walk with heavy footfalls at 4 am. Just turn on the room's ac fan and you'll drown it out. It is within walking distance of The Chart House, Luciana's, and Canon's is right next door...the outdoor patio @ Canon's provides some additional noise, especially when there is a wedding, but it winds down around just a bit after 10:30. I'd come back for sure.

Summary Heading: Like a trip to the Mediterranean Coast
Summary: The views at this Inn were like being transported to Capri Island in the Mediterranean without leaving the U.S.   They are breathtaking!  I have stayed at another Four Sisters Inn (Gosby House) years ago and this Inn did not disappoint. So glad to see that the attention to detail has not waned as this group of Inns has expanded.  Had a harbor view room with jetted tub and fireplace. The room was clean and furnishings comfortable. The happy hour wine and spread of snacks were delicious. Breakfast was plentiful and quite good (eggs, breakfast meats, hot cereal, fruit, pastry) but nothing fancy. It is excellently located near harbor and restaurants. The inn has spa services. We enjoyed deep tissue massages. The service was excellent. Probably one of the best massages I have ever

I debated for several weeks between this property and the nearby Marriott. So glad we picked Blue Lantern. NO resort fee, no parking fees, breakfast each day was great. Afternoon wine and cheese. Service was great and staff friendly.  Room was very nice with gorgeous views of the harbor. Ambience was nice with fountains and little touches (cookies in afternoon, flavored water, coffee always available). We actually didn't want to leave to continue onto Hawaii!  We will definitely be back here!

Six years ago my husband and I had our honeymoon at this wonderful bed and breakfast.  We were just able to make it back to the Blue Lantern and it was even more wonderful the second time!  We arrived late and we were greeted by a friendly staff member making us feel so welcome.  The breakfasts and afternoon appetizers were wonderful! Our room was perfect and the harbor view - oh beautiful.  The Blue Lantern provides beach chairs and towels and bikes too.  Close to many Southern California things to do.  We loved running at the harbor and watching the sunset from the nearby trails on the bluff.  I can't say enough good about this lovely place.  Hopefully we will be back sooner in the future!

Summary Heading: Our favorite ocean getaway from San Diego
Summary: My husband and I have been coming here for many years now.  Our last stay was Sept. 9, 2014 for 2 nights, and we stayed for 2 days in April 2014 as well.  We are retired, and when we want to get away for a few days, we stay here because it's the nicest place near the ocean for us.  It takes us one hour to drive here.  One reviewer called it a "motel", which is a real error - this is definitely an inn.    We like it because it is a beautiful property, with beautiful rooms, great views of the harbor/ocean, and very close to the best beaches.  We like that you can just go to the lobby dining area and have breakfast and then have drinks and snacks in the evening.  We prefer a room on the 1st floor because you can just walk outside your door to bring tea and cookies, etc. back to

Summary Heading: Great place for an Anniversary weekend
Summary: My husband and I stayed here during our 25th wedding anniversary trip to Southern California. The inn is beautiful and sits right on the edge of the cliff overlooking the Dana Point marina. We loved the walkway along the bluff right beside the inn. Our room was very spacious and lovely, as well as clean and comfortable. The food was delicious and elegant yet served in a casual, relaxing atmosphere. The staff is welcoming, friendly, and helpful with planning things to do or see in the area. We enjoyed the surrounding area. If you go north a few miles to Laguna Beach, don't miss the beautiful walk along the bluffs behind Montage resort (across the street from Albertson's) with views of Treasure Island beach below. The walkway is beautifully landscaped and has benches, picnic

This is a nice, small, quiet inn.  We stayed in the ground floor tower room and really enjoyed it.  We were a little apprehensive about staying in the ground floor since no one seemed to want to book the room because it's on the ground floor. It actually was great. Had a little patio that did open up to the hotel patio, but it was divided so it kept its privacy. It was nice for the cocktail hour and breakfast, because we could just grab our food and eat on our patio with little effort. The common areas of the motel were really nice and the location was great. The view is lights out, can't beat that.  Only knock on the room was there seemed to be some details that's room needed a little updating maintenance wise.  Nit picky, but there bathroom seemed a little worn and carpet

I won't write much because I don't want to delay your decision any longer - just book it! Blue Lantern Inn is wonderful in every way - simply hospitality at its finest. I would have no hesitation in recommending this inn. The only downside is not having enough time here! Have yet to try out spa! The management and staff should be very proud.

Believe or not, this is he best hotel we ever have stayed in and this was a perfect ending of our holiday. Very friendly and helpful staff, always with a smile and a positive attitude. Very good and variate breakfast and a nice complimentary offer of cheese, biscuit and wine every afternoon. Rooms where clean and tidy with a beautiful view of the harbor. Free towels and chairs to bring with us to the beach and free rental of bicycles. Glad there still is hotels like this and we will for sure order this hotel if we return to this area.

We stayed here for 2 nights are the end of our honeymoon road trip. What a fantastic place. From check in which was much later than we had planned due to LA traffic to check out the ladies at the front desk couldn't have been more lovely. When we said we were going to the beach they gave us chairs, offered towels and bikes. The room was beautiful, and the bathroom huge. The library had a great DVD selection and a half complete puzzle for guests to join in with. Afternoon wine and cheese was a really nice touch and breakfast was good too. I hope one day we can come back and stay again and i'd highly recommend to anyone looking to stay in the area.

This is the 2nd time we have stayed at the Blue Lantern Inn. The first time we stayed was in August 2011 in the 3rd floor Tower Room for the day before and the night of our wedding. What a gorgeous room with an amazing view! My bridesmaids got ready in this room (there were 7 of them) along with the hair stylists and makeup artist and it still felt spacious. My husband and I just stayed here for the 2nd time over Labor Day weekend for our 3 year wedding anniversary. We stayed in room 203 and the view was very nice (not as good as the tower room but still good!) and the room was pretty big as well. The breakfast was better than I remembered (eggs, pancakes, bagels, etc) and wine, cheese, and cookies are served in the evening. We will definitely be back here in the future.

Summary Heading: Great Inn/hotel for my wife and I
Summary: This is the 2nd time we have been to the Blue Lantern Inn. It has an amazing view of the Dana Point Harbor.  Pros 1) You can walk to several restaurants from the Inn 2) Free bike rentals  3) Collection of DVDs to check out for free 4) Comes with a yummy breakfast 5) 5 Minute drive down to the Dana Point Harbor where you can kayak and do other ocean activities

Summary Heading: A slice of the French Riviera
Summary: We have been to the Blue Lantern three or four times in the last five years.  It is a piece of heaven with an amazing view of the Dana Point Harbor.  Sunrise the lights play across the water - it is a photgrapher's joy.  The rooms are amazing, the staff is incredibly responsive.  We actually stay here when we go to Disneyland which is about twenty minutes away.

One of the prettiest views you can get! The hotel was very quiet. The rooms were spacious and clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the wine and appetizers, and the breakfast was really good too. We would definitely stay there again!

Summary Heading: Lovely place to stay & treat yourself
Summary: 310, Harbor View room.  Sitting area was a lovely surprise with elevated ceiling and 5 port windows high above.  Nice harbor view.  Bathroom has 3 windows that open.  Only con was shower is in tub which is a high step to get into if you are short.  Did not experience any water pressure issues other guests who stayed on high floors reported.  If you like a dark room don’t reserve this one because no shutters on high port windows to block early morning sun.  Water cooler located in hallway to stairs so no need to use bottled water unless you want to. Inn has private deck area for guests with amazing views.  Several of the 1st floor rooms open on to it but all guests can access the deck area no matter what room they are in. So not necessary to book a room with a balcony.

we were trying to stay here for an anniversary...and our birthdays, but the inn was booked solid.  they only have 29 rooms, so weekends are hard to come by.  that said, they have a great special, called carpe diem, where the rate is discounted if there is availability.  we managed to get in on that rate and the room didn't have the best view, was big and roomy and was decorated quite lovely.  the bathroom was gigantic and the tall ceiling made the whole place feel HUGE!  the wine, cheese and nibbles was a nice way to wind down...  the whole place is decorated with personal touches and it really had a warm feeling.  our friends surprised us with a chilled bottle of champagne waiting in our room and the hotel sent an extra special amenity as well.  I had been looking forward to

Summary Heading: Gorgeous and Romantic Hotel you will want to Revisit
Summary: My daughter stayed here for a night before and two nights after her wedding (at the Dana Point Chart House).  It is absolutely lovely and a romantic hotel you will want to stay at again.  She had a suite on the first floor.  Normally first floor rooms are not private.  Not the case with hers.  It had a beautiful bathroom with separate potty/shower and vanity areas.  There was a semi-private patio immediately outside her room (#103) that had a commanding view of the Dana Point Harbor and Pacific Ocean.  A lovely breakfast is included as well as early evening wine, cheeses, and crackers.  They "say" that they close the included wine bar early.  But our experience is that as long as you are enjoying it, they keep it open to enhance your stay.  The staff is delightful and the hotel

Summary Heading: Excellent place to Stay in Southern Calif!
Summary: I was attending a conference held in Dana Point and had to find alternate lodging since the event hotel down the street was completely booked. I was bummed since the original hotel was was supposedly 1st class. In the end, I was fortunate that the other hotel WAS unavailable because otherwise, I never would have stumbled onto the Blue Lantern. This little Inn has soooo much to offer. Awesome views of the harbor, a great breakfast every morning, a super helpful staff. One morning, my wife and I even rode bikes down to the harbor and paddle boarded. So much to do plus the beaches are super close as well. Definitely stay here if you have the chance!!!

This Inn is truly a Pacific coast gem!  My wife and I have been staying here since 2007, about three or four time per year.  Perched on a cliff overlooking the ocean, one is continuously awed by the commanding views of the sea, Dana Point Marina and sailing ships docked at the Ocean Institute directly below the Inn and while the Inn is located on the edge of a quiet, upscale, residential area, you are but a short, scenic, stroll to numerous restaurants.    The Tower and Pacific Edge edge rooms, have balconies and all rooms feature elegantly appointed bathrooms with a jetted tub, stall shower and plush bathrobes.  The gas fireplace gets frequent use on chilly mornings and while seldom needed, it is comforting to know that you have good A/C at your disposal.  Four Sisters Inns, in

Summary Heading: This Four Sisters Inn Makes a Comeback
Summary: We had been SO disappointed at our relatively recent stay in a Four Sisters Inn in Carmel (reviewed elsewhere) which used to be fantastic and had gone completely downhill last year.  But we decided to give the Blue Lantern Inn a chance. . . since the reviews were good and we were only staying overnight on a business trip.  Our stay was great and we wished we had stayed longer.  The Inn had a fantastic location overlooking the harbor and our rooms did as well. . . whether on the first floor or the third floor where our rooms were.  It was very peaceful and quiet, the outdoor patios to lounge, relax and meditate on the sky and ocean. , , terrific. . . even though the hotel was full and had lots of wedding showers and other events going on, it was quiet and peaceful everywhere

We were gifted a stay at the Blue Lantern Inn and absolutely loved our time there. The room was large, clean and beautifully decorated. We had ocean views from our patio, which was a great place to relax. They had a wine and snack time which was very nice. Lots of items to choose from as well as delicious cookies. Breakfast was a free buffet that also had a lot of options. Very good! Location was close to the harbor (great beach for paddle boarding!) and places to dine. The front desk made our dinner reservations for us and also helped us decide which restaurant to choose. First class all the way! Can't wait to stay here again!

My husband and I went to The Blue Lantern Inn as a little honeymoon after we got married. Our real honeymoon will be in the summer when we have more time off. We had a wonderful and restful time in the beautiful room and we enjoyed the view from out patio. They provide a variety of items at their continental breakfast along with delicious baked goods. At Happy Hour they serve many appetizers along with red and white wine and they keep the food and wine coming. We had breakfast in bed one morning and there was more great food that we couldn't finish! The staff was very friendly and made us feel welcome.  Mr. and Mrs. Kingston

The Blue Lantern Inn is the perfect place for couples looking for a quiet getaway. The Inn is perched atop a cliff which provides a beautiful view of the Harbor. The staff is very polite, helpful and accommodating. I love the little extras they provide such as free rental movies, free soda, water and even Tylenol! You definitely don't feel nickel and dimed. The complimentary breakfast and afternoon wine was a wonderful touch as well. I would highly recommend this Inn if you are looking for a quiet and relaxing vacation. It's away from town, but there are still plenty of places within walking distance to eat at. Cannons has a great Happy Hour and beautiful views out on the patio. The Shwack is a great little place to grab an inexpensive, but quality lunch.   The only downside:

This place is a gem. A beautiful gem. From the moment we checked in with Carmen, I knew we made the perfect choice. Having debated for weeks about where to go and stay. In a last minute decision we finally agreed with Blue Lantern, after I looked into B&B's rather then a traditional hotel.  BOY OH BOY was this the best choice. The view was awesome.  The fruit for breakfast was super fresh, the blueberry pancakes was light and made small. Which I enjoyed fully. I hate large oversized pancakes.  The only complaint is the AC was very loud in our room and the toilet handle was so hard to use that it broke off while trying to flush the toilet. But that takes nothing from the location, the quality of the overall hotel, the customer service, and the experience. Will be back very soon.

Summary Heading: You may not want to leave.
Summary: The Blue Lantern Inn is truly a place to relax and get away from it all.  With wonderful views, comfortable rooms and very attentive staff you may never wish to leave.  Add to that a great location along the shore in Dana Point, you will find plenty of activities, dining, shopping or just enjoying the waterfront.  And they have free parking, something you do not often see in California.

What delightful ambiance.  Nautical theme, and beautiful, sunny rooms.  We were in town for a wedding, and enjoyed every second at this Four Sisters Inn.  Breakfast out front in the morning, or a drink on the balcony made this Bed and Breakfast experience tranquil, inspiring, and reminiscent of times gone by.  Wonderful view of the harbor, and the sunsets.  We will return!

Summary Heading: Felt like South of France - relaxing
Summary: After much searching for a weekend getaway to celebrate our anniversary, we finally chose The Blue Lantern Inn at Dana Point, and were so glad we did.  It was a busy weekend, so initially we could only secure a smaller room for the one night. Even so, we had a lovely evening and the next morning (yayy) we were able to extend our stay for a second night and get a king room (suite) with a balcony and brilliant harbor and ocean view. Self-parking was free and close. So convenient.  From the moment of our arrival, we felt welcome. Such a charming place with a New England feel to it. Large enough for privacy and small enough to feel cosy with personalized service. Laurene, Carmen, Lin, Dana at the desk took care of every request and made us feel like welcome guests. Ray was the

Its sister inn, Gaige House has a better breakfast, hands down. Nevertheless, having said that, the location of this property is special and the view of the Pacific Ocean from the terrace is breathtaking. One problem is that they feed you so much at breakfast and afternoon tea that you end up skipping lunch and dinner There are beautiful trails that start within a short distance from the hotel. The staff was very attentive and friendly and the building was spectacular and very well maintained. We are already planning our return.

These compliments are overdue, but undiminished in enthusiasm and gratitude.  I'd exceed the 5 star limit if permitted.  We aren't able to do as much traveling as we'd like, but of the B&B's in which we've stayed, this is my hands-down *favorite* ~ and the staff has a great deal to do with that.  EVERYONE (desk and support staff, manager, on-site chef, housekeepers) are GOLD.  Mean it.  We arrived late on our first night and were greeted by Carmen.  Intensify 'warm and gracious' and *then* we can begin to describe her.  By the time we left, I felt like I was saying good-bye to a long lost cousin.  Our room was cozy and beautiful, with a harbor view from the patio.  On our first morning, a loud grinding vaporized the tranquil calm.  It lasted for several hours, but I was

Summary Heading: Special Touches and a Great Location
Summary: From the attention at check-in to the afternoon wine and cheese and gourmet sumptuous breakfasts, we enjoyed our stay at the Dana Point Blue Lantern Inn.  The area it's in is very walkable, with 3 restaurants in close proximity.  The gazebo at the end of the street provides a wonderful view of the harbor, and walking paths along the bluff and through the nature preserve provide excellent outlooks for peaceful contemplation.  The best surprise was finding out that the hotel staff had ordered a special dessert for us when they made our restaurant reservation!

Just got back from spending our 45th Anniversary here.  This place is Wonderful.  GREAT STAFF.  Beautiful setting and excellent facilities.  We had the most fantastic time.  We have found our little piece of Heaven on earth.  We will visit again, often as time permits.  If you need time to re-charge, go here.  They are marvelous and have the greatest oatmeal raisin cookies on earth.  Our thanks to all the folks at Blue Lantern for making our time with them SO Enjoyable.  If you go to Dana Point, you need to stay here.  The view is fantastic  Excellent breakfast buffet and afternoon cheese, wine and snacks.  Thanks to all of you at Blue Lantern Inn Tom and Karen

Stopped here for a short visit after business inland trip.  The Inn is located on a cliff at Dana Point and has absolute beautiful view of the pacific.   Well worth getting a room with a balcony or a view of the the harbor.  There is a lovely patio also overlooking the pacific, but it is not really that large.  It would be hard to fit everyone in the inn on the patio.  All three of our rooms were beautiful and the bathrooms were gorgeous (jacuzzi tubs, large showers). All rooms are VERY spacious..They do have spa services but the spa rooms are very small.We enjoyed both the breakfast and the afternoon wine and cheese.  We found both to be slightly better than the average served  at chain hotels. It is conveniently located to lots of shops and beach areas . However, you will

Summary Heading: AMAZING!!! Cant wait to come back
Summary: We had an amazing time at Blue Lantern and cannot wait to return. This time it was just my husband and I without children and we loved our time here. We scheduled a stop here after a conference in SD so knew nothing about the area. Phoned from Australia and were able to secure a reservation with the very friendly staff. Rooms are stunning- very well appointed and so clean. The view from our room was gorgeous and their was plenty of space to stretch out. We were travelling from Australia and had a tonne of luggage so the extra space was much appreciated. Jacuzzi was fab and the bathroom was huge. It was our wedding anniversary and reception were kind enough to organise chocolates and champagne and a little Blue Lantern cook book. Yes you pay for it but I would expect

Visited the Dana Point/Laguna Beach area weekend in April 2014.  Searched for something more quaint than a typical overpriced, glitzy hotel, and found it at the charming Blue Lantern Inn.  Located up on a cliff with a beautiful view of Dana Point Harbor from balcony-located just off the main hwy. (PCH). No extra parking fees & quiet.  Staff was pleasant and helpful, although a bit tooooo talkative when others are waiting for assistance.  Breakfast was so much more than continental-filling, fresh & delicious choices!  Charming lobby with fireplace & sunroom.  Wonderful front porch - very clean.  We wanted a more relaxed atmosphere and got it.  Comfy beds & pillows - with huge shower/tub.   We had a very pleasant stay.  Ferry to Catalina is close, and so are shops.  If you want to

Got engaged here on Friday night.  The room comes with pretty great amenities: fireplace and jacuzzi tub...PLUS, the most comfortable bed and pillows I have ever slept on.  I just called the Inn to see what kind of pillows they use so I can buy some at home!  The Inn is clean, comfortable, food and wine is consistent and tasty.  The staff is stellar, really genuine, nice people.  Thanks for a great stay!  We'll be looking to stay in your sister inns in Napa!

Summary Heading: We want to book for our 4 wedding Anniversary.
Summary: I called to book a reservation for our 4 th wedding Anniversary , the lady who answered the phone was a bit impatient . I will try back later.    I called back a day later & a different time, the lady who answered the phone was Rude!   On our way back home, we decided to stop by this B & B and see if booking a reservation in person  would be better, giving the employees the benefit of the doubt.    Well we walked into this B & B, pretty! Great location. Again the lady was Rude!!! Never mind , we will spend our money else where.   2 great Hotels across from the ocean. Great city love all the things to do in this charming city ( Dana Point )   Do not stay at this B & B

My husband and I chose this inn to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary.....we couldn't have been more disappointed.  This is clearly NOT a bed and breakfast as advertised here at Tripadvisor and other sites.. The food was more like a cattle call...a "buffet" complete with powdered eggs, processed glue like sausage....canned fruit...it was horrible. Further, the Inn did NOTHING to acknowledge our 20th wedding anniversary. When we mentioned this upon leaving, the manager asked us if we  had seen the "chocolates" left on the bed. I am surprised she could say this with a straight face. The "chocolates" were the common " two chocolate box" you would commonly see with a turn down service...nothing more. To top it off, the guest upstairs seemed to be rolling three dressers (from the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review Blue Lantern Inn as we always appreciate receiving our guests’ comments.  I was disheartened to read your review and subsequent feedback following your stay as I would have taken every measure to ensure your satisfaction during your visit had you mentioned any of the issues. I am so sorry that you were disappointed with the chocolates and card that were left for your anniversary as we hoped these would add a little extra sweetness to the occasion but apologize if we missed the mark.    We endeavor to make it is as clear as possible on our website and Trip Advisor that, as a larger bed and breakfast style inn, we offer a buffet-style breakfast that includes a hot and hearty breakfast as well as fresh baked goods, fruit, yogurt etc. You are welcome to enjoy this in our sunroom but it is our pleasure to also offer, on request the night before, breakfast in bed in the comfort of your guestroom or on the patio.   With regards to the disturbance from the guest above, as I discussed during check-out, we have 24 hour on-site staff that would have been more than happy to help rectify the situation should you have asked as, again, our guests’ comfort is of utmost importance.     Warmly, Lin McMahon General Manager, Blue Lantern Inn

Summary: My husband and I traveled to Dana Point to enjoy the annual whale festival and in the process discovered an amazing inn that we plan to return to more than just annually!  The moment we arrived we felt the serenity the location and atmosphere provides. As far as the festival, we were in the perfect spot overlooking the harbor and all the festivities - beautiful sunset views, plus we were able to see whales from our balcony! We definitely plan to return and enjoyed the daily complimentary warm breakfast and afternoon appetizers and wine.  The staff was very welcoming and friendly, accommodating us with DVD's, binoculars, bicycles, and local information.  Our room, 203, was clean, inviting, updated, and spacious. On our next trip we plan to take full advantage of one of several

Overall, we really enjoyed our time at the Blue Lantern Inn! The staff was so kind in arranging our last minute stay and was even willing to upgrade our room at no extra cost. Our room had a stunning view of Dana Point harbor, our bed was comfy & had enough pillows to accommodate me in my 8th month of pregnancy. The only drawback was the bathroom seemed a little outdated for this hotel, but the large soaking tub was wonderful. This b&b was a great couple's getaway for my husband and I celebrating our 9th anniversary.

My wife and I stayed here for a long weekend getaway and absolutely loved this place we will forever want to come back. The views were amazing, staff was excellent, and the atmosphere was wonderful.    We stayed in room 301 which is the room you see when you first enter the website. This has the best view in the entire hotel and makes you want to just sit on the balcony all day. We loved having wine and horse d'oeuvres every evening along with having a fully stocked fridge of Coca-Cola!  We can't say enough about this place.

I wanted a pleasant place to "hide out" for the week-end  after a trip to Busy San Diego and LA and decided on The Blue Lantern. It is in a lovely location with marina and water views. We were were cordially greeted and all of our needs were foreseen. We were celebrating my birthday and the receptionist had several suggestions for dinner, made the reservation for us and arranged a great table and birthday dessert. The room was cozy and I wish I could have spent more time on the patio. All in all, a very pleasant stay.

Summary Heading: Lovely Inn for a Get A Away
Summary: Yummy buffet breakfast provided in the morning. All the staff is trained in customer service. Have the turn down service. There will be nice bit of chocolate waiting for you. Appraisers  are provided in the afternoon as well as bikes to tour the local area.

We stayed in room 203, with a balcony & harbor/ocean view, fireplace, sitting area, and very large, clean bathroom. We absolutely loved the room and beautiful view, and would definitely stay at the Blue Lantern again. (We had been in Beverly Hills for business, and came to Dana Point to visit friends/vacation. The Inn was ideally located close to them.) The common area had been decorated for Christmas - lovely. We liked that we could just walk up the stairs to our room (there is an elevator, of course).  The personnel at the front desk were all, every one, no matter the hour, so very helpful and pleasant. We enjoyed hearing a bit about the history of all the lantern named streets, suggestions about what to enjoy while in the area, and just general conversation. Really, a great

We loved the Inn and will return.  I might mention that on the website, you were very firm about a 4 PM checkin.  This made things a little difficult for us.  Do wish check in was 2:30 OR 3.  Also we could never seem to get the water above lukewarm.  You were very busy while we were they so maybe the water heater was overloaded.  Other than those two items, the room was great, the food, was great and Peggy at the front desk was delightful.

Summary Heading: Another thumbs up review but a few little oddities to point out
Summary: This review is going to be a recording of previous positive reviews but there are a couple of "heads ups" I wanted to point out(though it should not change your mind about staying there).    The wife and I went mid-week the last week of December in order to take advantage of the summer-like winter Southern Cal has been experiencing. The off-season rate was only $150(with tax=$165). The room was ideal as was the service. Although check-in time is 4PM, we were able to check in about 2:45PM. The wine and cheese happy hour and breakfasts were as advertised-good but not necessarily extraordinary.  Our room was quiet and very clean.   A couple of things that made me go with 4 stars instead of 5:   1) There was no blow dryer in the room. They don't mention it on the website but then

I first stayed at the Inn while on a business trip and thought the place was adorable. I had a 3rd floor room with vaulted ceilings (though with a view of the parking lot), skylights in the enormous bathroom, and a fireplace and just loved it. They serve wine and hors d'oeuvres late afternoon and the first time I was there it was during the summer so you could sit out at 6 pm and still be warm while you enjoy the view of the harbor below. I liked it so much that my friend bought a gift certificate for me and my husband to use for a mini getaway after our wedding. So I called and booked a two-night stay for a room with an ocean view. I mentioned to the person taking the reservation that I like the vaulted ceilings on the top floor and very specifically and clearly requested a

Let me start this review by saying that I am not an "Inn" person.  My preference is usually an upscale hotel and all of its amenities; I don't love feeling like I am paying to stay in someone else's house.  Don't even get me started on B&B's!  We stayed at the Blue Lantern Inn last week on a whim.  We drove the 2 hours from LA and took advantage of a mid-week special they were offering ($150 a night).  As we pulled up to the inn, I was pleased to see that they had a nice, well-lit parking lot right for us to park in for free.  The outside of the building is really charming, built in a New England-y kind of style.  The location is incredible, they are situated right on the edge of a cliff overlooking the marina and the ocean.  So far so good.  Friendly and helpful assistance at

I had a meeting in Laguna Niguel and decided to spend the night prior in Dana Point at Blue Lantern. Everything from start to finish was excellent. Location is easy to get to. Parking is conveniently adjacent to hotel. Check-in was efficient and gracious. They really welcome guests and make you feel like they truly appreciate your visit. They took all the time necessary to explain everything about the premises. The wine/cheese happy hour was both generous and relaxing. The continental breakfast was equally enjoyable and a wonderful start to the day. The room was incredibly inviting from the bed to the bath, from the ocean breeze coming from the balcony to the cozy fireplace watching a great movie on the wide screen tv. Nearby are a great assortment of restaurants, ALL within

My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights as part of our honeymoon. After falling in love with the place whilst researching it before going, we were not disappointed. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. We unfortunately didn't have an ocean view room, but the rooms from the downstairs seating areas and the viewing area next to it were amazingly beautiful. Our room was large and well decorated. The bathroom was large and well stocked.A great supply of complimentary toiletries and coffees/teas. It was the liitle touches with this place that made it what it was, from the way it was decorated throughout the hotel, to the complimentary afternoon wine, tea, coffee and hors d'oeuvre, to the bikes your can take to explore the area. The walk down to the marina through the park

This will be a memorable stay if you choose to spend a few nights at the Blue Lantern Inn. I have stayed here a couple of times and enjoy all the amenities and the breakfasts are delicious. Afternoon appetizers are wonderful and the wine looks great, although I don't drink. Coffee and tea are always available..just make your reservation well in advance as they are booked yr. round.

Summary Heading: Great location, friendly staff, fantastic views...BINGO!
Summary: The Blue Lantern is a fabulous inn with everything going for it. The inn is located on a cliff overlooking the harbor at Dana Point; the views are breathtaking.   The rooms are large and spacious and have all the extras that I was looking for. Rooms include, robes, free Wifi, free soda, and they have a free happy hour each day.   Each morning a free breakfast is included too and there is enough food to start the day out right.   I would stay there again and highly recommend the Blue Lantern Inn.

The Blue Lantern deserves it's top ranking in Dana Point.  A superb location, moderate pricing and Fabulous staff combine to make a rewarding experience no mater the occasion.    We stay there every time we have to be Southern CA. and have NEVER been disappointed.  Have a great time.

Summary Heading: Wonderful Location with Views of Harbor
Summary: This was our furtherist stop (South) down the West Coast.  Unfortunately the Traffic was so bad we were late checking in and missed the afternoon wine, etc.  But we really enjoyed our stay.  Our room was wonderful with a partial view of the harbor. Everything felt first class!  The large room, bathroom, jacuzzi tub and shower.  The morning breakfast was wonderful.  We wish we could of stayed longer and used the complimentary bikes.

We enjoyed every minute of our stay at Blue Lantern Inn; the room was lovely, the view fantastic and the service was great. The morning breakfasts and daily cookies were delightful and having bikes available to ride was a fun treat.

Recently my wife and I took a trip driving the coast od California.  After reading the reviews of the Blue Lantern we booked a two night stay at the end of September.  We wished we had booked a week stay.  The blue lantern sit on top of a ridge over looking Dana Point Harbor.  The view is worth the stay but what makes it exceptional is the service, the leanness and the rooms themselves. The breakfast has many options and is always re-freshened often so everything stays warm or fresh the entire time no matter when you go down for breakfast.  The entire town is welcoming and they have several very good restaurants with in walking distance.  let the staff make your reservation as we found there was some extra added to the meal just because you were staying at the Blue Lantern.

I'll be honest, I didn't really have high expectations when it came to Blue Lantern Inn.  I had a feeling it suffered from an identity crisis.  Was it a small hotel 3 star hotel?  A motel since its just  of PCH?  A simple hotel with great service?  A fancy hotel with average service?  It certainly can't be a boutique hotel, is it?  IS it? Certainly you don't hear much about this place so I really wasn't expecting much.  I can proudly say that the establishment exceeded expectations on all levels.   You have a small, 28 room or so botique establishment with service and amenities to match.   Its truly hard to fault the place so if you see any nitpickings, they aren't really major cons, just "suggestions" for an even better experience   For being an "inn" there were a surprising

This is a very lovely Inn.  The common spaces are huge and well equipped, with plenty of room to lounge in the dining area, the sitting area, and another large area with a big screen television.  Outside, there are several patio spaces with outstanding views of Dana Harbor and the Pacific Ocean.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  There is free wi-fi.  Breakfast was good, with a nice selection of breakfast foods plus a hot dish every morning.  There was also a late afternoon 'cocktail' hour with wine and some very nice hors d'oeuvres.   We stayed in one of the Pacific rooms which was wonderful.  It was very large, with a shower and hot tub, fireplace, large television and small sitting area.  While these rooms all have a view of the ocean, ours was minimal and really only

This hotel has the basic ingredients to be great but misses the mark. The staff were lovely. The building has real character and its located on a cliff overlooking the harbor which gives it a great aspect.  Wine and finger food available complimentary at 4. Two free diet cokes in the room. Free wifi, decent coffee maker, nice robes, basket full of local restaurant menus to review in the lounge. All good.  But they HAD to furnish it from the catalogue of generic hotel furniture? They decided that putting open waste paper bins with plastic bags inside them would make the place look better! Breakfast was not so good. The inside of the elevator didn't seem to have been cleaned in the recent past. The room I got had a fantastic ceiling, most of which they had covered with a false

Summary Heading: Most beautiful relaxing hotel I've ever stayed in
Summary: I've stayed at lots of hotels from the quick pull ins off the highway to the five star resorts. Granted this place isn't an all inclusive Caribbean vacation but it is the most perfect place for what it is. The views are breathtaking! Just absolutely gorgeous! The staff is wonderful, very friendly, courteous and helpful, but not to the point of being annoyingly so. The room we stayed in had a wonderful view, was very clean, nice big bathroom. Just everything you need and then some. We really enjoyed the bikes that are free to use. Don't plan on any spirited rides but more of just a nice easy cruise. There's some awesome restaurants in walking distance and tons of activities to do nearby and down near the harbor. I almost don't want to write this review because I'd love the place

Summary Heading: Almost Like a Bed and Breakfast
Summary: My husband and I and another couple spent two nights at Blue Lantern Inn in early September.  We were pleasantly surprised at how charming the Inn was.  It felt more like a bed and breakfast than a hotel.  The exterior as well as the interior are charming.  The decor in our good-sized room was warm and inviting.  The linens were high quality and the bed comfortable.  We had a balcony with a great view of the harbor (and tall ships!) and the ocean beyond.  The buffet breakfast was quite good.  One morning was scrambled eggs (not runny, not rubbery...quite good!), crisp bacon, fresh fruit, scones, muffins, cold cereal, oatmeal, juices, coffee, and teas.  Next morning the eggs and bacon were replaced with a yummy quiche and French toast.  The women at the front desk were very

We stayed here for 4 nights after a long flight from Australia. It was only a bit over an hours drive from LAX & was a perfect place to unwind before going to a conference in San Diego. The Blue Lantern had lovely views over the Marina in Dana Point and we found the room very spacious with comfortable bedding & very large bathroom. We thought that the breakfast was good but not outstanding & it was a lovely touch to have afternoon drinks & nibbles included in the tariffs.  There were lovely restaurants within walking distance of the blue Lantern.  I think that the location of the Inn is wonderful because it is right on the coast away from the busy coast road & there are beautiful walks nearby. The nearby beaches also are very good. The only downside we had was some noisy

Only stayed for overnight visit the hotel is warm and friendly. The rooms are comfortable,spacious and clean. The bathroom was large and clean   The position of the the hotel is what makes it spectacular  the views are outstanding. We were lucky enough to stay while the tall ships were in harbour. Would recommend that everybody visits (if you can,t get in to the hotel as it is very busy ) then just visit dana point, fab shops and  restaurants,we tried shacks burger joint,excellent value for money. Cannot wait till we return.

Labor Day weekend was the third time we have stayed at this wonderful bed and breakfast in Dana Point, CA. Setting on a bluff overlooking the Dana Point harbor, each room has either a patio or balcony with fantastic views of not only the harbor but the blue Pacific.  Rooms are spacious and well appointed. A delightful breakfast is served each morning with wine and various snacks in the afternoon. The staff, without exception, are very helpful providing suggestions for restaurants and other attractions. We look forward to our next stay!

Summary Heading: Excellent place for short stay on West Coast trip
Summary: Very friendly and comfortable small hotel in great location.  We stayed here for 3 nights as part of a longer trip in USA, the hotel is just over 1 hour from LAX so an ideal first stop.  Very pleasant walking trails around the hotel and harbour, and within a short drive of other locations such as Laguna Beach, Crystal Cove, etc.  Good breakfast, we had different 'specials' each day (frittata, pancakes, etc).  Excellent restaurants nearby.  Would definitely recommend for short stays as part of a west coast tour.

We loved our stay at the Blue Lantern Inn. A beautiful destination when driving from Los Angeles for a change of pace. Our room was large with comfortable beds and an enormous bathroom with a perfect showerhead. We enjoyed taking walks directly from the Inn, there were several food options in walking distance and there's a trail with fabulous views of the harbor.

We went here for our anniversary, wanting somewhere special.   It was everything we had hoped for and more.  The rooms were very nice and very clean. They had a fireplace and also a jazzuzi tub AND ALSO A Jacuzzi tub.   Even had soda in the frig to take.  The view of the harbor and ocean was absolutely spectacular.  It was so peaceful and relaxing to sit out on our patio.  You could see all the activities in the harbor and we had our binoculars hoping to see a pod of dolphin or even a whale, but never did.  The staff was very nice and helpful.  They had a full  breakfast in the morning and a wine reception with lots of appetizers in the afternoon.  Couldn't ask for anything more.

Don't get me wrong, this is a perfectly decent and comfortable place to stay, but for us (a well-travelled retired British couple who stayed four nights) it simply didn't live up to its not inconsiderable Tripadvisor billing. Or to put it more bluntly, it wasn't worth the money, in our view. Yes, the location is superb and the views are delightful but really, that's out of the hands of the owners/management...  On the plus side: the bed was very comfortable; towels and bedding were good quality; public areas (indoor and outdoor) were spacious and well-kept; the free parking was welcome; and all the staff were friendly and helpful. The flavoured water/cookies/wine & cheese are nice touches.  But..and this is what drags down our overall rating...the whole place (including our room

We stayed at 6 hotels on our 2 week trip.  I can't say enough about Blue Lantern!  I liked it better than the Montage in Dana Point!  The view spectacular.  We had balcony with the Pacific Edge room.  The room was beautiful along with the view.  It had a fireplace too!  Frig in room to use also with soft drinks.  I thought the Happy Hour with wine and appetizers was really nice.  Breakfast also was varied.  Coffee and tea available all the time.  Cookies and flavored water during the afternoon.  They are always doing something.  A video library to watch dvd's in room too!  Pleasant staff also.  As for worn furniture I think it's antique like and not the typical old motel type furniture that some reviews made it seem to be.  Parking is right there and the wonderful views.  Close

During a recent visit to the LA area I met up with a girlfriend and we stayed 2 nights at the Blue Lantern Inn.  We had a very comfortable room with a partial ocean view, 2 queen beds and a fireplace.  Our little balcony on the third floor was nice for a view of the harbor.  Wine and cheese in the afternoon was a welcome treat.  Great video library available - we got take out and did a chick flick movie night. Staff was helpful with instructions and special breakfast for my gluten free friend.  Can order a pot of coffee to be delivered to your room in the morning - so nice!
