Went by bus to Laguna Beach on a rainy day for some shopping.  Duet in Laguna Beach was a great clothing shopping find.  Loads of store for browsing. Had lunch at the Harbor below the inn and walked the

We borrowed the bicycles and had a great time.  The inn is very comfortable. Complimentary sodas, breakfast, and evening meet & greet really makes staying here fun.  The staff are terrific and very helpful.

We were warmly welcomed by the staff and arrived just in time for wine, cheese and fresh veggies and dip.  A great beginning.  Loved our room that had a tiny view of the bay.  A nice fireplace and two wingback chairs gave the room a comfy feel to it.  Slept well and were able to leave a window open for a nice ocean breeze.  The Inn sits on a bluff at the end of a street so there was only foot traffic.  Breakfast was delicious and plentiful.  All areas of this Inn are warm and inviting.  It was our first visit but we will surely come again. Parking is right next door and there is no charge.  Also two nice restaurants are steps away. My only complaint is that the bathroom had many areas that should be repainted and wouldn't take a lot of time or effort to do.  (Room 307)  For the

Summary Heading: The way a B&B should be
Summary: This is a wonderful bed and breakfast set high on a bluff overlooking Dana Point Harbor.  The height and views mean no easy beach access, but beach access is very close by.  The views are tremendous, and I love the atmosphere of the inn.  Many bed & breakfasts are a little on the fussy side, which puts off my husband, but we found our room at the Blue Lantern to be understated, well-appointed and elegant.  The linens in particular are top notch, and they do have the usuals like fluffy white robes as well as in-room Keurig coffee makers.  The staff is great, and we really enjoyed afternoon appetizers and wine with that marvelous ocean view.  Breakfast was actually very good, with a mushroom and egg dish and lots of bacon, but the home-baked goodies such as stuffed french toast

We arrived at the hotel late after our wedding ended.  The man at the front desk was so kind and hospitable.  Our room was excellent - especially the bathroom and the tub.  Breakfast was nice and the views are breathtaking.  Parking is easy and convenient.

We were heading to California for a graduation and wanted to extend our stay to places we had not seen before. I looked around Laguna Beach but things were pretty pricey and in my search I stumbled upon the Blue Lantern which is just a bit south of Laguna. I read about the Four Sisters Inns and recognized another place we had tried to stay once, the Healdsburg Inn. Knowing the reputation of that Inn I did not hesitate to book Blue Lantern. It was one of the most wonderful places I have ever stayed!! (Also quite romantic)! Our friends joined us and they had a beautiful room as well with an even better view, they had upgraded them to a larger space as they had 3 in the room.The location is spectacular perched on a bluff overlooking the harbor. We had a semi ocean view room where

I wasn't going to write this review because then others would discover this beautiful place and I want to keep it to myself.This has to be my favourite hotel ever........views to die for, wonderful rooms, luxurious bathrooms, plenty of free wine , beach, shops and restaurants nearby. The staff are wonderfully attentive but not intrusive. However..........I have to agree with other reviewers that breakfast could be improved.  Sitting in the small patio garden overlooking the ocean at sundown has to be one of the best experiences ever.

Wonderful view.  Great staff.  Sit on the patio and get some of their local wine (very affordable and quite nice) and soak it in.  Highly recommend.  Lots to walk or bike to (with their fun big old school bikes). Enjoy.

We travelled from the UK and spent 5 nights here at the end of May to attend a family wedding. The reception staff were friendly and informative and were always on hand if needed. Our room was spotlessly clean, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was especially spacious and we had a great ocean view. The cheese and wine available in the afternoon was well received and the fruit flavoured water on tap was more than welcome on occasions.  However the "Signature Breakfast" was not up to the standards we have experienced in other bed and breakfast inns we have stayed in over the years.  We were told breakfast was available from 8am. While we were there it was never completely ready at that time. It was brought out in dribs and drabs and it seemed as though there was only one

Lovely, charming place.  Even the city view rooms were very nicely decorated and furnished.  Staff was top notch and very nice.  Good breakfast, beautiful property.  Only one disappointment was that there were very full pillows.  Will definitely come back!

I stayed here for 2 nights a week ago as a mini getaway just for myself.  The views from the rooms are stunning!  However, I was disappointed to find that there was no easy beach access. When I arrived the staff had accidentely rented my room to someone else.  I had to wait in the lobby for almost an hour for them to fix the error.  They ended up giving me a different room with one of my night's free.  I had to move to a different room the second night-which was inconvenient.  However, the free night made up for it. I had an excellent swedish massage in the "spa."  The "spa" was really just one room.  But it was done nicely and again, the massage was great. The most disappointing aspect of my stay was the breakfast each morning. The website shows quiche and french toast, but

Our room was beautiful.  The view from our balcony will stay with me forever.  We took nearly 100 pictures in an around Dana Point.  The food was delicious and the staff attentive and eager to please.  We are planning a return soon!

Our room had the most beautiful view!  We loved getting a morning paper and going down for a yummy breakfast everyday before our walk.  The staff was very helpful with any thing we needed. We would definitely return, in fact we can't wait!

Lets face it, some places by the beach are a bit feeble at their attempt to create a good experience, let alone deliver what they advertise. Well, that will not be the case at this lovely little lantern more than exceeds. It's a great looking, victorian-cottage place on the bluff overlooking and endless ocean view. Its clean, has beautiful rooms, VIEWS, free parking, breakfast is delicious and they have wine, fruit with cheese and crackers in the afternoon.  We love staying here and always leave refreshed and rejuvenated. There is no pool, but its a little B&B typish place, not a resort.

Perched atop a high cliff overlooking the Dana Point yacht harbor the Inn offers a quiet and dignified get-away for a night or two. Even at the afternoon wine and cheese offering guests tend to speak in whispers. Each room in the Inn is different, and also priced differently, so do some research to find the perfect setting for you and your significant other. The Cannon Restaurant is within close walking distance, but you will want to have your car to explore the rest of the town. The beds are luxurious and everyone feels pampered. Breakfast in the morning consists of fruit and baked goods and is served in the lobby/living room area. It's delicious, but light. There is no swimming pool or spa.

4th time stay already...still impressed. The best hotel in Dana point....great view..great wine..great room..free spacious parking...lovely breakfast...and yummy snack served at 4...love this place!!!

The Blue Lantern was selected as the international wedding destination for my Canadian son and his Japanese bride and their two families.  It could not have been better.  The location on the bluffs overlooking the marina with its wonderful patio/terrace was second only to the outstanding service and rooms that everyone enjoyed immensely.  Staff went out of their way prior to our arrival to ensure all was as the bride and groom wanted it as well as to accommodate our requests such as a last minute private tour of the Los Angeles area for 9 non-English speaking visitors to offering us all a latenight glass of wine to finish off the celebrations to ensuring we could reservations at nearby restaurants.  We found the food both at breakfast and during happy hour to be excellent but we

Summary Heading: The PERFECT Getaway with extra special ammenities
Summary: My husband and I just returned from a relaxing stay and superb amenities at the Blue Lantern Inn. The location is quiet and beautiful. The rooms are exceptional. The breakfast is very nice and tasty. My favorite time of the day was the daily afternoon tea, wine, cheese and crackers, and other tasty finger foods offered to guests. Sitting on the veranda for breakfast and afternoon wine was the perfect way to relax.   Dana Point is small so we ventured to Laguna Beach for most of our other dining experiences. K'ya Bistro was our favorite. We also did most of our shopping there.  One point  that I must mention is that the Blue Lantern has no pool. This was not an issue at all for us but I did want to point it out. Instead you get a wonderful view of the harbor from the bluff (see

Summary Heading: Great view, great place very romantic
Summary: This Four Sisters Inn is a favorite. Just an hours drive from Los Angeles, we find ourselves in a very charming 3 story cottage b and b.  Our room features a king size bed, bath with jacuzzi tub, a beautiful view out the window bay overlooking a gazebo, the Dana Point bluffs, the harbor and the ocean.  Great stuff inside and out.  They serve an enjoyable breakfast and in the afternoon, wine with some accompaniments. We have stayed in several different rooms.  Some have outside balconies  This trip was last minute and we were given a special price for the room.  There are less expensive places to stay and,all things considered, we will be back again.

Booked this inn to celebrate our anniversary.  We're not a glitzy couple so didn't particularly want to go to the Montage etc but wanted something quaint, eclectic, quality, with nice food and a great atmosphere.  By the look of the website, the Blue Lantern Inn fitted the bill perfectly.  Yes, it was pricey ($320 for one of the standard rooms) but I really thought it would be worth it.  Such a disappointment!  For that money I was expecting so much more - this was a third rate boarding house - old, out-dated, in need of repainting and refitting.  Everything felt shabby and old.  It would have been fine at $150 a night but at $320 (and that was one of the lower priced rooms) it was outrageous.  Breakfast was little better than a motel lobby breakfast.  Wish I'd spent another

Stayed here many times - still a favorite hotel with excellent service, quality and lovely view over the cliff of Dana Point harbor. Although, I miss the bears tucked in bed at night and the higher end breakfast strata of the past.   Clean, spacious and plenty of room to relax in your room as well as common areas. Everyone on staff makes you feel welcome and is helpful. Great value   Left something behind and they called before I even realized it was missing !  Stan, the night manager, is a standout ! Sorry he was not on duty the last night to say thank you and see you next time.

Summary Heading: Darling B&B, Beautiful Views, Great Value
Summary: A charming, clean, beautifully furnished B&B on the cliffs overlooking the marina in Dana Point.  It's a wonderful value vs other big resorts in the area: they offer free breakfast, wine/cheese hour, bicycle rentals, wifi. The hotel has several restaurants within walking distance, and is a great place to stay if you're interested in hiking any of the natural preserve areas nearby.

Beautiful place to stay overlooking Dana Point Harbor, absolutely beautiful. Every morning breakfast (two hot choices) with wine and treats in the afternoon. Homemade cookies are the best. We stayed in their only pet friendly room and it was spacious, clean and had a private patio with harbor view. We only live 10 minutes away and eagerly look forward to our next visit.

Quite and relaxing , clean and the staff very helpful and friendly makes you feel welcome! Will definitely stay again if we come back to Dana Point , and will recommend it to any one who wants to relax  Better than any hotel , very private . Beautiful view of the Ocean and harbor .

Terrific location overlooking the Dana Point yacht harbor and Pacific Ocean.  Located on a cul-de-sac away from any busy streets.  Rooms are large and well equipped.   The breakfast is varied and plentiful.  The afternoon wine and cheese session is very relaxing in combination with the great views. The staff is very congenial and ready to help in any way possible.  A couple of delightful restaurants are within walking distance of the Inn. This is a wonderful location to visit especially in the spring or fall.  We will return.

My husband and I travel to southern California every year to visit friends.  This time we decided to try a smaller hotel and we were pleasantly surprised with this gem of a place.  All of the staff were friendly and helpful, making reservations at nearby restaurants and suggesting interesting places to see.  The food was great and the added touch of afternoon wine and appetizers was wonderful.  Everything from the room to the view was perfect and made our stay an exceptional one.

Summary Heading: I won't stay in any other Bed and Breakfast if a Four Sisters Inn is available!
Summary: These Inns are amazing.  Every detail is perfect! From the beginning of your stay to the end!  Everything is the top of the line.  The breakfast is to die foe. The selection is superb! Wine, cheese and appetizers I'm the evening were great too. The cookies, warm from the oven! How can you get enough! The stuffed bears decorating the stairs are soooo....... Cute! I clouding the one on our bed.  The people in charge are so friendly and take care of any request. We go back as often as we can!

Stayed overnight for a quick getaway.  My husband called the inn direct and was offered a very good rate.  Front desk staff were pleasant and helpful.  Our room, on the second floor, was very clean and quite spacious with a small sitting area, fireplace, and a small fridge.  The bathroom was quite large with an over-sized tub and separate shower.  We did have a balcony that faced the side street with a lovely view of the harbor.  I enjoyed sitting on the balcony reading a book with a glass of wine.  We watched the sunset from the patio at the back of the inn and enjoyed some quiet time together.  The wine reception in the afternoon offered two types of wines and several cold hors d'oeuvres.  We had breakfast delivered to our room.  The breakfast was delivered on time and was

Summary Heading: Nice hotel in a great location.
Summary: When visiting grandkids, this time we decided to try a smaller place. This is a beautiful hotel in a great location on a bluff overlooking Dana point harbor. Pleasant room with a nice ocean/harbor view. Not easy to actually get to the harbor / ocean from there by foot . The description of the breakfast was far better than the actual breakfast. They were painting the lobby during our stay, leaving an unpleasant smell on the 1st floor.

Summary Heading: Dana Point and The Blue Lantern Inn
Summary: Blue Lantern Inn - was perfect getaway for our family.   Scenic views.  Quiet surroundings.  Close to the marina.   WE will be return guests very soon.  Nice lobby for family ativities.  Wine and Cheese platter in the afternoon was a great touch.

We stayed at Blue Lantern Inn last weekend for my husband's Birthday.  What a perfect stay!  The Inn is kept impeccably clean and all the staff are so friendly and willing to accomodate their guests.    We stayed in room 301, which was on the top floor and had a panoramic view of Dana Point Harbour and the coastline.  Although we are locals, we loved just sitting out on our private deck taking in the view and sipping champagne!    When we checked in, Laura, at the front desk, offered to make our dinner reservations for the Chart House restaurant closeby.  So glad we did!  When we arrived at the Chart House, we were given a VIP booth, prime location overlooking the harbour!  What I really appreciated about the Blue Lantern Inn was the friendliness of the staff and the ambience of

Summary Heading: a european style country house luxury hotel
Summary: This is a beautifully clean hotel. The wine and cheeses in the evening were very welcome after a long journey from LAX. A real bonus was the pot of freshly brewed coffee delivered in the morning. The breakfast was a big improvement  on the usual carbohydrate laden American breakfast. All the staff were keen to do everything they could to make our stay an enjoyable one.I only wish we had booked a room with a balcony.

We stayed, at the end of our Pacific Coast Highway Drive holiday, for 3 nights at this hotel. We were not disappointed with our choice. The hotel sits at the top of a cliff overlooking the Dana Point harbour. We'd booked a harbour / sea view room and were delighted with the one we were allocated. The room came with a jacuzzi, seperate shower and balcony. Everything about the room had been carefully thought out and tastefully furnished and decorated, including a gas log fire which came in very useful during the evenings. The balcony enjoyed tremendous views of the harbour and out across the ocean. The top of the cliff and the hotel's small gardens were covered with many shrubs in bloom and with many species of colourful birds to be seen. There was an interesting and pleasant walk

This inn was one of the best we have ever stayed in. The staff are fantastic. For being in Dana Point the price was extremely reasonable. The views are spectacular. Would stay again in a heartbeat. The rooms have Jacuzzi tubs, perfect for me since I have a bad leg. They also have a day spa downstairs, will try next time. Thank you so much for an incredible & luxurious stay.

We stayed for five nights for spring break.  The inn is located on a cliff  overlooking the harbor in Dana Point.  A nice feature of the inn is that there are many interesting walks right out the door. The Strand beach is a nice place to walk to, although it is a slightly strenuous walk.   There are also some restaurants within walking distance.  The harbor boasts a small beach and park area, but it is better to drive there than walk.  The view from our room was beautiful and I would suggest getting an ocean view or partial ocean view. However, if you want to save money and get a non ocean view room there is a great patio to sit on overlooking the harbor.    Our king room was enormous and the bathroom quite luxurious, with a separate shower and jacuzzi.  Breakfast and afternoon

Summary Heading: Should be on your Bucket List
Summary: Business complete and driving around deciding to stay or drive home...and suddenly there it was, sitting on the bluff, beckoning us to visit.  It was like that Christmas morning long ago, when nobody argued, everybody got exactly what they wanted, and breakfast tasted better than ever.

With 3 guests arriving simultaneously to check in, Laura, the front desk staff, took everything in stride and took time to make sure everyone's needs and questions were answered quickly and completely, without holding anyone up more than necessary. Genuine interest in the guests, and a warm friendly smile was a nice contrast to a Hyatt desk clerk in Monterey who never even made eye contact during check in several nights previously on this trip. Quiet rooms ( and a polite no cell phones rule posted in al public areas) made this a comfortable inn stay for us. Guests freely mingle over wine and cheese in the afternoons ( more was even put out for us late arrivals), and there is a chance to talk with folks in the morning over breakfast and compare travel plans for the day (Tahiti,

This hotel has it all; lovely location, well-appointed rooms, friendly staff, quiet sanctuary.  My sisters came from the snowy mid-west and stepped right into heaven, Southern California style. Dana Point is fun, and is centered between Laguna Beach (art!) and San Clemente (shopping!). It was perfect!

Summary Heading: A nice spot for a family get together
Summary: After a family event a group of the adults all decided to meet for a couple days and we went to the Blue Lantern Inn in Dana Point.   The facilities were really great and the staff was wonderful.   A nice location with a beautiful view of the harbor.   The common rooms were really helpful as they gave us a place to sit down together and just talk.   Restaurants were close by.

I travel all over the world and stay at some of the big name hotels; The St Regis and Ritz Carlton in Monarch Bay to drop names. Big lobbies, hustle & bustle to get to your room and the air of wealth and pretense permeates these resorts. They have their place. On my last visit to Dana Point I discovered the BLI... A quaint B&B overlooking the Dana Point harbor with well appointed rooms, cozy touches such as quality chocolates, cheeses, cookies to go with the fireplace in your room. It's quiet, in walking distance to a number of nice eateries in Dana Point and you can actually park your car without the fanfare/ritual of a typical large hotel: A breath of fresh air. In the morning you can take a nice quiet stroll (or run) along the scenic cliffs down to the harbor and come back

This is a lovely hotel in a very scenic location; our room was great with a large bathroom, fireplace and a balcony overlooking the water. They also have wine and cheese every evening and cookies available all day. The buffet breakfast also had a good selection so it had something for everyone. This is great for a getaway but there is not that much around the hotel, you’d have to have a car which we did so it worked out perfectly.

Very quaint and beautiful B&B right on the harbor.  We had a great room with our own private balcony patio that over looked Dana Point Harbor.  Exceptional breakfast every morning with a great selection.  Every afternoon there was wine and cheese for the guests.  The location was perfect because it was close to shopping, the harbor, and other local beaches.  One great beach was salt creek, fantastic park setting with beautiful sunsets.

We showed up early for check-in, and they were apologetic (it was our problem) and gave us a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine! The weather was damped, so we warmed ourselves by the fire with cookies and coffee ubtil our room was ready. The staff was very friendly and happy to help us. We lost hot water but ir didn't affect us because we were out at Cinneoplis. Regardless, they adjusted our bill (we didn't ask for them to do it). The view was charming and the location was concennient to many good restaurants. We loved and would definitely love to return. It is for couples, though. Definately no kids!

Us: Two Southern Californians and a 15 month old Poquito.  Pros:  Great location perched up on a dramatic cliff. First-Call Staff. Easy Parking. Nice food within walking distance. Loyalty Program. Best (complimentary) breakfast in Southern California. Great Wi-Fi reception. Free DVDs in the lobby to bring up to the room. Nice gas fireplace in room with the flick of a switch. In-room wine list decent - $18 for Pinot Noir. Complementary turn-down service.  Cons: Jacuzzi tub not really that strong would be nicer if they had a real jacuzzi overlooking the bay!  Perks/Notes: Rate: 165 inclusive all fees Booked online at 2:15pm - hotel front very friendly and quick, checkin at 3pm instead at most place it's 4pm.   Would I return? Yes.   Sent from my iPhone.

New Year's Eve getting ready for a party and there is no hot water.  Called down to Carmen at the front desk and she said let it run a little longer and she would check and call back.  Ran "hot" water 15 minutes and it never came on and she never called back...took cold shower.  On the way out I asked about hot water and Carmen said it should be working, but that she had another call about the water as well.  Checking out the next day, I waited till I had paid and then inquired about the hot water situation so as to not act like I was trying to get a freebie.  The lady at the front desk (manager) was indifferent even when the lady behind me said she had the same problem.  Not sure what I was looking for, but I did not expect a cold shoulder with my cold shower!

I had the most wonerful stay. From the time I enter the front door through my checkout I couldn't have asked for anything more. I was meant with a smile and a warm greeting room was perfect veiw off the charts all I can say is "WOW". If your thinking of staying here think no more and book it now. THANKS BLUE LANTERN INN.

we have stayed at this hotel many times, the veiw the serve the free wine are all excellent, within easy walking distance to dana point eateries and attractions, watch for special bargains on their website, best bargains always during the week for seniors, quick trip from la for a great rest stop during the week, the rooms oceanside have the most spectacular veiw, they even have bikes to borrow, the rooms are great, and very comfy, great for a romantic get away

Our recent stay at the Blue Lantern was the perfect escape. From the moment we checked in, we felt welcomed and at home. The space is beautiful and the room pristine. We immediately turned on our in-room fireplace and tucked in for the night. When we woke up in the morning, the views out of our window were a dream. Downstairs a full breakfast was waiting for us, complete with a cup of coffee and newspaper. This was the absolute perfect vacation spot for two city-dwellers looking for a way to unwind, sleep in, and relax in a serene spot. This will certainly not be the last time we stay at the Blue Lantern Inn and I would highly recommend this spot to anyone looking for an escape from your day to day stresses.

Very nice boutique hotel with a spectacular view. I would recommend this hotel for a couple that would like to have a very quiet time where you would like to be away from the world. The view is spectacular with room 206 having a small balcony that overlooks the water. There are some trees that obstruct the view a bit, but still beautiful. The hotel has bicycles available to take a leisurely bike ride around the area. There are some great restaurants within walking distance that have scenic views as well. I would not recommend this hotel for families or large groups due to noise concerns.

We stayed here in June for a weekend.  The location is beautiful and the service was even better.  All of our questions were answered promptly and everyone is very friendly. The breakfast is delicious, especially the granola! The room was clean, fresh, and well maintained. It was the perfect place for a romantic getaway.

Summary Heading: Everything great except check in people
Summary: Beautiful views of Dana Point Harbor which is the beach town after Laguna Beach.  Be sure to ask for a view room with a balcony. Room 301 at the very top is worth the extra money, and was pleasantly surprised that they had champagne and chocolates waiting. Great area for walking and relaxing after you get passed the check in staff which from reading the other reviews seem to be the biggest negative. Very unfriendly and condescending toward guests. Cannons restaurant is next door which has a beautiful view as well. From 4:30 to 5:30 wine, cheese and appetizers are out. Coffee, tea, cookies and cucumber, citrus water always available in lobby.  Breakfast was amazing with pancakes, bacon, boiled eggs, all kinds of bread, and juice. Reminds me of an older Cape Cod BB. Enjoyed our

We were really looking forward to our stay here.  Frankly, it wasn't all that we had expected. The woman who checked us in (Christine?) just did not have a very warm or welcoming personality and it never really improved every time I had to deal with her. In general, the vibe is that they are doing you a favor letting you stay there. The room was very clean and nicely appointed. It was great fun being able to sit out on our balcony overlooking the partial view of the ocean. The elevator alone has an unbelievable view. The bathroom with spa tub was very nice but we had to live with the noise of the waterjets, which wouldn't turn off, for an hour until the desk clerk flipped the circuit breaker to the tub. The breakfast was underwhelming and not up to the quality we had expected.

I recently attended a work conference in Laguna Niguel and both of the "top hotels" were blocked for some reason. I found the Blue Lantern online and it was perfect. Less then 3 minutes from the host hotels, with a warm and wonderful staff. I booked room 301 which is wonderful in every way. The complimentary wine and cheese in the evening and full hot breakfast in the morning were above and beyond my expectations. Friends staying at the host hotels couldn't get over the quality of my accommodations and the fact that my full breakfast was included while theirs cost $30 a day!  not to mention the free parking and cocktail hour. All this for almost half the price!  I will definitely be back with the family.

The Lantern Inn is suppose to be quality from top to bottom, location ok, facility ok, rooms are dated and showing wear.  Now the afternoon checking in staff, we arrived they  barely acknowledge our arrival, waited almost 10 minutes while they were on the phone , They should have put the person on hold and acknowledge us and let us know they would be right with us. We tried to ask several questions about the are, restaurants etc. again they seemed put out and just did not have the time to provide info.  Our last visit for sure.

While my trip was short, my stay at the Blue Lantern in was wonderful.  After a long, cross-country flight and the 30 minute drive from the airport, I was greeted by a great view of the Pacific when driving down the lane to the Inn.  When I got to my room, the view from the balcony was even better.   The main lobby and dining area are on the small side, but seating spills on to a quaint patio which makes the space seem less crowded.  Coffee, tea, naturally flavored water and cookies were available at all times.  Every evening there is a complimentary happy hour with wine and light snacks that encourage guest mingling. There is also a meeting room off of the lobby which works well for team meetings or family gatherings.    My room more spacious than I anticipated from a cozy Inn.

Fresh off the plane from Australia and an easy drive to Dana Point we looked forward to our stay at Blue Lantern..gorgeous!..We received a warm welcome and loved our rooms on the third floor all with harbour views. After a walk around the area we enjoyed happy hour drinks and snacks on the patio chatting with other return guests. We loved the view of the marina and tallships and the sunset. Two nights was not enough at this lovely inn..we hope to return again next year!

So I am in the hospitality business and have very high  expectations for service and quality! The Blue Lantern Inn not meet these expectations.   Room was adequate, service was not. Our towels which were used in the afternoon were not replaced and  the turn down service we expected did not happen on the second night.  The Breakfast was adequate and if you did not get down early  between 8-9 they ran out of food fast.The Bread and Pastries were packaged., Marriott Residence Inn style.  I have come to expect excellent service and food at a 4 diamond B&B, this missed the mark. I will not be returning. The Marriott Dana Point offers much better value, location and has a swimming pool.  I am sorry to have to report this disappointment, but I must be honest.

Again, based on reviews in tripadvisor, we booked into the Blue Lantern Inn in Dana Point. As high as our expections were, based on reviews, the actual experience was even better. Our room had a fantastic view of the harbor - picture perfect. The breakfast was exceptional as were the afternoon wine and appetizers. Considering all, this was one of the best values we've encountered in our travels. I would cross the country just to stay there again.

Did a one night stay here what a nice place. Our room had a small outside patio and a wonderful view of The Dana Point Harbor. It was raining but it did not dampen our spirits we just lit the fireplace and still sat out on our deck as it had an overhang so it was very cozy. Wonderful appetizers and wine in the evening and a refreshing breakfast in the morning ! We will return soon

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, staff could be more helpful and friendlier....
Summary: View of harbor from the hotel is great, and location is within driving distance to Dana Point Pier and Shops.  My room did not have a view, however, it was very nice and comfortable.   Nice touches are the complimentary breakfast in the AM, and afternoon cheese/crackers/wine.  There is also water and cookies as well as coffee and tea in the lobby. Free Wifi in the room is great as well.  The staff could be much more helpful and friendly!!  The only helpful and friendly personnel was the evening desk clerk, and he happened to be a college student working part time there. The day time staff could learn a few lessons from him!!! The day-time staff seemed to act like they were doing you a favor checking you in and out, and answering questions.    Upon check in, there should be a

Delightful!  Having stayed at Maison Fluerie (yountville) and Gosby House (Monterey) expeditions were high for this Four Sisters Inn.  Expect ions were surpassed.  A spectacular Victorian era hotel overlooking the ocean and Dana Point harbour.  The interior is extremely well kept and front of house staff extremely helpful and accommodating.  The views are worth the room rate alone.  Situated near to some good restaurants and within 10 seconds of highway 1 making it extremely easy to find and use as a base to explore the big tourist beaches nearby.

we recently spent five nights at the blue lantern inn in dana point, and were delighted.  pretty, comfortable and quaint - easy walk to the strand beach; bay is walkable as well (although further).   room overlooked the harbor, fireplace was so cozy after days out.  breakfast selections were just ok, but very convenient with good presentation.  wine, snacks and cookies in the afternoon/evening were a nice touch.  very charming, relaxing, and a bargain for the area!

The Blue Lantern Inn was a comfortable alternative to the Holiday Inns and the like available in Dana Point.  The room was large, with a firm bed and bathroom outfitted with all modern conveniences.  We had a room that partially faced the harbor and partially faced the street, and traffic/street noise was not an issue after 10 pm. WiFi worked perfectly.  The breakfast is served buffet style and is just average-- scrambled eggs, fruit, yogurt, bread.  Since the inn is larger than the average boutique bed and breakfast, the meals are not individually prepped.  Additionally, since the inn is larger, we did not interact with the front desk staff except when checking in and out, and the attendants in each case were not terribly friendly. The price is high, but it is Southern

Summary Heading: The Best Inn on our Entire Vacation
Summary: We recently stayed here on a California Coastal trip, starting in San Diego/Del Mar, Dana Point, and on up through Solvang, Morro Bay, Big Sur, Carmel-by-the-Sea and so on. This inn is absolutely outstanding in every way, and was by far our favorite accommodation on our trip, and we stayed in some nice places.  This topped them all. The location is perfect with a breath-taking view of the harbor and ocean. The rooms are large and very well appointed with luxurious linens and pillows. There was a very large balcony off of our room with great chairs and a panoramic view of the ocean and sea cliffs. The inn is on a very quiet cul-de-sac where there are benches and a gazebo to enjoy the panoramic views. Above all, it was quiet and peaceful. I never once heard hallway noise, plumbing

With only 29 rooms, the property succeeds in positioning itself as a B&B, offering quality breakfasts and early evening wine & cheese. Sitting area has an upscale nautical feel, with a great harbor view. Bath is large, with double sinks; tub is deep, so be careful in and out. King bed was below standard and should be recycled with one more suitable for a property of this type. Wifi is very closely held, with weak in-room signal, but there is a business center. Complimentary bikes are a new addition. If you walk the neighborhood of awesome homes, find the path from an overlook and take an interesting short walk to the other end for a great view of the boats. You can also take a long meandering stroll through the park down to the harbor, but take a rickshaw or taxi back!

Spent four nights here. Great location for views. Had a nice, quite small, room above the hotel entrance looking south with view of the harbour. Can appreciate the benefit of having a room with a balcony. Bed comfortable if a little soft my taste; good bathroom with great shower. Enjoyed the complimentary wine and nibbles each evening; also the breakfast buffet which changed each day. Appreciated staff's help to get a booking at one of the nearby restaurants. We had a very relaxing stay and enjoyed the peace and quiet against the hustle and bustle of the surrounding area which we were surprised about; at times it felt like being a suburb of LA to us. We were amazed that the very small visitor centre in Dana Point appeared closed the entire time of our visit

I've been returning to this quaint inn after finding it in '06. It has a bit of a bed and breakfast feel to it and the spectacular ocean view is superb. They have a small amount of rooms to choose from since it is not a hotel/motel. I've been here during the winter months as well as summer and enjoyed my stay each visit. I've stayed in both the Pacific Edge and Harbor View rooms.The rooms are large and cozy but they need to update the bedspreads as they look a bit worn and faded.  They provide a complimentary limited breakfast buffet and they offer complimentary wine and a cheese/crackers/veggie spread in the evening as well. They don't have an onsite restaurant but there are plenty of local restaurants in the area to dine at.   The service of the staff is good with the

My wife and I used to live in Dana Point and would either drive by the Inn or look out over the Dana Point Wharf from the Gazebo next to the Inn. Earlier this year, we drove by the Inn and it hit us as a possibility of where to go to celebrate our 10th anniversary. I made the reservations and on a Friday afternoon in June we arrived to spend the weekend there. We both agree that it was the perfect place to both celebrate as well as getting away to for a weekend. I had booked a downstairs room whose patio also looked over the cliff down to the wharf. The queen bed room also had a fireplace and big screen TV. They even had DVD's you could borrow as well as a library. They had a lovely happy hour with wine and small bites to eat. Their breakfast was simple and good. Don't miss the

Summary Heading: Not what we expected.  I'm sure it can be a nice experience
Summary: I'm sorry to do this but I feel you should know.....My wife and I had a horrible customer service experience last weekend at the Blue Lantern Inn.  Booked Pacific Edge room 4 months in advance. Checked into Rm #305 with view of parking lot and restaurant decking next door. ( see our photos) The balcony deck and table top was littered with palm date nuts from the big palm tree obscuring the view. Requested room change but was turned down because of our 3 night reservation. That night the visual exposure from our deck to the restaurant and their music until 10PM was not the experience we expected. The next morning made another request to move rooms. Was given the option to move for one night then back into #305 for last night. All with the only comment, " I'm sorry". I decided to

We loved our stay at the Blue Lantern, the only negative was we arrived at 9pm and were only there for 1 night.  The hotel was really gorgeous so nice to get away from the massive 5 star properties with no atmosphere.  The room was gorgeous we had a Harbour View room with a lovely fireplace, the room was massive including the bathroom with a wonderful jet spa which was very welcome after our flight from Denver & drive from Los Angeles.  The breakfast was lovely, just loved everything about this hotel.  The price and value was excellent.  Dana Point is a really lovely spot we also enjoyed Laguna Beach which we had more time to explore that area.

I took my mom to Blue Lantern in Dana Point for a mother daughter getaway and it was wonderful! We were enthusiastically greeted by the concierge who told us about all the amenities, accommodated booking us last minute spa appointments, and recommended surrounding things to do and places to eat.  The rooms are very inviting and modern. The crisp white linens and very comfortable beds added to the serene ambiance. The bathroom was spacious and our room came complete with a fire place, complimentary mini fridge, sitting area, and comfy robes. We checked out complimentary DVDS from their library to watch in bed, enjoyed their afternoon wine and cheese which was delicious, and also had a full breakfast with hot entrees, homemade muffins, and fresh fruit. The location is so peaceful

We stayed for two nights at the Blue Lantern.  Room 101.  Views were breath-taking.  Room was amazing with a separate sitting area with a fireplace, very comfortable king bed and a nice spa tub.  Since we were on the first floor our patio connected to the main patio for an even more spetacular view.  Staff was very helpful.  We had a delicous breakfast each morning.  Our stay was very enjoyable. They even had bikes you can take for a ride if you want to.  Cookies at night were a nice touch as well.

Summary Heading: Dana Point Harbor view is beautiful!
Summary: We enjoyed a lovely second floor Pacific Edge view from room 203 and having been forewarned by other writers on this site we were not startled by the Friday & Saturday wedding celebrations just outside our door/balcony.  The room, grounds and staff are all very special.  Daily breakfast and afternoon wine/cheese and snacks were lovely and the cookies delicious.  We enjoyed the Cliff walk just down the road as well as several area restaurants suggested by the staff.  We would certainly return and at the price I can see why it is considered a special occasion place.

We just returned from two nights at the Blue Lantern Inn.  We had a balcony on the third floor with a view of the bay.  Very delightful.  The inn is well kept and we enjoyed our stay.  We have been here several times before and always found the breakfast to be delicious.  This time not so much.  The egg dish was cold so we moved on to the muffin and fruit.  We were going to advise the person on checkout about the breakfast, however, she did not even ask if we had an enjoyable time, just checked us out.

Summary Heading: A lovely setting for a getaway
Summary: We have stayed here before for special occasions and for "just because occasions" and have always enjoyed the location, the rooms and the quiet.

We stayed at the Blue Lantern Inn on March 30-Apr 1 and enjoyed every minute of our stay.  The rooms and grounds are clean and well-kept.  The views are out of this world and the various staff peole were friendly and helpful at all times.  We especiall apreciated Peggy's advice on our queries about the San Juan Capistrano Mission.  We thourougly enjoyed our day there and her suggestion of The Ramos House for Brunch on Saturday.  It was a special meal.  B & B's and small Inns are our favorite places to stay, and this was one of many good experiences!

We've stayed at the Blue Lantern Inn before and have been very pleased.  The place is immaculate, staff is friendly and the breakfast is great!  Our room had a beautiful view of the harbor.  You can walk to Cannons Restaurant next door where we had a delicious anniversary dinner.  I know this wasn't the fault of the Inn, but I feel obligated to warn folks about the potential noise coming from Cannons.  They have weddings almost every weekend in the spring/summer season and the music is LOUD.  At first, we enjoyed watching the happy couple exchange vows from our balcony, but after the music started we quickly lost patience.  it went on until 10:00 pm - so much for our quiet anniversary night.  They even cranked up the volume at one point.    I know the Blue Lantern probably gets

We have stayed at the Blue Lantern Inn on several occasions, and each time we are taken with how excellent this facility and staff are.  The Inn is positioned at cliff's edge, and overlooks the sailboat marina, and affords a view of the ocean and beautiful sunsets! Every afternoon, the staff provides wine, cheeses, and other items.  Each room is special.  Very comfortable beds, fireplaces, private view decks (very nice for a glass of wine and sunsets).Your morning starts with a complete breakfast in a well appointed dining room, with windows allowing views of the ocean.  Complementary newspapers are available. The Blue Lantern Inn is at the end of Blue Lantern Street, and there is no traffic.  On site parking is provided.  Many exceptional restaurants are nearby, some within

Summary Heading: For a relaxing get away, try the Blue Lantern Inn-Dana Point, CA
Summary: We have been to the Blue Lantern Inn three times.  Located right on the cliff overlooking Dana Point Harbor, you are guaranteed a great view. Your stay includes an afternoon wine and appetizer presentation and a breakfast which has a different menu each morning.  The rooms are nicely decorated with a fireplace and sitting area.  Bathrooms are very large!  It is pricey, but you can sometimes get a special rate.  This bed and breakfast  is part of the Four Sisters Inns.

Summary Heading: What a view!  What wonderful amenities!
Summary: My husband and I recently spent two blissful days at this hotel. Having stayed at the Blackbird Inn and Channel Road Inn, both Four Sisters properties, we were expecting lovely surroundings and excellent service.  We were not disappointed.  Our nicely decorated room had a fireplace, a small but comfortable little balcony with a magnificent view of the harbor, and a huge bathroom with a whirlpool and skylight.  The happy hour snacks, served in a spacious dining room with elegant fireplace, were so substantial that we skipped dinner both nights (having eaten a hearty lunch). A computer that actually worked was available free of charge on the lower level. From the hotel, we were able to stroll to a beautiful cliff walk, then to a park, and down into the harbor.  The staff was

I've stayed in 2 different rooms here. They are all a bit different. Exactly as they appear on the website. Very well maintained and clean. The rooms have fireplaces and are very cozy and romantic.The breakfast and happy hour is good, try not to miss it! The first floor rooms share a big stone patio on the seaside so if you are traveling with a group it may be fun to be on that side together. Upstairs the views are nicer and you have a private balcony. If you want privacy the patio may not be for you. There are free bicycles and a nature preserve behind the hotel. Worth seeing. The staff is helpful and friendly.

My fiancee and I decided to elope before the big family wedding so it would be more intimate.  Just the two of us.  On Friday we booked the Blue Lantern tower room, 3rd floor.  They recommended a pastor for us and he was available.  They could not have made our weekend nicer.  Christina was our witness, we were married in the arbor outside the hotel overlooking the Pacific with beautiful views.  The room was excellent and very romantic, fireplace, four poster bed, beautiful view, large tub.  They had even put just married balloons in the room with chocolate and champagne.  They recommended a fantastic restaurant for dinner, and a gourmet breakfast was served on our porch.  The staff here made it all happen and shared in our joy.  Thank you everyone!

Summary Heading: A quiet and beautiful retreat with a perfect view.
Summary: If you appreciate Dana Point and don't mind getting away from the commercialism of the nearby harbor and beach life this is probably the place for you.  High on a cliff overlooking the harbor and ocean, this 29-room inn offers first-class accomodations and comforts at reasonable prices.  With a last-minute weekday reservation in February we paid $160 for a lovely room with an angled harbor view and a spacious green granite bathroom with jacuzzi and large shower stall and all the amenities.  Our room, like the entire inn, was immaculately clean and fresh-looking and beautifully furnished and appointed. Amenities we didn't try included four free bikes, a fitness room and spa massage services.  The final touch was an excellent free breakfast at tables either inside the dining area

This is the second time I have stayed here on business for a company retreat. It is only 20 minutes from home but it feels like a world away. The ladies who run the place provide great customer service and are very helpful. The warm homemade breakfast is very tasty with great coffee and a variety of teas. There are always homemade cookies and some sort of fresh homemade baked good available with fresh coffee. The rooms make me not want to leave. My room had a gigantic deep jucuzzi tub with a separate shower. Shower had built in dispensers for shampoo, conditioner and body wash instead of having to fiddle with those tiny containers. Fireplace and cozy sitting chairs with a gigantic flat screen TV, thick terry robe and my favorite, a Keurig coffee maker in the room! My room was on

The Blue Lantern Inn is set on a hill overlooking the Dana Point harbor and the Pacific Ocean.   The view is absolutely gorgeous.    Our room had a "partial view" which was more than fine (the partial was due to the fact that less than 1/4 of the view from our room was not of the water but a road -  no big deal).   The staff is extremely friendly and helpful.   There is a decent breakfast buffet - not true "bed and breakfast quality" but way more than adequate (fresh fruit, a fresh made egg dish and breakfast meat, bagels and muffins) and a nice afternoon "tea" with wine and "noshies".   Free internet is a plus and the common room is lovely to relax in.  The Four Sisters Group of inns (of which this is one) offers deals at various time (we stayed a 2nd night with a 50% discount)

If you wanted to have a very nice place with an excellent view and feel like you are visiting family this is the place to stay. The staff is very nice, you have access to many activities nearby and you can't beat the restaurants within walking distance. I would recommend this location to couples wanting to alone time.

A lovely place to stay but not a true B&B if that's what you're expecting. More like an upscale Courtyard.  Not all rooms have unobstructed views so be sure to ask. Pacific Edge have the better views and worth the extra cost if you'll be spending more than a night.  But even some of those have partial views.

We're from San Diego, so this hotel is just an hour's drive for us--but it's a better value than any SD oceanfront hotel. The view from the balcony or terrace is unequaled. The Blue Lantern is clean, effcient, friendly anfd superbly located. Free Internet, small gym in the basment. No pool, though. A good free breakfast. Right in the heart of Dana Point. Lots to do: shopping, fine dining,  cruising. Ferry to Catalina Island also. We'll be back!

This B&B is in an amazing location with awesome views. Very clean, friendly and helpful. Has a cottage feel to the hotel. Lots of great restaurants near by and beautiful beaches. Would highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Average C+ execution for an incredible property.
Summary: Overall the best description that comes to mind for the Blue Lantern experience is "average." Agree with a prior review which said this property has declined since it first opened. A real shame. To be certain, this is not a case of a place falling apart or some horror story of rusting pipes and rats running around, it's simply that the location and original property used to be a spectacular experience when it first opened. Now, it's a let down. Old sub-par apartment furniture, tv's that are jury-rigged, aged bedding, foam rubber extra blankets. Cheaping out on a lot of things that would bring this incredible location back to major league level. Right now, in baseball terms, it seems like a AA minor league baseball team when it could be one of the best on the West Coast. Perhaps

Summary Heading: One of our favorite places to stay
Summary: Located on the top of the bluff, overlooking the Dana  Point Harbor and the Pacific Ocean, This Breakfast is our favorite.   Rooms are impeccably maintained and ready for our arrival.    Breakfast is always just right and the late afternoon cookies, snacks and deserts are excellent.  We have stayed many times for business and pleasure and will return as we have found no better place with the views and amenities in the area.

Summary Heading: Everything was good, but worth the cost?
Summary: We stayed for 2 nights over Xmas holidays.  Paid extra for a balcony room with a view.  The room was just fine.  No complaints.  The tower room, even higher priced, would have a better view.  The furniture needs updating a bit, but the bed was confortable and all was clean.  Bathroom was nice.  I don't know I just expected a bit more after the rating I read on tripadvisor.  Breakfast was good the first morning, so so the second day.  We had a problem with the remote control for the TV, would not work at all, & once I called it was taken care of quickly.  We enjoyed our stay, but would we return, Iam not sure.  Other places to try first in Dana Point I think.  There was a sign no cell phones in the common areas, was not enforced,I am sorry to say.

We stayed at the Blue Lantern for a few days in December.  It is in a lovely location right by the harbor with harbor and ocean views.  We were greeted by a nice fire in the lounge fireplace--a cosy place to sit and chat or read.  The room was comfortable with a gas fireplace and a harbor view.  The weather was nice enough that we could enjoy our little balcony for a short time. Breakfast was fine.  Since we were visiting friends in the area we did not partake of the afternoon wine reception.  They have a special during the week which made the price attractive.

I was in Dana Point during a cold spell in December.   The Blue Lantern was perfect with their fireplace and jacuzzi tub in every room.  The staff could not be nicer.  The afternoon tea, wine and cake gathering was great, and the hot breakfast a wonderful way to start the new day.    With the view of the harbor and sunset to enjoy, nothing could be better.

My husband and I enjoyed a romantic getaway at this charming inn.  We enjoyed a "Pacific Edge Room" with a balcony.  The view was amazing and the room was spacious.  I was really surprised at how spacious the balcony was.  Plenty of room to relax.  Our balcony was on the side where the restaurant next door is but that was not a problem for us since there was no special event, but I can see where it might get noisy.  The breakfast was good though I had hoped for a bigger selection of items.  Overall a beautiful inn at a beautiful location.  I would definitely recommend it.    A savings tip for Costco Members:  Costco sells bedandbreakfast.com gift cards which can be used at many locations including Blue Lantern.  Usually they are sold for $75 (worth $100)...but they were recently

Summary Heading: Perfect Blend of B&B Meets Hotel
Summary: We love this relaxing Inn so much! It's the perfect blend of Bed & Breakfast (with it's FULL morning breakfast, relaxed and friendly staff, and afternoon wine and cheese hour) and Hotel ( with professional standards, nice decor (no tacky wallpaper) and no cats running about. HA!). You can use their beach cruisers at no charge, play a game, borrow a movie, take a dip in your own whirlpool tub ... and leave relaxed. Be sure to have them make RSVPs for you at Chart House, just a short walk away. It's SO YUMMY, you'll fall asleep super happy and wake up ready for some homemade granola, eggs and fresh brewed coffee.

I had such a wonderful time at the Blue Lantern Inn.  The service was great, the atmosphere was just what I needed (calm, cozy, a definite getaway) and the view way beautiful.  The only thing that was a little frustrating was the noise from the restaurant next door, but I know there's nothing that they can do about that.  The evening I got there I had had a long day, a challenging day and was greeted by a lovely concierge and complimentary wine.  What more can I say?..Oh, wait...breakfast was delicious too!  And the pillows were nice:)  Highly recommended!

Summary Heading: Fabulous views of Dana Point Harbor, excellent amenities, helpful staff
Summary: The Blue Lantern Inn is situated on a cliff above Dana Point Harbor with fabulous views of the harbor, Ocean Institute including the tall ship.  The room was well appointed with a balcony large enough for a couple of lounge chairs and a table.  Breakfast was included and consisted of the usual rolls, bagels, etc, a fresh fruit plate, hot oatmeal and two other hot dishes usually one based on eggs and the other on potatoes (we stayed four days).  In the afternoon there was a snack hour or so with crackers & cheese, a special plate, and a carafe of both a red wine and a white wine.  Both the breakfasts and snacks were provided in a airy dining area with both indoor and outdoor seating.  The staff was helpful with restaurant recommendations and menus (in addition to our Tripadvisor

I have been staying at the Blue Lantern Inn for years.  What a great place to stay when you are working in a busy place and want to come to a quiet place to relax and unwind.  The inn is a good value for what you get.  Wonderful room with fireplace and jacuzzi.  I much prefer the rooms with the balconies and water views.  Nice place to read the paper and have a glass of wine.  There is complementary wine and cheese in the afternoon and a homemade breakfast in the morning.  And, cookies in the cookie jar on the check-in desk.  It's not really an inn.  It's like coming home.

Summary Heading: Blue Lantern Inn  - a very special property
Summary: Our 4th time at this property!! We love the very gracious feeling this Inn exudes.  The rooms are all different in our opinion. Most have really nice views over the harbor. Alto seemingly pricey you get alot for the $$ starting with evening wine and cheese and other appetizers produced by the kitchen staff (4-6:30 PM daily). The kitchen is also  turning out fresh baked cookies daily.  The best part is their hot breakfast buffet which is quite fantastic and includes a yummy assortment of hot breakfast items all cooked on site in their kitchen, and NOT like breakfasts included  at mid priced hotels and Inns. Fresh fruit, coffee, teas alsoall abound..   The staff is fantastic and can help with just about anything including reservations for restaurants and more. There is free

Need I say more. Great location, right on the water. Beautiful neighborhood. Very nice property and delicious breakfast and treats. Some call this a B&B and it is too large, more of an Inn as the name implies. Nice, a little harsh on the budget though.

Summary Heading: A wonderful retreat.  I can't wait to return in February.
Summary: This is the second time I have stayed at the Blue Lantern.  This time I stayed by myself to attend an anniversary party a couple blocks away.  On my first two nights, I stayed in room 303.  I adored this cozy little room with windows and a door to a private balcony.  I felt perfectly safe leaving the door open all night to let the sea breeze in.  It wasn't quite as quiet as I would like because it also partially overlooked a cul-de-sac and someone arrived by motorcycle in the middle of the night.  Otherwise, I don't think it would be too noisy. I decided to stay a third night because I was loving it so much and they offered me a great deal.  I had to move to room 306 with an ocean and jetty view.  Again, a wonderful room with a more private balcony and very quiet.  The rooms are

We called last minute for a room and was happy to get a discounted "Carpe Diem" room rate with harbor view.  This B&B is a block from the busy PCH and located in a beautiful spot over looking the Dana Point Harbor.  We were greeted with friendly staff from the minute we walked in & felt relaxed right away from the busy work week that we left behind.  The hot buffet breakfast is served from 8-10 and afternoon reception at 4:30-6:30  with wine & cheese.  For dinner, there are restaurants within walking distance from the B& B.  This was a wonderful get away weekend,  we liked everything about this place and will return soon for a relaxing weekend.

Summary Heading: We absolutely fell in love with the Blue Lantern Inn
Summary: We took our hairy 4 legged white mop of a dog ( Dudley), and even though they only have accommodations in one of their rooms for dogs, Dudley was treated like a King. The rooms are just lovely, they serve a terrific breakfast buffet, cheese and wine in the afternoon, and a jar full of freshly baked cookies. The staff made us feel right at home. Also, we met so many of the other guests who felt just as we did. We will be back many times over.

We stayed at Blue Lantern Inn the weekend we got married.  It is right next door to Cannons where we got married, so first and foremost, it was convenient.  However, after checking in, we quickly realized how spectacular this place is.  Not only are the views incredible, the service matches.  We made several special requests which they took care of right away.  The room was beautiful, very clean, and spacious.  To top it off, they have refreshments in their lobby such as warm cookies, cool drinks, coffee, and breakfast in the morning.  We highly recommend Blue Lantern Inn and if you're getting married at Cannons, this is absolutely the way to go!

We were staying in Las Vegas as it was my partners 50th birthday!!  Before travelling from the UK we had decided to spend a couple of days down at Dana Point and after a lot of research, chose to stay at The Blue Lantern Inn......we were not disappointed in any way!! The room with a partial sea view was excellent and the bed was very comfortable. The breakfasts and afternoon teas were a delight!!!  We had a boat trip with 'Captain Dave' to hopefully see some whales..........again not disappointed, the dolphins came out to play in their hundreds and the icing on the cake was to see a grey whale with its calf!!!  A 50th birthday holiday not to be forgotten!!!!  The Blue Lantern Inn would be the place to stay if ever we were in that area of California!!!

Summary Heading: Our memories were the best part of our stay !
Summary: My husband and I recently stayed at the Blue Lantern for a nice week-end get-a-way. We had stayed at the inn about 10 years ago and had recommended it to friends and family in the interim. We were using a gift card and so we splurged and reserved a partial ocean view, room 205. The room had just been recarpeted with an indoor outdoor type carpet and by the time we checked out it was lifting off the pad and big ripples could be seen across the floor. The wine and cheese were very nice and we really enjoyed watching a young couple take wedding photos at the viewpoint in front of the hotel. Little did we know that the wedding was a stones throw from our balcony and that deafening music from the reception would be blaring until 10:00pm. So much for romance. The bed was unbelievably

Summary Heading: Would have been perfect if I had gotten the room I expected.
Summary: We had our wedding next door at Cannons so this seemed a perfect place to stay.  It had many advantages to other hotels in town.  We had scouted most of them in preparation for family members that would be coming in from out of town.  The Blue Lantern is a beautiful hotel, with a walkway connecting to Cannons and free parking.  The free parking is a big plus considering most hotels charge upwards of $12 per night for self parking.  What a rip-off!    We had 3 rooms booked at the inn.  2 city view rooms for out of town guests and a harbor view room for us.  Now this is where my surprise came in.  Since the harbor view room was more expensive, I expected it to be nicer than the city view rooms.  But that was not the case.  Both of the city view rooms were bigger, had more windows,

This was our second time staying here.  We didn't splurge as much as before and got a room that was not on the top floor facing the harbor below but our room was still large and very comfy.  It was a holiday weekend so there was more street noise and party noise from the restaurant on the hill behind the hotel but the early noise curfew of 10 p.m. took care of that issue.  The people that run this hotel are so accommodating and pleasant.  They act like they're happy to be working in this beautiful environment and are just as happy to share that with the guests. They made our dinner reservations for us. The breakfasts were very tasty with both hot and cold items and homemade granola.  Some other special "extras" were the homemade cookies served in the lobby, wine and appetizers

Based on the mixed reviews on this website, we kept an open mind when we booked a Pacific Edge level room for one night, checking in on New Year's Eve. We could not have been more pleased. Christine checked us in and was very informative, helpful and cheery. Our room was described as "partial ocean view: but it turned out to have a very nice view of the ocean and part of the marina; we could watch the paddle boarders and sail boats wandering about the bay. The room was very comfortable, the gas fireplace provided much needed warmth on a chilly evening and our "Happy Hour" was great with wine and light appetizers. Breakfast was fine with homemade quiche, potatoes and fresh fruit and juice. Any questions we had were promptly responded by Peggy. All in all a very positive

Summary Heading: Was a little surprised and disappointed........
Summary: Beautiful location. The service here was ok. The late afternoon wine and cheese time was nice; breakfast so-so. The room we stayed in was on the 3rd floor with a view of the harbor. Price was a little high. Dana Point is beautiful and at this time of year we had fabulous weather. Fireplace was very nice. Bathroom very large. However the Jacuzzi tub had mold all around the inside perimeter. A newspaper was promised to be delivered in the morning - but that morning was a holiday and we were told they do not deliver newspapers on holidays. The TV did not have sound on many of the channels and when we call the front desk and asked about this; they replied that the cable company was responsible and they had no control over this. Checkout time was 12 noon however our key locked us out

My husband and I got married at Cannons next door 5 years ago, and stayed at the Blue Lantern on our wedding night. Almost every year we go back to the same room for our anniversary (this time with our newborn). The service is great (especially Peggy), the location is stunning, and it is a wonderful place to stay.  I do have to echo what some of the other reviewers have said: the breakfasts are bad--really bad. Supermarket quality bagels, undercooked scrambled eggs, burnt pancakes, rubber frittata with no taste, and one day it was sliced bread (from the cocktail reception the night before) dumped face down in a globby cinnamon mush--so it was just a soggy glob.  I also have to agree with other reviewers that say  why do you display a cookbook boasting the breakfast recipes of

My husband and i stayed at the Blue Lantern for our 20th anniversary and it was a fantastic, relaxing, romantic weekend.  The room was clean and comfortable, the staff pleasant and helpful, the breakfast was good, all in all exactly what I had  hoped for.  For a romantic dinner there is a Chart House restaurant just a couple of blocks to the west of the Inn; walking distance!  I highly recommend the Blue Lantern for any special occasion.  Or 'just because'.

We arrived here with very little notice after we had to bring our dog to an emergency DVM clinic in Tustin and needed to pick her up the next day (we live in Los Angles). We arrived soaked to the skin following a drive in pouring rain and Laura, at the front desk, seeing our distress, upgraded us to a room with a great view of the harbor and a balcony at no extra cost. Our room was very nice with a fireplace and elegant bath. They serve wine and cheese at 4:30 pm and leave the wine out if you come home from dinner and want one for the road. They serve a full breakfast, eggs, bacon, orange juice, oatmeal, whatever you could possibly want. All together a very fine experience under the worst possible circumstances.

We had a quiet and relaxing anniversary celebration. It was a nice change of pace from the noise and chaos we usually experience everyday. :-)  The breakfast, wine, hors d'oevres and cookies are good. Comfy bed. Clean room. The staff is great. Wonderful view. We were lucky the weather was perfect and clear.   The nearby restaurant, Cannons, served okay food. But the harbor view table made eating there worth it.

Summary Heading: Sadly.....Not what it used to be
Summary: After coming here yearly since the place opened...we were disappointing in the staff they acted like they are doing you a favor & you are imposing if you ask any questions, & the food, pretty poor..watery oatmeal, dry muffins & breads, burnt cookies. Rooms are clean & place is quiet in great location thou.

It was the perfect anniversary weekend: from the cozy, comfortable room to the ocean view from our patio. The fireplace was a nice touch. The employees could not have been more helpful- every one of them! All rooms have dvd players, and the Inn has an extensive DVD library.  Great complimentary breakfast in the mornings and wine and hors douvres in the afternoons. Several good restaurants within walking distance, and great trails leading down to the beach. Will definitely return!

Summary Heading: Loud music and staff was largely unsympathetic
Summary: I will never, ever stay at the Blue Lantern Inn again for the simple reason that between 8:50 p.m. when we returned from dinner and 10:00 p.m., music was blaring from a wedding reception from the restaurant next door. We might as well have been on the dance floor. We were trying to watch a DVD, and we had to turn on the subtitles. IT WAS THAT LOUD. We were in room 205, which is closest to the restaurant and its parking lot.   We were looking for a quiet, pleasant place to stay for our babymoon. It has been over 2 years, since our daughter was born, since our last romantic weekend. While most of our stay was fine - the room itself was pleasant enough, the view was lovely, the breakfast fine if not particularly delicious or special - the weekend was really ruined by the noise. We

This hotel offered a restful haven and meeting place for family members who traveled from Phila for a wedding.  The view is incredible and although we did not pay for a room with a view, the staff invited us to have our lunch on the patio overlooking the marina.  Homemade cookies and juice were available during the day, followed by wine and cheese late afternoon and still available for a nightcap late in the evening.  The rooms were quite bright and airy, large, with working fireplaces, large bath with stall shower and seperate huge jucuzzi tub and two sinks. The buiding and rooms were immaculate.  Although the breakfast was not exceptional, it was great to just go downstairs and help yourself.  The staff couldn't have been more helpful.  This was a great place for multiple

Summary Heading: Deafening music, so-so food, nice view.
Summary: No doubt that this Inn has a beautiful view of Dana Point Harbor and nice rooms. That's why I can give it 2 stars. However... My wife and I stayed in room 305. I specifically chose this room because I knew it had a nice balcony, and was willing to pay a little more for that view. Upon arriving I noticed that the balcony overlooked a restaurant. Unfortunately for us, there was a wedding reception held there on Saturday night. The event went from about 6pm to 10pm and featured music that was so loud that even with the balcony door closed I had trouble hearing my TV set and having a nice conversation with my wife. My beef with the Inn is that I was not warned of this possibility. They pointed to their website, which does mention the restaurant, but I didn't read everything on their

Summary Heading: Great Inn in a wonderful location
Summary: Everyone else has commented on the location and views, so I won't be repetitive.  The staff were quite friendly here, and the evening wine/cheese thing was just fine.  Comfy bed in an excellent room with a spacious, functional bathroom.  A stroll around the neighborhood was quiet and relaxing.  The only thing I'd change is the breakfast start time.  With breakfast starting at 8AM, this isn't the best place for early risers who need to get away before the crowd.

Summary Heading: Great relaxing stay and view unmatched
Summary: Stayed atthe Blue Lantern Inn for one night for my wifes birthday. I booked a winter rate city view for $140. When we arrived they upgraded us to a harbor view for free and had birthday baloons in the room. The room was a good size with fireplace and jet tub.  The inn was walking distance to the harbor and great diner options. There was a yummy tea time and a great breakfast served in the morning. Overall had a great time and would come back in the wintertime again when rates are reasonable.

Summary Heading: A Gorgeous Hotel with a wonderful view
Summary: We were a walk in for this hotel. We got it for $160 for the night which we feel was worth the money.  The rooms were stunning, really homely, like someone cared what they looked like. There was a wine and cheese meet and greet early evening which wasn't really our cup of tea. We thoroughly enjoyed the nibbles and drinks and managed not to talk to anyone! Fabulous! Breakfast was a buffet which was varied and readily replenished. The reception staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly. We thought it was a gorgeous building with a fantastic view over the harbour. Loved it all.

This hotel has exceptional customer service and goes out of their way to make you feel like you are at home while travelling.   The rooms are in excellent condition and the staff is very friendly and knowledgeable.    My husband and I plan to return and would stay at this hotel every time we return to Dana Point.

Summary Heading: location/view is great, the rest was so-so
Summary: you can read about the view in other reviews.I chose this place also because it was supposed to have fireplaces in the rooms. Well, that's not exactly what you get - more like a candle sized flame that the guests are not allowed to adjust - it was silly really. The breakfast was OK - not memorable. The wine from the evening reception was past it's prime to say the least - we fely it had turned closer to vinegar an dpoured it out. And unlucky for us, we had construction or repairs going on outside our room on the decking both the afternoon we checked in and starting at 930 the next morning making our balcony impossible to enjoy and our departure from the Inn earlier than we'd planned. Obviously this won't be everyone's experience, but for us it was a bummer.

Summary Heading: Charming inn with great staff and a fabulous view!
Summary: After one night at a hotel on the busy (and noisy!) PCH, we decided to find another place to stay and I'm so glad we found the reviews here about the Blue Lantern Inn! When I called just hoping they had a room available, Laureen was so helpful and put us in a beautiful room with a great view of the harbor and ocean. The Inn was quiet, charming and everything we could wish for a romantic getaway - from the ocean view from the room and balcony to the fireplace and cozy robes. We were visiting friends and celebrating my birthday and Lin, the manager, made reservations for us with extra custom touches that we appreciated. The entire staff at the Blue Lantern was top notch - friendly and very helpful. The breakfasts and afternoon teas were good and the common area was cozy and

Took the wife out for our wedding anniversary getaway.  The view over the bay was gorgeous.  Make sure you request the 2nd or 3rd level so that you get the best views.  The room wasn't too large but good enough for a couple that wants to cozy up.  The fireplace and jacuzzi bath tub were nice touches to the room for sure.  Also, their evening desserts was a really classy touch and great opportunity for people to get out of their rooms and enjoy some sweets before turning in.  The only thing I wish was different is the lack of a pathway to walk down the pier/bay.  There's a winding road from the inn to it but it didn't seem safe walking down it.  So, we just jumped into our cars and drove down.  A minor inconvenience for generally a great location.
The Blue Lantern Inn was simply wonderful.  A fabulous getaway.   Delicious breakfast included.  Comfy rooms, beautiful views, nice balcony.  Friendly staff.  Will definitely return!

Summary Heading: Very nice room, but breakfast a disappointment.
Summary: We stayed three nights in a city view room. The room was very cute with a stuffed bear waiting for us on the bed and anniversary balloons tied to the entertainment center. The bathroom was gorgeous and spacious. The bed was comfortable.  We couldn't use the a/c due to the noise it made going on and off. Luckily, it was cool. The evening wine was undrinkable, but the artichoke dip was amazing. The first breakfast was the best with a potato and egg casserole, fruit, english muffins, stale danish. The second was some rock hard egg thing (similiar to airline eggs) and the third was slicable scrambled eggs. The sides were always the same. The bread was quite stale. Muffins, waffles or pancakes would have been nice. We enjoyed the DVD free rental and the grounds were very pretty.

The Blue Lantern Inn is a charming small hotel with lovely rooms, extremely welcoming staff and great amenities, all in addition to the unmatched ocean view.  Morning breakfast, afternoon wine/tea/spread, fresh cookies...there was even a telescope on the balcony!   Spa services are available and the massages/facials were wonderful.  When completing the hotel's own evaluation form, I couldn't think of anything to suggest; it was that great.

From the moment we arrived, the staff was extremely friendly.  When we checked into our room, there was a small note card addressed to us along with "happy anniversary" balloons.  The location was perfect -- overlooking Dana Point Harbor.  It is also walking distance to The Chart House Restaurant where we dined at to celebrate our anniversary.  We had the most amazing couples massage experience ever!  Overall, we absolutely loved this Inn -- we will definitely come back again!
