Also, I highly recommend this venue for a wedding or special event.
Perfect staff, perfect room, perfect breakfast.  What more can I say?

Summary Heading: No other place to stay, this is the best
Summary: We stayed at the Blue Lantern while on business in Dana Point.  This hotel or Bed and Breakfast has the most amazing view over the harbour.  The breakfast was excellent and in the evening they have a very nice happy hour with wine and food.  Our room was beautiful, a large bed, sitting area and a bath with both a shower and tub.  The staff wwas very friendly.  There is a great Japanese restaurant not far away with excellent sushi and the restaurant directly behind them had great food and views.  There are two yacht clubs in the harbour, if you are a memeber of another club you can visit there, be sure to choose Dana Point West, they were by far the most friendly.  Go to San Clemente and visit the pier and shop at the Rainbow Sandal company, great sandals!

This was a beautiful inn with an amazing view.  The room rate came with a continental breakfast in the morning and wine and cheese in the afternoon.  The staff was amazing and arranged dinner reservations along with suggestions.

My wife and I were looking for a nice local place for a weekend away from the kids.  We had seen the Blue Lantern on a previous trip to Dana Point and I decided to book the weekend and surprise my wife.  We had a great time.  The staff was very nice and helpful.  When i booked the room we could not afford the higher end rooms but still really wanted a view of the harbor or ocean and a balcony.  The lady i talked to recommended a harbor view room that had a balcony (which the other harbor views don't).  It was a great little room (#206) with a queen bed that was fine for us.   The fireplace was toasty and the bathroom was beautiful.  During the day we borrowed a couple bikes and explored the area.  Overall we had a great time and could not find one negative aspect about our stay.

Summary Heading: Not exactly a B & B , but a lovely little hotel
Summary: The Blue Lantern Inn is not exactly a real B & B. It is more a little hotel. Isn't as personal as a regulare B & B where one stays in peoples homes. The rooms are clean and quite large. the staff are nice and helpful. The hotel is located near the marina in a quiet streefret and easy to reach.  Breakfast is rather poor.

Summary Heading: Cozy and Comfortable; Personalized Service; Great Value
Summary: Stayed at the Blue Lantern Inn for two nights in Feb 2009.  The staff was very attentive and helpful.  They seemed to personalize everything and made us feel important and right at home.  The hotel itself is beautiful with a nice interior, gorgeous and cozy (though not large) rooms, with beautiful balconies and views of Dana Point Harbor.  The many small touches made the difference: newspaper at the door every morning, very nice complimentary breakfast in the lobby each morning, helpful front desk, nice personal note on our arrival, etc.  Our room was beautiful, with nice decorations, nice large bathroom with separate shower and whirlpool tub, and robes in the closet.  Great value too!

Summary Heading: Charming hotel with great views - inattentive front desk
Summary: We stayed in room 201 having balcony with fabulous views over the ocean and harbour. the balcony has table, chairs and a sun lounger - ideal since it was a suntrap from early morning to late afternoon.  Complimentary chilled champagne & chocolates awaited us in our spacious clean and very comfortable room.  TV has DVD player  with DVDs available to borrow from reception.n  we could not fault our beautiful room  but be aware that there is some noise from upstairs which sounds like it has wooden floors.  There is an open fire in the room which was particularly welcoming on the colder evenings.    Breakfast is served from 7.00 'til 10.00am - we ate at 9.30 each morning by which time the breakfast buffet was looking tired and was somewhat disappointing.  The Inn offers compimentary

Oh well....the stay started out nice.  When we arrived at the inn Friday night we were greeted by a very nice, very personable employee at the front desk and were treated to fresh baked cookies and a nice glass of wine.    The inn is decorated very nicely in both the public areas and the guest rooms (we actually checked out several).  The next morning the friendly lady at the desk had been replaced by Cruella da Vil.  We made sure we stayed out of her way!!  Breakfast on Saturday was lukewarm eggs and overdone potatoes. Breakfast on Sunday was much nicer with very good baked french toast.  I was surprised at how noisy our room was.  We were on the second floor and we had noise from the guest room above, the kitchen below us and people talking on the street outside.  All in all

Summary Heading: What a way to end a holiday
Summary: We stayed at a sister Inn at the start of our holiday, The Channel Road Inn in Santa Monica and picked up a "Four Sisters" brochure. We had 2 days at the end of our holiday and, after our experience at the start, we choose to say at the Blue Lantern Inn. We found the staff really friendly and helpful, since we booked so late, we couldn't get the same room for our 2 nights but that was no problem as the staff moved all our staff from 1 room to the other while we were our seeing the sights!  We stayed in both room 101 and 204 and would recommend either of them. They both had excellent patios and those fantastic views, although The space and the welcoming champagne and chocolates in 101 were fantastic. We also ate at the Chart House on the staff's recommendation and were treated

Summary Heading: Front Desk Harried -- Loud Air Conditioners
Summary: The Laguna Ritz was full so we gave the Blue Lantern Inn a chance.    Check-in didn't make a good first impression.  The two front desk people seemed swamped with phone calls, and we had to wait , mayber five minutes, for check-in at 3:00 PM.  That ignored feeling was compounded by lack of any acknowledgement such as, "Sorry sir, I'll be right with you."  Lack of ability to give attention to guests seemed to be the rule rather than the exception during our three-night stay.  The air conditioner in Room 105 makes a clanking/rattling noise when the thermostat turns it on.  A similarly annoying sound when it turns off.  It also seemed unusually loud while operating.    On the bright side there is a nice, light breakfast buffet from 8:00 to 10:00 AM,  Housekeeping was attentive.

Summary Heading: Choice locale, stunning views, gracious service
Summary: We stayed in a corner suite with a magnificent view of the harbor and coastline from  the plantation-shuttered windows and the balcony.  It was sublime.  The room was spacious, clean, and attractively furnished.  Service was friendly and helpful, not at all pretentious.  Dana Point is a great alternative to Laguna Beach for accommodations.  The area is less hectic and has plenty of greenbelts and pleasant walking paths past beautiful homes, the coastline, harbor, and small beaches.  It's a short drive to Laguna Beach for wonderful shopping, entertainment, art galleries, and restaurants, but it's a pleasure to return to a serene setting like the Blue Lantern Inn.
We just return to florida after a 4 day weekend.Staff, room,veiw and atmosphere were awesome.I would recogemend the Blue Lanten to any of my freinds.The only place to stay in Dana Point.

This was the last leg of our three week vacation in Southern California and we saved the best for last.   What a wonderful property.   The location is great - we had a beautiful view of the harbor and our room was charming.   The bed was comfortable and the patio delightful.  Each morning there was a breakfast  with a hot entree.  We would have liked more variety for the hot entry however fruit/juices/cereal and muffins were included.  There was wine/cheese & dessert in the afternoon that was very nice.   You could have turn down service that included cleaning your bathroom.   All the services are included - free internet, parking,breakfast and turn down service.  There were games and books in the library and lobby.  They even gave us champagne the last night there and thanked

Loved our pacific edge room, # 202, second floor – view of the harbor and the ocean from a roomy balcony with table and chairs.  Over $100 less that the best rooms – 201 & 301, that have larger balconies, which jut out from the western end of the Inn with ultimate privacy.  We brought our breakfast up to our room each morning and had our afternoon apps. & drinks on the balcony watching the world go by.  They don't have coffee ready downstairs until 8 am. but we made it in our room if we wanted it early.  The breakfast was fine, always lots of fruit, muffins/breads, and a hot egg dish, sometimes with meat, not like moms home cooking, but plenty to get you through to lunch.  There was a party with music one night at neighboring Canons, but it didn’t bother us as we were usually

Summary Heading: Great getaway at this charming B&B
Summary: We recently spent 2 nights at the Blue Lantern Inn and found it to be a great place for a relaxing getaway.  Our room was quite nice - with a balcony overlooking the ocean, a working gas fireplace, and a jacuzzi.  Each day, they served a satisfying breakfast which we ate outside on the deck one day and upstairs on "our" balcony the next.  Late afternoon, they served wine and light refreshments.  They also had DVDs which you could borrow to watch in your room and a tandem bicycle which we took out for a spin.  The first night we were there, we asked for a recommendation for dinner and they suggested the Chart House.  They took care of making reservations for us and when we arrived (it is a short walk from the Inn), we were treated as VIPs and were seated at the only open window

Summary Heading: Great place for a get away
Summary: Spent one night here with my wife on Valentines Day and we had a great visit.   The evening wine was very nice as were the snacks.   The breakfast was so-so, regular scrambled eggs are my preference vs the scramblette.   Our room did not have a balcony and after staying here, I would recommend a room with a balcony and view.

My husband and I just got back from a weekend getaway at the inn. It was recommended by my sister in law. We could not have been happier. After I booked it,  I found this site and was a little nervous with all the reviews. My fireplace worked fine, the breakfast and snack in the afternoon was very good and the inn keepers were very nice and helpful. We look forward to booking another getaway there soon.

I had the pleasure of staying at the Blue Lantern Inn, for a week in January with my boyfriend.  Overall we loved the Inn.   OUR ROOM was comfortable and immaculate with no dust or dirt to be found anywhere.  I do look! The bed was comfortable and nicely dressed with neutral comforters and linens. We both liked the nautical decorations and the spaciousness of our room. The gas fireplace added warmth and a sense of coziness to the room.  We never heard any noise and slept like babies! The room was easy to relax in and call home for the week we were there. The highlight of the room is the view of the Pacific Ocean. It is truly spectacular. The room had plenty of windows to open up the wooden blinds and enjoy the view. THE BATHROOM was oversized with plenty of counter space.

Summary Heading: We've been staying here once a year for ten years
Summary: This place is a real gem and I think their prices are good considering the prices nowadays for similar upscale inns/hotels.    I'm sorry, but I cannot agree with several reviewers regarding this Inn.  My husband have been staying at The Blue Lantern Inn once a year since it opened, probably more than ten years ago.  It is our favorite "weekend getaway" place.  Regarding the comment about the noise from the restaurant next door, I am sorry that this happened to you, but  in all of our years staying here, we have never once has a problem with noise.  I asked the hotel clerk about this, and she said that there is one room on the far side which can have noise if there is a wedding on the weekend.    Regarding the comments from a couple of reviewers about the breakfast being just

We stayed for two nights in a Harbor View Room ($245/night) for a weekend getaway.  Check-in was quick; however the clerk seemed somewhat aloof.  She did apologize for not being able to give us a room on the top floor as we had requested on our reservation.  We had Room 209 and enjoyed that it was a room at the end of the building.  All the aforementioned amenities worked well (jacuzzi, fireplace, wireless internet, etc.).  We enjoyed the afternoon snacks and noted they were replenished quickly  when running low.  The breakfast  was nice with a hot egg dish, bacon, fruit, breads, oatmeal, cereal and a variety of beverages.   We really enjoyed exploring the Dana Point area.  Walking to the harbor was fun and what a view!  One night we ate at the Melting Pot in San Clemente (~ 4

We went to the Blue Lantern for my husband's birthday. I happen to mention his birthday when making the reservation. We were greeted with "Happy Birthday" there were balloons and a card in our room. The room was beautiful and the view was exactly like the pictures on their website. Each room we saw was spacious and had a fireplace and jacuzzi tub.   The front desk offered and made reservations when we arrived.  She was very helpful with suggestions.  We went to dinner at the Chart House. They greeted us at the restaurant with a "Happy Birthday" (the front desk had arranged for us to be treated as "VIPS")    This was a wonderful experience. I would highly recommend the Blue Lantern

I enjoyed our stay even though I thought the price for the room a little steep. ($210.00 for two nights because of a special deal they had going, two nights for the price of one)  The high points were: The hot tub bathtub in the room, the overall cleanliness of the room, the complimentary breakfast, free wine tasting in the afternoon and the view.  The low points were that the fireplace in our room didn't work, they were not willing to move us to another room after they failed to fix the problem, and they would not lower the bill after they failed to fix the fireplace.  Also, some more low points included not being able to eat the complimentary breakfast one morning because we came down at 11 a.m. and they had already cleared everything away.  It was our First Wedding

The Blue Lantern Inn is a beautiful B&B with a spectacular view of the harbor and ocean.  Stayed in the Inns best room (301) a few weekends ago.  The staff was great, the breakfast delivered to your room’s private balcony each morning and a bottle of Champaign and chocolates awaiting your arrival.  Took a bike ride along the coast, on a tandem bike provided by the inn and dined at great local restaurants (Gemmell).  So what could go wrong?  The morning of my departure, I was awoken by a phone call I received at 12:20pm from the inn's manager, Lin McMahon.  She stated she was 'surprised' I answered, as it was now past the noon checkout time, and she 'needed the room.'  I said ok, and said I could be packed and out in 20 minutes.  Well, that wasn't good enough for Lin.  She

My husband and I love this inn!  We were married just next door at Cannon's Restaurant that weekend and booked the BLI a year in advance.  We picked room 302 because it offered a view of the ceremony area and of the harbor.  The staff was courteous and welcoming.  My favorite room feature was the vaulted and beamed ceiling and of course the bed. It was fantastic! Sumptious, fluffy, and HUGE!  We are planning a stay again next year on our anniversary.  I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys the charm of B&B's.

We stayed here just one night during the Tall Ships Festival.  We had a Tower Suite Room (#101, I think).  The room was lovely, the bathroom huge, the sitting area with fireplace fine (although a few steps down from the rest of the room, something to consider for the mobility-impaired), and the views of Dana Point Harbor and the Parade of Tall Ships absolutely spectacular.    The only negatives I would mention were the noise from the restaurant next door (although, thankfully, they stopped at 10:00 p.m.) even though our room was one of the quietest on the property, and staff at the desk that was not as welcoming as we are accustomed to at B & B's.  They were professional, just not as personable or helpful as they might have been.    Both the breakfast and the evening appetizers

Summary Heading: Terrific room, well above average b&b
Summary: My husband and I called to reserve a room and asked for one with an ocean view.  I expected to be able to see a sliver of blue but our view from room 304 was spectacular.  We overlooked Dana Point Harbor, and could see for miles.  We found our room to be very spacious with a shuttered door opening onto the small balcony.  The room had a fireplace, an adequate tv with a dvd player, a very firm mattress on the king-size bed, and a large bathroom with a skylight in the center.   There was also a small refrigerator and sink.  The room appeared to have been recently painted (a seafoam green) and was quite clean and welcoming.  The staff provides newspapers outside the rooms in the morning and the breakfast was more than we expected, if not at all elaborate.  Oatmeal, dry cereal,

Sorry Four Sisters, I really wanted to love your inn. I am one of four sisters myself and thought your company name very cool. Unfortunately your Blue Lantern Inn is NOT. The decor reminds me of a nursing home - albeit a nice nursing home - but hardly what I would call romantic. Busy green wallpaper plastered everywhere, and where there wasn't wallpaper in our room, there was a very harsh, stark-white paint, making the mood of the room icy-cold. Furnishings were very traditional, fabrics were plaids & dark greens. Fake ferns adorned our room. I don't get the bears - childrens' toys don't make me feel romantic - ours was so unattractive I immediately hid it in the armoire. We thought the happy hour spread was of good quality and just as advertised. The only downer was that the

We stayed here on our honeymoon, both of us teachers, for our once in a lifetime chance to have an outstanding experience at a property that appeared to be a cut above.    We had a "partial ocean view" room which meant no view unless you walked outside of the room.  Nothing special was done for us even though they knew we were on our honeymoon.  In fact, no acknowledgement whatsoever of that fact was made.    We spent over $1000 to stay in a nice enough room, but could have gone much cheaper about a mile down the road, with a better view.  The property is absolutely gorgeous, as is Dana Point, but the room was average.  Overall, I continue to be profoundly disappointed about how much we spent on this place whenever I think back to our honeymoon.  We splurged on this inn, and it

My wife and I stayed here for a quick get away in June.  After one night here we felt refreshed and rested to return to our two kids in diapers.  We stayed in rm 202 - a "pacific edge" room with great view and private patio (see pics).   The rooms are very clean and the service was excellent.  No problems with noise from establishment next door. The breakfast was continental  with trays available for breakfast on our balacony.  I would classify this as a boutique hotel vs. classic bed and breakfast.  Overall, an excellent value for Orange County.

We've stayed at the Blue Lantern Inn a number of times over the years.  Have had rooms with and without balconies, and really prefer the opportunity to step outside to enjoy the ocean breeze.  This time, we splurged and got the top floor Tower suite.  Very nice choice.  The room was wonderful, the view spectacular!  On our last night, we were speaking to the attendant at the front desk (Danielle?) and mentioned we wanted to order dinner to the room that night.  She raved about a restaurant that was not on the list for delivery service--called the place herself, and within an hour one of the restaurant partners personally delivered a wonderful meal to our room.    Have always had good luck with the front desk staff--even housekeeping is cheerful and friendly.  The inn is ideal

Summary Heading: Wonderful blufftop site with expansive view of harbor and Pacific
Summary: Attractive inn sits above the harbor and offers sweeping views from the terrace and common areas. We had a ground-level room with doors opening on to a pleasant terrace with table and chairs.  The room was tastefully decorated and included a fireplace. The oversized bathroom was elegant with premium fixtures and a large jetted tub. I liked the way the room avoided looking "boxy". BUT, there were three steps down from the entry/bathroom level into the bedroom. We tripped on these several times while not paying close attention.  Cannon's restaurant could present a problem for some guests. Their terrace is contiguous to the inn property. A party with music on the terrace might be loud. We did not have that problem but could here converations of restaurant guests.  My husband is

Summary Heading: Ocean View B&B At Its Finest
Summary: A truly enjoyable weekend B&B.  First class accommodations and everything else described by others.  Not mentioned is afternoon wine and cheese which is a nice touch.  You will not find a better view, so spend the extra money and stay on the ocean side, if a reservation is available. (See my posted pictures).  We were in a room that was one step down from a Tower Suite, but it still had a nice balcony and though the Inn was full, we never heard any noise from adjoining rooms.  The only warning I would give is that indeed, the Inn is right next door to a large restaurant that holds outdoor wedding receptions, parties, etc.  We suffered through loud music blaring next to us from 3 to 5 pm on one of our days.  The Inn is currently in negotiations to have a sound wall built, but in

This b&b is a very  lovely hotel to stay for a short trip.  It is a little pricey but it was well worth the money.  The room was huge, clean and did not have a view of the beach but it was extremely quiet and relaxing.  The bathroom was enormous and had a big tub.  It was my mother's birthday and the lovely lady who helped me book the reservation remembered and acknowledged her birthday when we checked in.  Cherri is wonderful and the entire staff was very helpful.  The views are gorgeous and it's a great place to relax and get away from Los Angeles for a little while.

Summary Heading: Blue Latern Inn - a great choice
Summary: Having scoured the internet for something different to stay at along the coast in Orange County, I came across a TripAdvisor suggestion to stay at the Blue Lantern Inn at Dana Point.  After a little background research I decided to book a non ocean facing room, for two nights.  Having just come from staying at the Hilton at Universal City in Hollywood, I was extremely pleased with the presentation of the hotel and its location.  The staff were friendly and informative, the room was huge and the bed so very comfy. I personally felt that all of what was offered was fantastic and the Inn met my hopeful expectations.  The smaller things of service seem to be something they have captured here.  The fact that it’s a smaller and personal location bode well for my wife and I and we both

My husband and I stayed here one Saturday night and enjoyed our stay very much.  We stayed in room 210, a Harbor View room.  It met our expectations and more!  The bathroom was huge!  Two sinks, separate toilet, jetted tub, and robes.  The TV was a good size, they have DVD players and DVD's you can check out w/o cost.  Our room actually had two TV's, one for the bed and one in the sitting area.  The sitting area overlooked the Harbor and Pacific Ocean (we looked south towards San Diego).  The linens were clean, a sheet under and on top of the blanket...something all hotels should do!  They had complimentary sodas, coffee, tea and cookies all day.  Fruits, cheeses and wine during cocktail hour.  The breakfast was wonderful as well.  We had bacon, oatmeal, eggs florentine, red

Took advantage of an advertised mid-week package offering a discounted second night with a fully paid first night (still pricey) and booked weeks in advance. Upon checking in, found our room extremey noisy (jack-hammering, drilling, hammering) due to remodeling of adjacent room. After speaking with management, received a pretentious, "well, you're in a discounted room, aren't you?" (in the presence of other guests), as if we were out of line to complain or expect peace and quiet due to not being full-price guests. The staff would not mitigate the problem, so we chose not to stay, partially due to the noise, but mostly due to the offending attitude of the management.
- Absolutely great in every way - service, food, views, rooms - Would love to stay there again

This hotel, which is part of the Four Sisters Inns, provides excellent quality and value.  The rooms are spacious with nice bathrooms (even the cheapest City View rooms).  Nice touches, like teddy bears on each bed.  You get appetizers and wine in the afternoon, and a great morning breakfast.  There is a great view of the ocean at the end of the street, and nice landscaping and outdoor sitting areas.  There are free bicycles to check out, including bicycles for two.  Off-season rates were reasonable -- look for website deals.

Pros: Absolutely gorgeous location.  Drop-dead view of the ocean from the patio Nice comfortable room Friendly, helpful staff Free sodas Whirpool tub in the room Bathrobes in the room Nice appetizers and wine in afternoon  Cons:  Breakfast was so-so.  Next time I'll go next door (If a Sunday) and have the Cannon's brunch Very close to Cannon's and if a wedding is going on, you feel like you are part of it. TV small Bed nice but a little soft  Overall this place is  a gem. We were going to book at the Ritz Carlton, but decided it was just too pricey so chose the Blue Lantern instead.  We took one of the Pacific Edge rooms and it was $255 for a Saturday night. But worth every cent as far as location.  I started the stay off with a nice relaxing soak in the whirlpool tub in the

The Blue Lantern is a fantastic Dana Point experience! It is located on the Pacific, it is absolutely lovely inside -- spotless - decor is charming - the staff is the BEST ever and it is an absolute joy to stay there.  Make your reservation early because lots of others know how great this place is.

Summary Heading: It was ok but could have been better
Summary: We stayed at the Blue Lantern Inn for four days and we found that for the price they charge they sure cut a lot of corners.  I believe they could have offered up better food.  Pancakes and potatoes and hard boiled eggs can't be a cheaper breakfast to feed someone and it was a lot of carbs!  Oh they had muffins, cereal, and bagels too - more carbs!  they had the coffee, tea, and juice as well but to me it looked like they could have done a better breakfast for their customers and it would not break the bank.

When we booked the room we asked for a quiet room.  We were told there was a restaurant next door but it shouldn't be a problem since they were unaware of any weddings going on that weekend.  As it turned out, our "Pacific Edge" room #302 was about 100 feet from  the deck/patio of this place.  There was a VERY LOUD wedding going on, complete with booming bass and a loud d.j. enamored with his microphone.  Blue Lantern told us "there's nothing we can do."  This did not turn out to be the romantic quiet get-away weekend we had planned.  We felt we were deceived just so they could book a room.  A simple phone call from them to the restaurant and they would have been able to confirm there was a wedding that weekend.  The room was nice but had an odd smell as if it was recently

We just came back from staying four days at the Blue Lantern, with a Pacific Edge room which had a terrace overlooking the harbor and the ocean. We loved the place. Wifi in the lobby, nice breakfasts, lovely room and great location (if you drive or don't mind a challenging walk down to the harbor - we loved it). The only problem was that the linen wasn't pristine. Not dirty, just seen better days. It's something they should correct to make them really perfect. We will definitely return next time we're nearby.

We spent two nights pre-cruise out of San Pedro at the Blue Lantern and loved it, loved the service and the "continental" breakfast in the morning.  The food is served buffet style and included an egg dish each of the two days.  We also enjoyed the wine at "tea time" along with cheese and crackers.  Our overall rate for two nights with tax was $385 and it was a fair price and we'd easily do it again and again.  Our room did not have a balcony nor patio, but did have a nice view of the Dana Point harbor.  The hotel is perched right on the bluffs overlooking the harbor.  We found the hotel clean and in good repair.  The front desk was helpful and friendly and parking was readily available in the attached parking area.  There was nothing not to like from our perspective.  I'd also

My husband and I just returned from a weekend at the Blue Lantern Inn.  We had received a gift certificate for the Inn at Sonoma, which is owned by the Four Sisters Inns, but decided to use it at the Blue Lantern since we were going to be in that area. I ended up having to deal with the corporate office and it was not fun. Spent 4 wonderful nights at the Blue Lantern Inn with my Husband and Daughter. The place is situated on a high bluff overlooking Dana Point Harbor and the Pacific! You can't get better than that.  We had a very large room with fireplace, King bed and a rollaway for our Daughter. Plenty of room for the three of us.  The bathroom was oversized with a separate whirlpool bathtub and shower, 2 sinks, private toilet and a large skylight to let in all that California sun. The room was clean and very charming, but I wish they would provide fitted bottom sheets. It's very annoying when the sheet gets rumpled up and the mattress is exposed. Maid service was good and turn down service was a nice touch. We enjoyed our stay very much.

Our room was perfectly decorated and cozy with the fire place going. The warm ambiance of the lobby with all it's pleasant smells and delicious food for snacking was an enjoyable surprise. The staff was courteous and friendly and the guest rooms were impeccably kept and beautifully decorated. The bathroom is awesome - like the Grand Wailea. Breakfast in bed was wonderful and was beautifully served and delicious. I would definitely recommend the Blue Lantern Inn to others...

Stayed here recently while in California on business. Staff was friendly and helpful, rooms were large and spacious with a separate shower and whirlpool tub. Gorgeous views of Dana Point Harbor from the balcony. Breakfast was delicious. Overall, the best place I stayed during my 5 night trip to California. Can't wait to go back!

Just got back from a 3 night stay. This is a charming inn that sits on a bluff over the Dana Point Harbor, quiet, relaxing and with great views and a great staff. We spent our anniversay there in a Pacific Edge Room - worth the extra money for the patio and view. Tower Rooms are also beautiful but much more expensive. Room was very large, jacuzzi tub was great. Breakfast was juice, cereal, fruit, bagels, breads, fresh muffins, hard boiled eggs and quiche --quite tasty.
